Holycowvegan1 ID section step
Holycowvegan1 ID section step
e3a178ab-c2ec-484c-84b0-cfd0f8121e38
Coat the baking dish with some vegan butter or oil spray. Arrange the slices of bread in the casserole, overlapping them like shingles. Fill in any empty spaces with the smaller end slices.
e3a178ab-c2ec-484c-84b0-cfd0f8121e38
In a blender, place the banana, cashews, nondairy milk, cinnamon, nutmeg, sugar, flax meal, aquafaba and vanilla. Blend until smooth and creamy.
e3a178ab-c2ec-484c-84b0-cfd0f8121e38
Pour the custard over the bread evenly and set aside for 15 minutes, while you make the walnut topping.
e3a178ab-c2ec-484c-84b0-cfd0f8121e38
Set the oven to preheat to 350 degrees.
e3a178ab-c2ec-484c-84b0-cfd0f8121e38
To make the topping, place the walnuts in a bowl with the sugar, butter, cinnamon and nutmeg. Mix with your hands until the butter is dispersed through the mixture. Sprinkle it evenly on top of the casserole.
e3a178ab-c2ec-484c-84b0-cfd0f8121e38
Bake the casserole for 40 minutes. Serve the French toast with maple syrup, if desired.
ec99c156-9526-4d00-9120-58ff79b4deac
Place the cashews in a high-powered blender with 3 cups water and blitz until very smooth. If your blender is not high-powered, soak the cashews first for at least 30 minutes.
ec99c156-9526-4d00-9120-58ff79b4deac
In a food processor or a large bowl, whisk together the cashew milk, maple syrup, pumpkin puree, tofu, cinnamon, nutmeg, ginger, cloves and vanilla extract. You will need to blend the tofu separately first if you're not using a food processor in order to get it smooth.
ec99c156-9526-4d00-9120-58ff79b4deac
Spray a 9 X 12 inch baking dish with cooking spray. Arrange the cut pieces of bread in a single layer and pour over the custard evenly. Let the pudding stand at least 30 minutes, during which the bread will soak up a lot of the custard.
ec99c156-9526-4d00-9120-58ff79b4deac
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
ec99c156-9526-4d00-9120-58ff79b4deac
Just before baking, give the pudding a quick stir. Don't be too heavy-handed or you'll mush up the bread pieces.
ec99c156-9526-4d00-9120-58ff79b4deac
Bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes.
ec99c156-9526-4d00-9120-58ff79b4deac
Serve with a scoop of vanilla ice cream or whipped cream.
4b6c9bc0-9fcb-4e87-8b22-0219ff0398d1 Make the bread dough: In a large bowl or in the bowl of a stand mixer, mix the yeast with the warm water. Let stand five minutes until yeast is frothy.
4b6c9bc0-9fcb-4e87-8b22-0219ff0398d1 Make the bread dough: Add the nondairy milk, sugar or maple syrup, salt, and apple cider vinegar and mix.
4b6c9bc0-9fcb-4e87-8b22-0219ff0398d1 Make the bread dough: Add ½ cup of bread flour and all of the whole wheat flour and mix well. Gradually add the remaining bread flour, a little at a time, until you have a smooth, slightly sticky dough. Continue kneading for about 10 minutes.
4b6c9bc0-9fcb-4e87-8b22-0219ff0398d1 Make the bread dough: Form the dough into a smooth ball, place in a large bowl sprayed with oil, cover, and set in a warm place to rise for an hour or until doubled.
4b6c9bc0-9fcb-4e87-8b22-0219ff0398d1 Make the bread dough: While the dough is rising, mix together the apple filling ingredients in a bowl and set aside.
4b6c9bc0-9fcb-4e87-8b22-0219ff0398d1 Make the bread dough: Once the dough has risen, knead it to deflate, and divide into 12 portions.
4b6c9bc0-9fcb-4e87-8b22-0219ff0398d1 Make the bread dough: Roll each portion into a ball, then roll into an oval, about four inches across on the wider side.
4b6c9bc0-9fcb-4e87-8b22-0219ff0398d1 Make the bread dough: Place 2 apple slices in the center of the oval, and brush on some of the juice that the apples have expressed along with any sugar and spices. Fold the oval in half. Continue doing this for the rest of the balls of dough, and then stack them side by side, open side up, inside an oiled loaf pan.
4b6c9bc0-9fcb-4e87-8b22-0219ff0398d1 Make the bread dough: Cover with a loose kitchen towel or plastic wrap and set aside to rise in a warm place, about two hours. The dough will mushroom over the top of the pan.
4b6c9bc0-9fcb-4e87-8b22-0219ff0398d1 Make the bread dough: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees.
4b6c9bc0-9fcb-4e87-8b22-0219ff0398d1 Make the bread dough: Once the loaf is risen, brush any remaining apple juice over the top of the loaf gently, then place in the oven. Bake 10 minutes, lower heat to 350 degrees, and continue baking 45-50 minutes or until the top is golden brown.
4b6c9bc0-9fcb-4e87-8b22-0219ff0398d1 Make the bread dough: Cool on a rack, then unmold and dig in.
8e728ff4-5f1a-4848-a4a6-07d728110463
Mix the yeast with the water, almond milk and sugar in a large bowl or in the bowl of a stand mixer. Let it stand for five minutes so the yeast can flower.
8e728ff4-5f1a-4848-a4a6-07d728110463
Add the aquafaba and olive oil and mix it in. Now add 2 cups of all purpose flour and mix by hand or on medium-low speed in the mixer until everything is incorporated. Slowly, add more flour, half a cup at a time, until you get a smooth, supple dough. I needed a total of about 3 ½ cups on a humid day.
8e728ff4-5f1a-4848-a4a6-07d728110463
Continue to knead for a couple of minutes, by hand or on low speed in the stand mixer.
8e728ff4-5f1a-4848-a4a6-07d728110463
Remove the dough to a bowl sprayed with oil and set aside to rise in a warm place until doubled, about 1 hour. (I leave it in the unheated oven with the light on).
8e728ff4-5f1a-4848-a4a6-07d728110463
When the dough has doubled in size, punch it down and roll it into a rectangle on a floured surface, 15 inches in length and 9 inches in width.
8e728ff4-5f1a-4848-a4a6-07d728110463
Mix the filling ingredients in a small bowl: sugar, cinnamon and walnuts. Sprinkle them evenly over the surface of the dough.
8e728ff4-5f1a-4848-a4a6-07d728110463
Start rolling up the dough as tightly as possible along the longer seam, so you have a 15-inch cylinder.
8e728ff4-5f1a-4848-a4a6-07d728110463
Cut the roll at 1-inch intervals, making 15 individual rolls.
8e728ff4-5f1a-4848-a4a6-07d728110463
Spray a 9 X 12 inch pan with some oil. Place the rolls side by side.
8e728ff4-5f1a-4848-a4a6-07d728110463
Set the rolls aside, again in a warm place, for about 45-60 minutes.
8e728ff4-5f1a-4848-a4a6-07d728110463
A few minutes before baking, preheat the oven to 350 degrees (if your rolls are rising in the oven, be sure you take them out before you preheat!)
8e728ff4-5f1a-4848-a4a6-07d728110463
Bake the rolls for 30 minutes until golden brown. Remove and place on a rack to cool slightly before drizzling the glaze on.
8e728ff4-5f1a-4848-a4a6-07d728110463 Make the glaze: Place all ingredients in a blender with ½ cup water and blend until very smooth. Try and make the glaze at least half an hour before you glaze the cinnamon buns to let it thicken a little.
8e728ff4-5f1a-4848-a4a6-07d728110463 Make the glaze: Drizzle or brush on the glaze over still-warm rolls.
62dfe5c3-5c38-431f-81d1-5d7c63680362
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.
62dfe5c3-5c38-431f-81d1-5d7c63680362
In a bowl, whisk together the almond and whole wheat pastry flours with the baking soda, baking powder, and salt.
62dfe5c3-5c38-431f-81d1-5d7c63680362
In the bowl of a stand mixer or in any large bowl, mix the sugar with the oil, flax eggs, apple sauce, vanilla extract, and orange juice. Mix or whisk well.
62dfe5c3-5c38-431f-81d1-5d7c63680362
Add half the dry ingredients to the wet in two batches, mixing after every addition until the dry ingredients are thoroughly incorporated.
62dfe5c3-5c38-431f-81d1-5d7c63680362
Prepare a standard 9 by 5 inch loaf pan by spraying or coating with cooking spray or oil.
62dfe5c3-5c38-431f-81d1-5d7c63680362
Pour in the batter and even out the top with a spatula.
62dfe5c3-5c38-431f-81d1-5d7c63680362
Bake in the preheated oven for 50-55 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out dry or with crumbs (not wet batter) sticking to it.
62dfe5c3-5c38-431f-81d1-5d7c63680362
Cool the loaf in the pan for about 30 minutes. Then slide out of the loaf pan (run a knife or spatula along the sides to help it along, if necessary) and place on a rack.
62dfe5c3-5c38-431f-81d1-5d7c63680362
Make the marmalade glaze: In a small saucepan, heat the marmalade and the orange juice until the marmalade is warm and a little runny. Brush or spoon over the top of the loaf.
62dfe5c3-5c38-431f-81d1-5d7c63680362
Sprinkle on some chopped almonds for garnish.
02057c3d-0ef9-4ec3-8dab-bba66110bb25
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit. Oil and flour a a 9 X 5 loaf pan.
02057c3d-0ef9-4ec3-8dab-bba66110bb25
Mix the streusel ingredients until the mixture resembles large breadcrumbs. Set aside.
02057c3d-0ef9-4ec3-8dab-bba66110bb25
Mix the apple cider vinegar and almond milk and set aside for a couple of minutes to curdle.
02057c3d-0ef9-4ec3-8dab-bba66110bb25
In a bowl, mix the flour with the baking powder, baking soda, flaxmeal, salt and sugar.
02057c3d-0ef9-4ec3-8dab-bba66110bb25
In a larger bowl, whisk together the applesauce, nondairy milk, butter and vanilla extract.
02057c3d-0ef9-4ec3-8dab-bba66110bb25
Add the dry ingredients to the wet in two batches, mixing thoroughly with a spatula after each addition.
02057c3d-0ef9-4ec3-8dab-bba66110bb25
Fold in the cranberries and walnuts, if using.
02057c3d-0ef9-4ec3-8dab-bba66110bb25
Scrape the batter into the loaf pan and smooth the top with the spatula. Sprinkle the streusel on evenly.
02057c3d-0ef9-4ec3-8dab-bba66110bb25
Place in the preheated oven and bake 1 hour and 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
02057c3d-0ef9-4ec3-8dab-bba66110bb25
Cool thoroughly on a rack before unmolding. Slice and serve.
f077681b-53b5-46fe-80a2-44801675f150
Make the bechamel sauce by heating the oil. Add the leeks and garlic, season with salt and pepper, and saute, stirring, until the leeks are soft, about five minutes.
f077681b-53b5-46fe-80a2-44801675f150
Add the sausage and herbs and continue to stir-fry about two or three minutes. Add the flour, mix well, and stir-fry another two minutes.
f077681b-53b5-46fe-80a2-44801675f150
Add half the cashew milk and stir into the sausage mixture until it begins to thicken. Add the remaining cashew milk and mix well. Bring the sauce to a boil over medium heat and turn off.
f077681b-53b5-46fe-80a2-44801675f150 Assemble the lasagna: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.
f077681b-53b5-46fe-80a2-44801675f150 Assemble the lasagna: Spread a couple of ladles of the bechamel sauce on the bottom of a 12 X 8 inch baking pan, then layer five noodles over the sauce to cover the bottom of the pan.
f077681b-53b5-46fe-80a2-44801675f150 Assemble the lasagna: Spread half of the chopped spinach over the noodles, then spread a third of the remaining bechamel on top of the spinach. Sprinkle a third of the cheese and a third of the scallions on top, then layer on another five noodles.
f077681b-53b5-46fe-80a2-44801675f150 Assemble the lasagna: Repeat with the other half of the spinach, a third of the bechamel, a third of cheese and a third of scallions and layer on the last five noodles.
f077681b-53b5-46fe-80a2-44801675f150 Assemble the lasagna: Ladle on the remaining bechamel on top of the noodles, sprinkle on the remaining scallions and cheese, and cover with aluminum foil. If you plan on baking this the next day, you can cover tightly with cling wrap at this time and refrigerate overnight. The next day, before baking, remove the cling wrap and replace with foil.
f077681b-53b5-46fe-80a2-44801675f150 Assemble the lasagna: Bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes, then remove the foil cover and continue baking another 15 minutes until golden on top.
f077681b-53b5-46fe-80a2-44801675f150 Assemble the lasagna: Let stand for five minutes, then cut and serve.
02356c93-dd62-4a77-8dfe-c0d4cc8ac251
Make the cheesy sauce by combining all ingredients and blending into a really smooth paste. Set aside.
02356c93-dd62-4a77-8dfe-c0d4cc8ac251
Place the diced potatoes in a microwave-safe dish and add 1 tbsp water. Cover and nuke on high for five minutes or until potatoes are tender.
02356c93-dd62-4a77-8dfe-c0d4cc8ac251
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
02356c93-dd62-4a77-8dfe-c0d4cc8ac251
In a large skillet, heat the oil. You can do this in a 10-inch cast-iron skillet or any skillet that can go from the stove to the oven, to reduce cleanup.
02356c93-dd62-4a77-8dfe-c0d4cc8ac251
Add the onions, garlic and parsley to the oil. Season with salt and ground black pepper and saute, stirring, for five minutes over medium heat or until the onions are soft.
02356c93-dd62-4a77-8dfe-c0d4cc8ac251
Add the sausage and potatoes and continue to cook, about five minutes. Check seasoning and add more pepper and salt if needed.
02356c93-dd62-4a77-8dfe-c0d4cc8ac251
If you are using a cast iron or a stove-to-oven skillet, arrange the potato mixture in an even layer and pour the cheesy sauce over it evenly. If using a baking dish, like I did, transfer the potato sausage mixture to the baking dish and pour the cheesy sauce on top.
02356c93-dd62-4a77-8dfe-c0d4cc8ac251
Transfer the skillet or baking dish to the oven and bake 30 minutes or until the top starts to lightly brown. Switch to the broil function on your oven and broil for another five minutes on the highest setting, or until gold-brown spots appear on the potatoes and cheesy sauce.
02356c93-dd62-4a77-8dfe-c0d4cc8ac251
Remove from the oven, garnish with more parsley if you wish, and serve hot or at room temperature.
1e4d7d82-b814-4116-863f-a624cf7865b6
Heat the oil in a skillet. Add the garlic and saute 30 seconds until fragrant, then add the yellow squash. Season with salt and pepper and saute for about two to three minutes until the squash starts to soften.
1e4d7d82-b814-4116-863f-a624cf7865b6
Add the rice and herbs to the skillet and stir to mix everything. Add the coconut milk, let it cook until the liquid begins to bubble at the corners, then place a tight lid on the skillet and cook 20 minutes without disturbing.
1e4d7d82-b814-4116-863f-a624cf7865b6
While the rice is cooking, preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Also blend the cashews with 1 ½ cups water (or, for a creamier consistency, you can also use any nondairy milk)
1e4d7d82-b814-4116-863f-a624cf7865b6
Once the rice is done, stir in the herbs along with the cashew cream and add more salt and ground black pepper if you wish. If you are using a baking dish, at this point transfer the whole thing into the baking dish.
1e4d7d82-b814-4116-863f-a624cf7865b6
Cover tightly with aluminum foil (or an oven-safe lid) and bake 20 minutes. Then remove the foil or lid and continue cooking another 15 minutes.
1e4d7d82-b814-4116-863f-a624cf7865b6
Serve hot or warm.
06cc52ce-70c3-4c78-9774-37c542d8bace
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F
06cc52ce-70c3-4c78-9774-37c542d8bace
Heat the oil and add the onions and garlic along with some salt and ground black pepper. Saute for a couple of minutes until the onion start to brown.
06cc52ce-70c3-4c78-9774-37c542d8bace
Add the thyme and vegan sausage and continue to saute a couple more minutes. Add the hash browns and stir to mix.
06cc52ce-70c3-4c78-9774-37c542d8bace
Turn off the heat and stir in the cream of mushroom soup and the mozzarella shreds. Reserve some of the mozzarella shreds to sprinkle over the top, if you wish. Before you sprinkle the mozzarella over the top, make sure you check for seasoning and add more salt and pepper to your taste. (If you aren't using a cast-iron skillet, coat a 9 X 12 baking dish with cooking spray and turn the mixture into the dish, then sprinkle the remaining mozzarella over the top.)
06cc52ce-70c3-4c78-9774-37c542d8bace
Place the skillet or the baking dish into the oven and bake 45 minutes until the cheese is all bubbly and golden.
06cc52ce-70c3-4c78-9774-37c542d8bace
Remove from the oven and serve hot.
3324f654-67d3-41cb-a343-340f9465081d
Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Bake the croissants, cut side down, for five minutes. Remove from the oven and set aside.
3324f654-67d3-41cb-a343-340f9465081d
Heat the oil. Add the garlic and saute for a few seconds, then add the vegan sausage. Stir-fry for a couple of minutes until the sausage starts to brown. Add the zucchini and bell peppers and the oregano or thyme. Season with pepper and salt and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until they soften a little. Turn off the heat.
3324f654-67d3-41cb-a343-340f9465081d
Place the cashews in a blender with 4 cups of water and process into a very smooth milk. If you are using a nondairy milk, you can add the milk directly to the blender. Add the onion flakes, garlic powder, nutritional yeast, nutmeg, and salt and ground black pepper. Mix.
3324f654-67d3-41cb-a343-340f9465081d
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
3324f654-67d3-41cb-a343-340f9465081d
Butter or oil a baking dish (I used an oval baking dish that's roughly 12 X 9 inches and 3 inches deep and it was the perfect size for this dish).
3324f654-67d3-41cb-a343-340f9465081d
Place the croissants in the baking dish. I lay some down and make the others stand. It may be a little crowded but that's okay. Scatter on the vegan cheese, reserving some to sprinkle on the top.
3324f654-67d3-41cb-a343-340f9465081d
Spread the cooked sausage and veggies evenly over the croissants and cheese.
3324f654-67d3-41cb-a343-340f9465081d
Now pour in the cheesy cashew milk evenly. Press down on the croissants with a ladle to submerge them so they soak up all that cheesy milk. You can either bake this rightaway, or, for the best results, let it stand at least 15 minutes before baking. I like to slide a baking sheet under the dish to make it easy to take it in and out of the oven.
3324f654-67d3-41cb-a343-340f9465081d
Bake 45 minutes until the casserole is golden and bubbly.
3324f654-67d3-41cb-a343-340f9465081d
Let stand 5-10 minutes, then serve!
57d9e88b-432e-4ea4-b420-e62c131b2f6a
In a skillet, heat 1 tsp olive oil. Add the garlic, sauté for a few seconds. Don't let it brown. Add the zucchini, tomatoes and onions. Season with ground black pepper and Italian seasoning. Saute for five minutes or until zucchini is soft but not mushy. If there is liquid in the pan, cook over high heat for a few minutes until most of it has evaporated. Turn off the heat.
57d9e88b-432e-4ea4-b420-e62c131b2f6a
While the zucchini is cooking, place the soaked, drained cashews in a blender along with 2 cups water, basil, lemon juice, salt and jalapeno. Add salt to taste and blend until very smooth.
57d9e88b-432e-4ea4-b420-e62c131b2f6a
Make the mashed potatoes by mashing together the boiled, peeled potatoes with the remaining 1 tbsp of extra virgin olive oil, salt, sage, and lemon zest.
57d9e88b-432e-4ea4-b420-e62c131b2f6a
In a large bowl, mix the zucchini-tomato mixture, bread, and half the mashed potatoes.
57d9e88b-432e-4ea4-b420-e62c131b2f6a
Place them in a 9 X 12 inch baking dish and spread evenly.
57d9e88b-432e-4ea4-b420-e62c131b2f6a
Pour on the basil cream evenly, and toss or press down slightly to make sure the bread cubes are immersed in the cream.
57d9e88b-432e-4ea4-b420-e62c131b2f6a
Scatter on the remaining mashed potatoes over the casserole.
57d9e88b-432e-4ea4-b420-e62c131b2f6a
Cover tightly with a cling wrap and place in the refrigerator overnight for the flavors to merge and for the bread to get thoroughly soaked.
57d9e88b-432e-4ea4-b420-e62c131b2f6a
When you're ready to bake, preheat the oven to 350 degrees
57d9e88b-432e-4ea4-b420-e62c131b2f6a
Place the baking dish in the oven and cook 40 minutes.
57d9e88b-432e-4ea4-b420-e62c131b2f6a
After 40 minutes, turn on the custom broil to 450 degrees. Broil for 8-10 minutes or until the tops of the bread and mashed potatoes turn golden brown.
57d9e88b-432e-4ea4-b420-e62c131b2f6a
Remove from the oven, garnish with basil, let stand about 10 minutes. Then scoop out and serve hot.
f1123fa1-fd04-4079-b112-116b7063dfb7
Set the Instant Pot to the saute function, add the oil and when it heats up, add the shallots or leeks, celery, carrots and garlic with some salt and ground black pepper. Saute, stirring frequently, a couple of minutes until the onions begin to soften.
f1123fa1-fd04-4079-b112-116b7063dfb7
Add the rosemary and potatoes with the vegan sausage, making sure you crumble the sausage into little bits or run it once through the food processor before adding. Mix well, and add the beans and 3 cups of vegetable stock.
f1123fa1-fd04-4079-b112-116b7063dfb7
Cover the Instant Pot and set it to the "chili" function, which is 30 minutes of pressure cooking time. At the end of cooking, you can either wait for the pressure to release, or release it manually after 10 minutes.
f1123fa1-fd04-4079-b112-116b7063dfb7
Place the cashews in a blender with the remaining ½ cup of vegetable stock. Blitz into a smooth cream.
f1123fa1-fd04-4079-b112-116b7063dfb7
Put the IP back at the saute function, add the cashew cream, and let it warm through. Check at this time if you need more ground black pepper.
f1123fa1-fd04-4079-b112-116b7063dfb7
The filling should be pretty thick, but if you want to thin it out, add more stock.
f1123fa1-fd04-4079-b112-116b7063dfb7
Make the puff pastry topping by first preheating your oven to 375 degrees. Unroll the puff pastry sheet and cut it into pretty shapes using a cookie cutter. You can make one large disc that will sit on top of your ramekin, or smaller shapes, like the hearts I made.
f1123fa1-fd04-4079-b112-116b7063dfb7
Place the puff pastry shapes on a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven 15 minutes or until golden and puffy.
f1123fa1-fd04-4079-b112-116b7063dfb7
Ladle the pot pie filling into ramekins, top with the puff pastry, and serve piping hot.
fbaffe23-6851-4079-9d39-d1171ee07632
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
fbaffe23-6851-4079-9d39-d1171ee07632
In a cast-iron or other skillet, heat the olive oil. Add the garlic and onions and season with salt and pepper. Saute until the onions turn soft.
fbaffe23-6851-4079-9d39-d1171ee07632
Add the asparagus and sage or mint, saute for 2-3 minutes, then add the chorizo and continue to cook, stirring frequently, for another five minutes. Turn off heat.
fbaffe23-6851-4079-9d39-d1171ee07632
Place the cashews, tofu, garlic powder, salt and ground black pepper to taste in a blender along with ½ cup water. Blend until very smooth.
fbaffe23-6851-4079-9d39-d1171ee07632
Pour the tofu into the chorizo mixture and mix well. You can simply bake the quiche in the cast iron skillet (or any oven-safe skillet) at this point, or pour it into a pie or tart plate.
fbaffe23-6851-4079-9d39-d1171ee07632
Bake for 40 minutes. Let it stand 10 minutes, then serve.
f8aa435f-7a7b-46f6-90d0-9a6ff12dbc4a
Mix the yeast, sugar and water in a large bowl or in the bowl of a stand mixer and let it stand five minutes or until the yeast is frothy and bubbly.
f8aa435f-7a7b-46f6-90d0-9a6ff12dbc4a
Add the orange juice, aquafaba, oil, flour and salt and 2 cups of flour and mix until the dough comes together. Continue to add flour, ¼ cup at a time, until you have a smooth, pliable dough that doesn't stick. Continue to knead a couple more minutes.
f8aa435f-7a7b-46f6-90d0-9a6ff12dbc4a
Form the dough into a smooth ball and place in an oiled bowl, turning the dough over once to ensure it is coated with oil. Cover tightly with cling wrap and set aside in a refrigerator overnight. If you want to make the rolls the same day, set the dough to rise in a warm place for 1-2 hours or until doubled.
f8aa435f-7a7b-46f6-90d0-9a6ff12dbc4a
In the morning, or when ready to shape the rolls, punch down the dough and roll into a rectangle 12 inches long and six inches wide.
f8aa435f-7a7b-46f6-90d0-9a6ff12dbc4a
Spread the orange marmalade for the filling on the surface of the dough. Starting along the long seam, roll the dough as tightly as possible until you have a cylinder 12 inches in length.
f8aa435f-7a7b-46f6-90d0-9a6ff12dbc4a
Cut the dough into 10-12 pieces, equal in size if possible.
f8aa435f-7a7b-46f6-90d0-9a6ff12dbc4a
Place each roll, cut side up, in a 10-inch round or square pan. I used an 8-inch cake pan and things were a bit tight in there which made the rolls rise rather high, but you can use an 9-inch pan if that's your only option. A 10-inch cast-iron skillet would work well too.
f8aa435f-7a7b-46f6-90d0-9a6ff12dbc4a
Cover the rolls with cling wrap or a kitchen towel and set aside to rise in a warm place for an hour until they are puffy and risen.
f8aa435f-7a7b-46f6-90d0-9a6ff12dbc4a
About 20 minutes before baking, preheat your oven to 350 degrees.
f8aa435f-7a7b-46f6-90d0-9a6ff12dbc4a
To bake, place the orange rolls in the oven and bake for 28-30 minutes or until browned on top.
f8aa435f-7a7b-46f6-90d0-9a6ff12dbc4a Make the glaze: Mix all the glaze ingredients with a whisk. If using vegan butter, make sure you melt it first.
f8aa435f-7a7b-46f6-90d0-9a6ff12dbc4a Make the glaze: Drizzle the glaze over the rolls and serve warm.
b84a0d87-4b95-496a-bff3-e8820d2a92b1
Place the raw cashews in a high-powered blender with ¾ cup of water and blitz until very smooth.
b84a0d87-4b95-496a-bff3-e8820d2a92b1
Place the potatoes in a microwave-safe bowl and cover with water. Cover with a microwave-safe lid or dish and zap 10-15 minutes on high or until a knife inserted in the center of a potato goes cleanly through. Since different microwaves work differently, I'd recommend starting out with 10 minutes and adding more time if needed.
b84a0d87-4b95-496a-bff3-e8820d2a92b1
When the potatoes are cooked, take the bowl out of the microwave, being very careful not to burn yourself by spilling the hot water, and drain the potatoes. When cool enough to handle, peel and mash with a potato masher.
b84a0d87-4b95-496a-bff3-e8820d2a92b1
Add the melted butter, salt and ground black pepper to taste, and half the cashew cream. Mix well, then, using a handheld mixer, whip the potatoes for about two minutes, stopping frequently to mix with a spatula. If doing this in a stand mixer, use the whisk attachment. Add more of the cashew cream as you mix, until you get the consistency you like.
b84a0d87-4b95-496a-bff3-e8820d2a92b1
Check seasoning and add more salt and ground black pepper if needed. Scrape into a bowl and season with chives or parsley.
b84a0d87-4b95-496a-bff3-e8820d2a92b1
Serve with mushroom gravy (link in recipe notes below)
20c7b67a-c422-454d-aee6-e7b58d156b27
Heat the oil and add the onions or shallots. Season with salt and ground black pepper to taste. Cook, stirring frequently, over medium heat until the onions caramelize and turn golden-brown.
20c7b67a-c422-454d-aee6-e7b58d156b27
Add the mushrooms with the apple cider vinegar and cook, stirring frequently, until the moisture has evaporated.
20c7b67a-c422-454d-aee6-e7b58d156b27
Add the flour and cook, stirring, 2-3 minutes, until the flour is completely absorbed by the veggies.
20c7b67a-c422-454d-aee6-e7b58d156b27
Add two cups of the stock, whisking as you add it, until you have a smooth sauce. Add the remaining stock, continuing to whisk.
20c7b67a-c422-454d-aee6-e7b58d156b27
Stir, add the soy sauce and sage, and continue to cook for another 15-20 minutes over high heat or until the gravy is reduced by almost half and is thick and creamy. Stir in the cashew cream if using
20c7b67a-c422-454d-aee6-e7b58d156b27
Turn off the heat and, at this point, you can strain the sauce for serving. Or, if you'd rather, serve it as is. The bits of mushroom and onion in the gravy are delicious.
853dfa77-4c9b-4ff6-b702-d75eb50ba882
Bring a large pot of salted water to boil while you prep the green beans. When the water boils, add the green beans, wait six minutes, then drain the beans and reserve.
853dfa77-4c9b-4ff6-b702-d75eb50ba882
While the beans cook, place the cashews, almond milk, chipotle pepper, 1 tbsp of fried onions and salt in a blender. Blitz until smooth.
853dfa77-4c9b-4ff6-b702-d75eb50ba882
Place the green beans in a bowl and drizzle the chipotle sauce over it. Mix well and garnish with remaining fried onions. Serve.
25153ece-c86f-4ac4-bd04-4e0d3b9ff164
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
25153ece-c86f-4ac4-bd04-4e0d3b9ff164
Mix the nondairy milk and the vinegar and set aside.
25153ece-c86f-4ac4-bd04-4e0d3b9ff164
Place the flour, salt, sugar, baking powder and baking soda in a bowl and whisk them together to mix.
25153ece-c86f-4ac4-bd04-4e0d3b9ff164
Add the cubes of butter and using a pastry cutter or a fork, cut the butter into the flour until the mixture is grainy with a few pea-size pieces of butter.
25153ece-c86f-4ac4-bd04-4e0d3b9ff164
Add the milk-vinegar mixture, a little at a time, stirring with a fork to ensure everything mixes. Don't overmix because you don't want to promote the formation of gluten which will make your biscuits hard rather than crumbly and flaky.
25153ece-c86f-4ac4-bd04-4e0d3b9ff164
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Using an ice cream scoop, or with a spoon, scoop out the batter in mounds on the baking sheet to make eight biscuits. You can also make 10 smaller biscuits. Make sure there's at least an inch of space between the biscuits.
25153ece-c86f-4ac4-bd04-4e0d3b9ff164
Bake for 20 minutes or until the tops are golden brown and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
25153ece-c86f-4ac4-bd04-4e0d3b9ff164
Cool on a rack for five minutes, then serve hot or warm.
ad6662f1-0920-46f7-a50d-be48b7cf9197
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.
ad6662f1-0920-46f7-a50d-be48b7cf9197
Place the bread cubes on a baking sheet. Sprinkle on some salt and pepper and the ½ tsp each of sage and thyme. Spray with cooking spray and toss well to mix. Bake for 10 minutes or until the bread is quite dry.
ad6662f1-0920-46f7-a50d-be48b7cf9197
On another baking sheet place the tater tots and bake them also for 10 minutes or until they are almost crisped up all the way but not quite.
ad6662f1-0920-46f7-a50d-be48b7cf9197
In a skillet, heat the oil. Use a cast-iron skillet if you have one that can go from the stovetop into the oven.
ad6662f1-0920-46f7-a50d-be48b7cf9197
Add the carrots, celery, onions and garlic. Season with salt and pepper and saute until the veggies turn very soft, about 10 minutes.
ad6662f1-0920-46f7-a50d-be48b7cf9197
Add the fresh herbs and mix them in. Add the vegetable stock and then the bread cubes and stir well to mix. Check seasoning and add more salt and pepper if needed.
ad6662f1-0920-46f7-a50d-be48b7cf9197
If you're not using an oven-safe skillet, transfer the stuffing to a casserole or baking dish. Cover with aluminum foil and bake 20 minutes.
ad6662f1-0920-46f7-a50d-be48b7cf9197
Remove the skillet or baking dish from the oven and stir in the tater tots. Increase oven temperature to 425 degrees.
ad6662f1-0920-46f7-a50d-be48b7cf9197
Place the skillet back in the oven for another 15 minutes, uncovered, or until the tater tots are crunchy.
ad6662f1-0920-46f7-a50d-be48b7cf9197
Remove from the oven and let stand at least 10 minutes before serving. Handle hot skillets with care.
e8152448-7c53-4154-9001-5285b9f1ac9c
Make the breadcrumb mixture by placing the breadcrumbs with the parsley, cheeze if using, and the salt and pepper with ½ tbsp oil in the food processor or a bowl and mixing well.
e8152448-7c53-4154-9001-5285b9f1ac9c
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
e8152448-7c53-4154-9001-5285b9f1ac9c
Heat 1 tbsp of the oil in a skillet (use an oven-proof skillet for a one-pot dish). Add the onions and garlic with some salt and pepper and saute, stirring frequently, until the onion is soft.
e8152448-7c53-4154-9001-5285b9f1ac9c
Add the cubed butternut squash along with the rosemary and the nutmeg. Cook, stirring frequently, about 7-8 minutes or until the squash is quite tender. You can cover the skillet to speed this, but check frequently to ensure nothing's sticking to the bottom of the pan. Season with salt and pepper as needed.
e8152448-7c53-4154-9001-5285b9f1ac9c
Prep a baking dish, if using one, by coating it with a thin layer of oil. Once the squash is cooked, ladle it out into the baking dish in an even layer.
e8152448-7c53-4154-9001-5285b9f1ac9c
Pour the coconut milk evenly over the squash cubes. Then top evenly with the breadcrumb mixture.
e8152448-7c53-4154-9001-5285b9f1ac9c
Bake the gratin until it is bubbling and the top is lightly golden. Serve hot or warm.
4be3b994-8bed-4b9f-8855-b5239b3b07e2
Place the sweet potatoes on a baking sheet. Sprinkle with salt and ground black pepper and coat with a teaspoon of the olive oil.
4be3b994-8bed-4b9f-8855-b5239b3b07e2
Bake in a preheated 450-degree Fahrenheit oven for 40 minutes. Remove and set aside to cool.
4be3b994-8bed-4b9f-8855-b5239b3b07e2
Heat the remaining teaspoon of oil in a saucepan. Add the onions and garlic and ginger. Sprinkle some salt. Saute over medium heat until the onions turn translucent, about four to five minutes.
4be3b994-8bed-4b9f-8855-b5239b3b07e2
Add the cayenne and garam masala. Stir to coat the onions, then add the chopped kale and cook, stirring, 2-3 minutes or until the kale has wilted and is tender.
4be3b994-8bed-4b9f-8855-b5239b3b07e2
Add the coriander leaves and lemon juice, mix well, then turn off the heat. Check seasoning and add more salt if needed.
4be3b994-8bed-4b9f-8855-b5239b3b07e2
Cut each sweet potato down the middle, lengthwise. Scoop out half of the flesh with a spoon and place in a bowl. Mash the sweet potato mixture, then add the cooked kale mixture to it and mix well.
4be3b994-8bed-4b9f-8855-b5239b3b07e2
Scoop back the mashed sweet potato and kale mixture into each of the sweet potato halves.
4be3b994-8bed-4b9f-8855-b5239b3b07e2
Place the sweet potato skins back on the baking sheet and bake in a preheated 450-degree oven for 15 minutes for the skins to crisp up.
4be3b994-8bed-4b9f-8855-b5239b3b07e2
Serve hot, drizzled with some cinnamon cream. To make the cinnamon cashew cream, place all the ingredients in a blender and whiz until you have a really smooth cream.
fdd4eb82-cf41-4100-a6a2-b5a25b03b930
Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Make the pecan topping by mixing the ingredients together until crumbly.
fdd4eb82-cf41-4100-a6a2-b5a25b03b930
Make the sauce by heating the oil. Add the garlic and fresh herbs and saute for a few seconds, then add the flour and continue to cook until the flour is well mixed into the oil and forms small crumbs.
fdd4eb82-cf41-4100-a6a2-b5a25b03b930
Add a cup of the nondairy milk, using a whisk to mix so lumps don't form. Add the remaining milk and whisk it in as well. Add the nutmeg, salt, and ground black pepper to taste and bring to a boil. The sauce should thicken. Turn off the heat and add the orange juice.
fdd4eb82-cf41-4100-a6a2-b5a25b03b930
Spray a casserole or baking dish with cooking spray. Shingle in half the sweet potato slices in a decorative pattern -- I like making concentric circles. Pour half the creamy sauce over the sweet potatoes, using a ladle.
fdd4eb82-cf41-4100-a6a2-b5a25b03b930
Shingle on the remaining sweet potato slices and pour the remaining sauce evenly over them.
fdd4eb82-cf41-4100-a6a2-b5a25b03b930
Cover with aluminum foil, place on a baking sheet, and bake for 35 minutes.
fdd4eb82-cf41-4100-a6a2-b5a25b03b930
Remove the foil, scatter the pecan topping over the sweet potatoes, and continue baking, uncovered, for another 25 minutes.
fdd4eb82-cf41-4100-a6a2-b5a25b03b930
Let the scalloped potatoes stand on a rack at least 30 minutes before serving.
fef27d73-cc33-46e1-9eea-13feef770f73
Preheat the oven to 450 degrees.
fef27d73-cc33-46e1-9eea-13feef770f73
In a very large bowl, mix 1 cup of the nondairy milk, rosemary, garlic, salt and ground black pepper to taste. Toss the sliced potatoes gently in the mixture to coat.
fef27d73-cc33-46e1-9eea-13feef770f73
To make the bechamel, heat the olive oil.
fef27d73-cc33-46e1-9eea-13feef770f73
Add the spring onions with a pinch of salt and ground black pepper. Cook, stirring, a couple of minutes.
fef27d73-cc33-46e1-9eea-13feef770f73
Add the all-purpose flour and cook the flour over medium-low heat, scraping it up if it starts to stick, about a minute.
fef27d73-cc33-46e1-9eea-13feef770f73
Add the remaining nondairy milk slowly, whisking with a wire whisk as you pour it in. Whisking will prevent any lumps from forming and you'll have a smooth, silken bechamel.
fef27d73-cc33-46e1-9eea-13feef770f73
Add the nutmeg and more salt and black pepper to taste.
fef27d73-cc33-46e1-9eea-13feef770f73
Stir frequently over medium heat until the mixture reaches a simmer and the sauce is thick enough to coat the back of a spoon.
fef27d73-cc33-46e1-9eea-13feef770f73
Turn off the heat.
fef27d73-cc33-46e1-9eea-13feef770f73
Brush or spray a 9-inch oval or square baking dish with extra-virgin olive oil. Pour any of the milk flavored with rosemary and garlic that hasn't been absorbed by the potatoes into the dish.
fef27d73-cc33-46e1-9eea-13feef770f73
Arrange the potatoes in the dish, making them stand, until the potatoes are tightly packed in.
fef27d73-cc33-46e1-9eea-13feef770f73
Now pour the bechamel over the potatoes evenly, holding back about ½ a cup.
fef27d73-cc33-46e1-9eea-13feef770f73
Cover the baking dish with aluminum foil. Place on a foil-lined baking sheet to catch any drips.
fef27d73-cc33-46e1-9eea-13feef770f73
Bake for an hour, then remove the aluminum foil from the baking dish. Pour the remaining bechamel over the potatoes and continue to bake another 30 minutes until golden and bubbly.
fef27d73-cc33-46e1-9eea-13feef770f73
Remove, let cool for 15 minutes, then serve garnished with more spring onions, if desired.
a07a7a0c-d6f6-4f24-bb93-3a2f5b80847d
Place the wild rice in a saucepan with 4 cups water. Bring to a boil, lower heat to a simmer, cover and cook 45 minutes. Drain.
a07a7a0c-d6f6-4f24-bb93-3a2f5b80847d
If using dry mushrooms, soak them in 2 cups hot or boiling water for at least 30 minutes. Drain and reserve the stock.
a07a7a0c-d6f6-4f24-bb93-3a2f5b80847d
Blend the cashews with ½ cup vegetable stock into a very smooth paste.
a07a7a0c-d6f6-4f24-bb93-3a2f5b80847d
Heat the oil in a saucepan. Add the onions, garlic and celery. Season with salt and pepper and saute until soft and translucent.
a07a7a0c-d6f6-4f24-bb93-3a2f5b80847d
Add the mushrooms with the wine. Cook until the wine has evaporated, stirring frequently.
a07a7a0c-d6f6-4f24-bb93-3a2f5b80847d
Add the herbs and the vegetable stock and the reserved mushroom stock. Bring to a boil, cover and cook 10 minutes.
a07a7a0c-d6f6-4f24-bb93-3a2f5b80847d
Remove half the soup to a blender and blend until smooth. You can blend up to ¾th if you want less texture in the soup.
a07a7a0c-d6f6-4f24-bb93-3a2f5b80847d
Return the blended soup to the pot with the rest, add the drained wild rice, and cook another five minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Stir in the cashew cream, warm through, and serve hot.
00e3f595-0b7a-4656-8b88-4b08b0f1d2d1
Preheat the oven to 425 degrees.
00e3f595-0b7a-4656-8b88-4b08b0f1d2d1
Place the oil, maple syrup, hot sauce and salt in a small saucepan and bring to a boil.
00e3f595-0b7a-4656-8b88-4b08b0f1d2d1
Place the delicata squash in a baking dish, cut side down.
00e3f595-0b7a-4656-8b88-4b08b0f1d2d1
Nestle the rosemary sprigs and the garlic within the sliced squash.
00e3f595-0b7a-4656-8b88-4b08b0f1d2d1
Brush on some of the maple syrup-chili glaze.
00e3f595-0b7a-4656-8b88-4b08b0f1d2d1
Place the baking dish in the oven and bake 15 minutes. Remove, baste with more of the glaze, and bake again for 15 more minutes. Baste again and repeat for another 15 minutes.
00e3f595-0b7a-4656-8b88-4b08b0f1d2d1
Serve warm or at room temperature.
dcfbdc80-1616-4282-ac70-2220b29f0d9f
Mix 1 tsp of the oil, garlic and rosemary and set aside for 15-30 minutes.
dcfbdc80-1616-4282-ac70-2220b29f0d9f
In a bowl,mix the remaining oil, Brussels sprouts, salt and pepper. Spread the sprouts on a baking sheet in a single layer.
dcfbdc80-1616-4282-ac70-2220b29f0d9f
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Roast the Brussels sprouts for 35 minutes. About 15 minutes into the baking, sprinkle the oil-infused garlic and rosemary over the sprouts and stir slightly to mix. Continue roasting.
dcfbdc80-1616-4282-ac70-2220b29f0d9f
Serve hot or cold. These are so delicious, I pop them into my mouth like candy.
ff18e5f7-f352-4330-a3ae-6d07db4dd1b8
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees.
ff18e5f7-f352-4330-a3ae-6d07db4dd1b8
Place the potatoes in a baking dish large enough to hold them in a single layer.
ff18e5f7-f352-4330-a3ae-6d07db4dd1b8
Add the lemon juice and zest, garlic, vegetable stock, olive oil, salt and ground black pepper and oregano and mix everything.
ff18e5f7-f352-4330-a3ae-6d07db4dd1b8
Place the baking dish in the oven and bake for 1 hour and 15 minutes. About halfway through, turn the potatoes once with a spatula to make sure they roast evenly. Continue roasting until all the potatoes are slightly crispy and fork-tender and the stock has evaporated.
ff18e5f7-f352-4330-a3ae-6d07db4dd1b8
Serve hot or at room temperature.
0284c4c6-2dcc-4ba4-8d38-107e200f4448
Blend the cashews with 1 cup of the vegetable stock and set aside.
0284c4c6-2dcc-4ba4-8d38-107e200f4448
In a saucepan, heat the oil or vegetable stock. Add the onions and garlic along with a pinch of salt and ground black pepper. Saute, stirring frequently, until the onions turn translucent but do not brown. It is important that you cut the onions really fine so they just melt into the soup.
0284c4c6-2dcc-4ba4-8d38-107e200f4448
Add the mushrooms. At this stage you can add a splosh of white wine for more flavor, if you wish. Saute the mushrooms over medium-high heat until they are tender, about 5-8 minutes.
0284c4c6-2dcc-4ba4-8d38-107e200f4448
Add the thyme or sage, stir to mix, and then add the all purpose flour or rice flour. Mix well and let the flour cook for a couple of minutes, stirring frequently to let it cook evenly.
0284c4c6-2dcc-4ba4-8d38-107e200f4448
Add a cup of the vegetable stock, stirring vigorously as you do so to avoid any lumps from forming. You can also use a whisk to mix at this stage. Add one more cup of stock, continuing to stir, and when it comes to a boil, stir in the blended cashew milk.
0284c4c6-2dcc-4ba4-8d38-107e200f4448
Once the soup comes to a boil, you can thin out with more stock to get it to the consistency you like. Check for seasoning and add more salt and pepper as needed. You can also add a tablespoon of soy sauce for more flavor, unless you want to be soy-free.
0284c4c6-2dcc-4ba4-8d38-107e200f4448
When the soup comes to a boil, stir, and turn off. Serve hot.
4a31bb69-8b3b-44c9-b0a4-641ad88a2616
Preheat oven to 425 degrees F.
4a31bb69-8b3b-44c9-b0a4-641ad88a2616
Heat oil in a large skillet. Add the onions and garlic and season with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring, until onions are softened.
4a31bb69-8b3b-44c9-b0a4-641ad88a2616
Add the beefless beef, stir to mix, then add the artichoke hearts and the thyme and continue to cook another 5-10 minutes until the artichokes are just tender. Check seasoning and turn off heat.
4a31bb69-8b3b-44c9-b0a4-641ad88a2616
Place the cashews in the blender with garlic powder, salt and ground black pepper to taste and 2 cups water. Blend until smooth.
4a31bb69-8b3b-44c9-b0a4-641ad88a2616
To assemble the gratin, layer or shingle half the potatoes in the bottom of a baking dish approx. 10 inches by 8 inches and 2 inches deep. It's okay if some potatoes overlap.
4a31bb69-8b3b-44c9-b0a4-641ad88a2616
Spoon the artichoke mixture on top of the potatoes in an even layer.
4a31bb69-8b3b-44c9-b0a4-641ad88a2616
Cover the artichoke mixture with the remaining potatoes. Shingle them in a decorative fashion for a nice look to your gratin.
4a31bb69-8b3b-44c9-b0a4-641ad88a2616
Pour the cashew mixture over the gratin evenly. Press down on the potatoes with a spatula to submerge them as far as possible.
4a31bb69-8b3b-44c9-b0a4-641ad88a2616
Cover the baking dish tightly with a foil. Place in the oven and bake 45 minutes or until the potatoes are tender.
4a31bb69-8b3b-44c9-b0a4-641ad88a2616
Mix the breadcrumbs with the olive oil, nutritional yeast if using, thyme, and salt and black pepper. Remove the baking dish carefully from the oven, remove the foil, and sprinkle the breadcrumb topping over the gratin.
4a31bb69-8b3b-44c9-b0a4-641ad88a2616
Return the gratin to the oven, without the foil covering this time and bake another 10-15 minutes or until the breadcrumb topping is golden and crunchy.
4a31bb69-8b3b-44c9-b0a4-641ad88a2616
Let stand 5-10 minutes before serving.
fc9c4bfd-a071-4869-a3be-7a1d229eb85d
Place both kinds of mushrooms in a bowl and add ground black pepper, salt to taste, and the all purpose flour. Toss well to mix.
fc9c4bfd-a071-4869-a3be-7a1d229eb85d
Heat the 1 tbsp oil in a large saucepan. Add the mushrooms to the pan and saute for a couple of minutes, or until the mushrooms start to soften and brown slightly. Remove to a bowl.
fc9c4bfd-a071-4869-a3be-7a1d229eb85d
In the same pot, add the remaining 1 tsp of olive oil.
fc9c4bfd-a071-4869-a3be-7a1d229eb85d
Add the garlic, onions, carrots and celery. Add a pinch of salt and stir-fry, scraping the bottom of the pan for any bits of mushrooms or flour left behind. They will add wonderful flavor.
fc9c4bfd-a071-4869-a3be-7a1d229eb85d
When the onions and carrots start to soften but not brown, add the mushrooms back into the pot along with the peas, 1 tbsp of herbs and all of the mushroom stock.
fc9c4bfd-a071-4869-a3be-7a1d229eb85d
Stir well, bring to a boil, cover and cook for 20 minutes or until the carrots are tender.
fc9c4bfd-a071-4869-a3be-7a1d229eb85d
Add the remaining herbs and cashew paste. Stir well to mix. The stew should have thickened because of the flour you dredged the mushrooms in, and if it is getting too thick, add some water or stock to thin it out.
fc9c4bfd-a071-4869-a3be-7a1d229eb85d
Add salt and ground black pepper to taste. Stir in the parsley.
fc9c4bfd-a071-4869-a3be-7a1d229eb85d
Turn off the heat.
fc9c4bfd-a071-4869-a3be-7a1d229eb85d Assemble the pot pies: Preheat the oven to 425° Fahrenheit
fc9c4bfd-a071-4869-a3be-7a1d229eb85d Assemble the pot pies: Roll out the puff pastry and, using a glass or a cookie cutter, cut circles or squares large enough to fit over the ramekins or pie plate you will use. I cut circles just large enough to fit over the ramekins I used, but because the pastry shrinks when it cooks, the stew bubbled up through the sides of the ramekins. I don't mind it because it looks rather rustic, but if you want a more polished effect, make sure the puff pastry covers the top of the ramekin completely.
fc9c4bfd-a071-4869-a3be-7a1d229eb85d Assemble the pot pies: Spoon the mushroom filling into the ramekins and cover the tops with the puff pastry circles or squares.
fc9c4bfd-a071-4869-a3be-7a1d229eb85d Assemble the pot pies: At this point, for a prettier crust, I like to brush on a mixture of 1 tsp olive oil + 1 tsp nondairy milk on top of the crusts-- this makes them really golden, but it's completely optional.
fc9c4bfd-a071-4869-a3be-7a1d229eb85d Assemble the pot pies: Cut a small slit in the top of the puff pastry in each ramekin.
fc9c4bfd-a071-4869-a3be-7a1d229eb85d Assemble the pot pies: Place the ramekins on a baking sheet and place in the oven. Bake 15 minutes, then turn down the heat to 350 degrees and continue baking for another 10 minutes or until the tops are all golden and puffy.
fc9c4bfd-a071-4869-a3be-7a1d229eb85d Assemble the pot pies: Remove from the oven, let stand 15 minutes before serving.
c707ba9d-7f20-45f3-abf2-9a597a0f99d9
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.
c707ba9d-7f20-45f3-abf2-9a597a0f99d9
Heat the oil in a 12-inch cast iron skillet. Add the garlic and onions, season with salt and ground black pepper, and cook over medium heat until soft but not brown.
c707ba9d-7f20-45f3-abf2-9a597a0f99d9
Add the sausage and stir for a couple of minutes until it starts to brown.
c707ba9d-7f20-45f3-abf2-9a597a0f99d9
Add the mushrooms and stir well. Saute for a few minutes until the mushrooms start to soften, then add the sage or thyme and the flour and mix well. Cook, stirring, for another couple of minutes.
c707ba9d-7f20-45f3-abf2-9a597a0f99d9
Add the frozen veggies, mix, and then add the nondairy milk. Stir frequently until the mixture just comes to a boil. Add more salt and pepper as needed. Turn off the heat.
c707ba9d-7f20-45f3-abf2-9a597a0f99d9
Arrange the frozen tater tots on top of the veggies. You can make a simple but appealing design, like I did, by arranging the tots in concentric circles.
c707ba9d-7f20-45f3-abf2-9a597a0f99d9
Place the skillet in the oven and bake 55 minutes or until the tater tots are golden-brown.
c707ba9d-7f20-45f3-abf2-9a597a0f99d9
Remove the skillet from the oven and let stand 5 minutes before serving.
53696298-1d0c-4188-8ed3-97d5ead10d79
Thaw the puff pastry sheets to room temperature.
53696298-1d0c-4188-8ed3-97d5ead10d79
Place the lentils in a saucepan, cover with an inch of water, bring to a boil, cover, and continue cooking 10-15 minutes or until lentils are tender but not mushy. Drain and set aside.
53696298-1d0c-4188-8ed3-97d5ead10d79
Preheat the oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit.
53696298-1d0c-4188-8ed3-97d5ead10d79
Heat the oil in a skillet. Add the carrots, celery, onions and garlic along with a dash of salt and ground black pepper. Saute, stirring frequently, until the veggies start to caramelize.
53696298-1d0c-4188-8ed3-97d5ead10d79
Add the mushrooms, saute for a minute, then add the wine. Continue to cook, stirring often, until the wine has evaporated and the mushrooms are browned.
53696298-1d0c-4188-8ed3-97d5ead10d79
Add the herbs, soy sauce or tamari, dijon mustard and salt and ground black pepper to taste.
53696298-1d0c-4188-8ed3-97d5ead10d79
Add the lentils and continue cooking until there is no visible liquid in the skillet. Add the flour and mix well until the flour is absorbed by the mixture. Turn off the heat.
53696298-1d0c-4188-8ed3-97d5ead10d79
Roll out one of the puff pastry sheets to 11 X 13 inches on a lightly floured surface. Divide the lentil mixture in two and place one half in the center of the puff pastry sheets, forming a loaf with your hands as you go. Press it in firmly so it holds together, then bring one side of the puff pastry sheet over the top, and then the other. Tuck in the top and bottom so you have a neat-looking, fully wrapped log. Press in the seams to seal, brush with water first to help the puff pastry stick. Repeat with the second sheet of puff pastry and the remaining lentil-veggie mixture.
53696298-1d0c-4188-8ed3-97d5ead10d79
Place the logs on a baking sheet, at least two inches apart. Using a sharp knife, score the top of the log in a decorative pattern-- I did a crosshatch that's pretty and also pretty easy to make. Mix the two wash ingredients and brush the wash on the tops of the wellington loaves. This gives the baked loaf a lovely color.
53696298-1d0c-4188-8ed3-97d5ead10d79
Place the baking sheet in the preheated oven and bake the wellington logs for 45 minutes.
53696298-1d0c-4188-8ed3-97d5ead10d79
Remove, let the wellingtons stand for about 10 minutes, then slice and serve.
f2a9a1ab-148d-4fc7-b908-10f93b0328b0
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
f2a9a1ab-148d-4fc7-b908-10f93b0328b0
Heat 1 tbsp of oil in a skillet. Add half the garlic and as it begins to turn golden, add the oregano and the fresh mushrooms. Season to taste with salt and ground black pepper. Saute, stirring frequently, for five minutes or until the mushrooms start to brown. Drain the reconstituted mushrooms and add to the skillet. Reserve the mushroom stock. Add the wine.
f2a9a1ab-148d-4fc7-b908-10f93b0328b0
Continue cooking for another five minutes until the wine has evaporated, then add the leeks. Continue cooking another five minutes or until the leeks are just tender. Turn off the heat and set aside.
f2a9a1ab-148d-4fc7-b908-10f93b0328b0
Make the bechamel. In a saucepan, heat the remaining oil. Add the shallot and the remaining garlic. Season with salt and pepper and cook until the shallots start to turn translucent. Add the flour and cook, stirring frequently, over medium heat, until the flour begins to brown.
f2a9a1ab-148d-4fc7-b908-10f93b0328b0
Slowly, stir in the cashew milk, using a whisk to beat out any lumps of flour, until you have smooth sauce. Add the reserved mushroom sauce. Add nutmeg, check seasoning and add more salt and ground black pepper if needed.
f2a9a1ab-148d-4fc7-b908-10f93b0328b0
Let the sauce come to a boil and thicken. It should be thick enough to coat the back of a spoon. Turn off the heat. Reserve 1 ½ cups of the sauce and add the rest of it to the mushroom and leek mixture and stir well.
f2a9a1ab-148d-4fc7-b908-10f93b0328b0
Coat the bottom of a 12 X 8 inch baking pan with the reserved bechamel sauce. Layer lasagna noodles side by side on top. In the pan I used, three noodles fitted side by side in each layer.
f2a9a1ab-148d-4fc7-b908-10f93b0328b0
Pour one-third of the mushroom-leek mixture on top of the lasagna noodles in an even layer. Sprinkle on one-third of the vegan mozzarella
f2a9a1ab-148d-4fc7-b908-10f93b0328b0
Arrange three more noodles on top and again layer on one-third of the mushrooms and leeks and the mozzarella. Repeat one more time, and finish off by layering mushrooms and leeks, mozzarella, and the vegan parmesan on the top layer.
f2a9a1ab-148d-4fc7-b908-10f93b0328b0
Cover the lasagna pan with tinfoil and bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes. After 45 minutes, take off the foil and let the lasagna cook another 15 minutes.
f2a9a1ab-148d-4fc7-b908-10f93b0328b0
Let the lasagna stand 10 minutes. Garnish with parsley before serving.
53188803-43a6-4f91-9cd0-60d815731d1f
If using regular lasagna noodles, cook them in salted boiling water until al dente but not mushy.
53188803-43a6-4f91-9cd0-60d815731d1f
Make the meat sauce by heating the oil in a large saucepan. Add the onions and garlic. Saute, until they soften, about five minutes. Add the "meat" crumbles and saute for a couple of minutes. Add the tomato paste and mix in.
53188803-43a6-4f91-9cd0-60d815731d1f
Put the plum tomatoes in a bowl and squish them to break with your fingers. Add to the saucepan along with 3 cups of vegetable stock if using no-boil noodles, and 2 cups of stock if using regular noodles that have been cooked.
53188803-43a6-4f91-9cd0-60d815731d1f
Stir well, bring to a boil, add the oregano, red pepper flakes, salt and ground black pepper to taste. Stir and let the sauce cook for about 15 minutes or until it turns a bright red. Turn off heat and check seasoning. Set aside.
53188803-43a6-4f91-9cd0-60d815731d1f
Make the ricotta, by placing the cashews in a food processor with all ingredients except the parsley. Process for a couple of minutes until fairly smooth. Mix in the parsley and pulse until it's mixed into the rest of the ricotta. Set aside.
53188803-43a6-4f91-9cd0-60d815731d1f
Preheat oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit.
53188803-43a6-4f91-9cd0-60d815731d1f
Assemble the lasagna by spraying a 12 X 9 inch lasagna pan with cooking spray or oil. Ladle out a small amount of sauce into the pan and spread.
53188803-43a6-4f91-9cd0-60d815731d1f
Layer on four sheets of the noodles into the bottom of the pan. If using no-boil noodles, which are smaller than regular noodles, you might need to layer on five noodles vertically and one more horizontally.
53188803-43a6-4f91-9cd0-60d815731d1f
Layer on one-fourth of the meat sauce over the lasagna noodles.
53188803-43a6-4f91-9cd0-60d815731d1f
Layer on one-fourth of the cashew parmesan.
53188803-43a6-4f91-9cd0-60d815731d1f
Layer on one-fourth of the vegan mozzarella.
53188803-43a6-4f91-9cd0-60d815731d1f
Layer on one-fourth of the vegan ricotta.
53188803-43a6-4f91-9cd0-60d815731d1f
Repeat until you have built up three layers of the meat sauce and the cheeses. Over the fourth and final layer, layer the remaining meat sauce, parm and mozzarella.
53188803-43a6-4f91-9cd0-60d815731d1f
Cover tight with aluminum foil, place the lasagna pan on a rimmed baking sheet, and bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes. After 30 minutes, remove the aluminum foil and bake another 30 minutes until bubbly and hot.
53188803-43a6-4f91-9cd0-60d815731d1f
Let the lasagna stand at least 15 minutes to firm up, then cut and serve.
75b18a70-3343-4de0-ad7d-7fd6ac787c96
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees.
75b18a70-3343-4de0-ad7d-7fd6ac787c96
Heat the olive oil in a skillet. Add the garlic, saute for a few seconds until it just starts to turn color, then add the cabbage and leeks. Season with salt and pepper and cook for 5-8 minutes or until the vegetables are just tender but not mushy. Turn off the heat
75b18a70-3343-4de0-ad7d-7fd6ac787c96
In a blender, place the cashews, cornstarch, nutmeg and salt and ground black pepper to taste. Add ¾ cup water and blend into a very smooth paste. Set aside.
75b18a70-3343-4de0-ad7d-7fd6ac787c96
Roll out the puff pastry sheet to fit into your tart pan. I used a rectangular tart pan that's 12 inches by 8 inches, but a round pan would do just as well.
75b18a70-3343-4de0-ad7d-7fd6ac787c96
Place the puff pastry into the tart pan and press into the sides, making sure it fits into all the corners and crevices. Prick the pastry sheet all over with the tines of a fork, which will keep it from puffing too much. Don't remove any overhanging dough yet.
75b18a70-3343-4de0-ad7d-7fd6ac787c96
Arrange the slices of potatoes in the bottom of the tart pan, then layer on the cabbage and leeks. Finally, pour the cashew sauce all over. Once you've filled the tart pan, pinch off any excess dough along the edges of the pan.
75b18a70-3343-4de0-ad7d-7fd6ac787c96
Place the tart pan in the preheated oven, preferably on a baking sheet, and bake 30-35 minutes or until the puff pastry is golden-brown and the filling is set.
75b18a70-3343-4de0-ad7d-7fd6ac787c96
Let the tart stand 10 minutes before serving.
9f6ad537-8a5d-47a9-bfa3-139a5568e9e3
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
9f6ad537-8a5d-47a9-bfa3-139a5568e9e3 Make the crust: Place all ingredients except water in the bowl of a food processor or a large bowl. Mix well, then drizzle in the water slowly until the dough just comes together. Use a fork to mix, if doing this without a food processor.
9f6ad537-8a5d-47a9-bfa3-139a5568e9e3 Make the crust: Gather the dough into a ball, and then wrap tightly in cling wrap, shaping it with your hands into a disc. Refrigerate while you prepare the filling.
9f6ad537-8a5d-47a9-bfa3-139a5568e9e3 Make the filling: Heat the olive oil in a saute pan. Add the leeks with the garlic, some salt and ground black pepper to taste. Saute for about 10 minutes over medium-low heat, stirring frequently, until the leeks soften and become tender, but do not brown. Turn off heat.
9f6ad537-8a5d-47a9-bfa3-139a5568e9e3 Make the filling: Place all ingredients--the tofu, nutritional yeast, cashews, nutmeg, garlic powder and water--in a blender and blend until smooth. Season with salt and ground black pepper.
9f6ad537-8a5d-47a9-bfa3-139a5568e9e3 Make the filling: Add the tofu cream to the leeks and mix well.
9f6ad537-8a5d-47a9-bfa3-139a5568e9e3 Assemble and bake the quiche: Roll the crust to fit a 9-inch tart pan. Fold into half and place in the pan. Unfold and, using your fingers, fit the crust into the pan. Cut out any overhanging dough by running your rolling pin over it.
9f6ad537-8a5d-47a9-bfa3-139a5568e9e3 Assemble and bake the quiche: Prick the bottom of the crust all over with the tines of a fork. Place the tart pan on a baking sheet.
9f6ad537-8a5d-47a9-bfa3-139a5568e9e3 Assemble and bake the quiche: Pour the filling into the crust.
9f6ad537-8a5d-47a9-bfa3-139a5568e9e3 Assemble and bake the quiche: Place the baking sheet with the tart pan into the preheated oven and bake for 35-40 minutes until the filling has set.
9f6ad537-8a5d-47a9-bfa3-139a5568e9e3 Assemble and bake the quiche: Remove and let the quiche cool about 20 minutes before unmolding. Serve.
f380e756-ddc1-42e5-be63-1a8550d0f9f2 Make the pumpkin bechamel: Heat the oil in a saucepan. Over medium heat add the flour and cook, stirring constantly, until the flour becomes very fragrant, about 3-4 minutes.
f380e756-ddc1-42e5-be63-1a8550d0f9f2 Make the pumpkin bechamel: Add the nondairy milk, stirring constantly with a whisk to prevent lumps from forming. Add the pumpkin puree and continue to whisk. Cook the sauce for 10 minutes. You want it to be thick but fluid, about the consistency of pancake batter. If the sauce gets too thick, add some more nondairy milk.
f380e756-ddc1-42e5-be63-1a8550d0f9f2 Make the pumpkin bechamel: Stir in the nutmeg and add salt and pepper to taste. Set aside.
f380e756-ddc1-42e5-be63-1a8550d0f9f2 Make the creamed spinach: Blend the cashews with 1 cup water.
f380e756-ddc1-42e5-be63-1a8550d0f9f2 Make the creamed spinach: Heat the oil in a saucepan and add the onion and garlic.
f380e756-ddc1-42e5-be63-1a8550d0f9f2 Make the creamed spinach: Saute over medium heat until the onions turn translucent.
f380e756-ddc1-42e5-be63-1a8550d0f9f2 Make the creamed spinach: Add the flour, and cook, stirring, about 2-3 minutes. Add the cashew cream and stir well.
f380e756-ddc1-42e5-be63-1a8550d0f9f2 Make the creamed spinach: Add the spinach and continue cooking about two minutes. This will be thick, but if you find it is sticking to the bottom of the pan, add a tiny bit of water. Add nutmeg, salt and ground pepper, then turn off heat.
f380e756-ddc1-42e5-be63-1a8550d0f9f2 Assemble the lasagna: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees.
f380e756-ddc1-42e5-be63-1a8550d0f9f2 Assemble the lasagna: Spread a couple of ladlefuls of the pumpkin bechamel on the bottom of a 9 X 13 inch baking dish.
f380e756-ddc1-42e5-be63-1a8550d0f9f2 Assemble the lasagna: Layer five of the lasagna noodles on top of the sauce, then layer on half of the creamed spinach, spreading it evenly over the noodles. On top of the spinach, layer on approximately a third of the pumpkin sauce.
f380e756-ddc1-42e5-be63-1a8550d0f9f2 Assemble the lasagna: Cover with five more noodles and continue layering with all of the remaining creamed spinach and a third of the bechamel.
f380e756-ddc1-42e5-be63-1a8550d0f9f2 Assemble the lasagna: Place your last five noodles in the pan, and this time cover with just the remaining pumpkin bechamel.
f380e756-ddc1-42e5-be63-1a8550d0f9f2 Assemble the lasagna: Top evenly with the breadcrumbs. Cover the pan with aluminum foil and bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes.
f380e756-ddc1-42e5-be63-1a8550d0f9f2 Assemble the lasagna: After 30 minutes remove the foil and continue to bake for 30 more minutes.
f380e756-ddc1-42e5-be63-1a8550d0f9f2 Assemble the lasagna: Remove from the oven. Let stand 10 minutes, then serve the lasagna hot or later, at room temperature. If desired, sprinkle on some chopped parsley or basil before serving.
d1482ded-b681-4136-b930-5df5da1d9d17 Make the pastry crust: Whisk the flour and the salt in a bowl. Add the cold butter cubes to the bowl and cut it into the flour, using a fork or a pastry cutter, until you have a coarse, grainy mix with some pea-sized pieces of butter.
d1482ded-b681-4136-b930-5df5da1d9d17 Make the pastry crust: Drizzle in the ice-cold water, a little at a time, stirring frequently until the dough comes together. Try not to make the dough wet -- stop adding water as soon as you can pull the dough together in a ball.
d1482ded-b681-4136-b930-5df5da1d9d17 Make the pastry crust: Wrap the dough tightly in cling wrap, shaping into a disc with your hands as you wrap it. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
d1482ded-b681-4136-b930-5df5da1d9d17 Make the "chicken" tikka pieces: Place all of the ingredients in a bowl, and toss to mix. Spread the faux chicken pieces on a baking sheet and bake 20 minutes in a 350 degree oven or until chewy.
d1482ded-b681-4136-b930-5df5da1d9d17 Make the tikka masala sauce: Heat oil in a saucepan and add the onions. Saute until they turn golden-brown, then add in the ginger-garlic paste. Stir-fry for a minutes, then add in the tomatoes and tomato paste.
d1482ded-b681-4136-b930-5df5da1d9d17 Make the tikka masala sauce: Cook the tomatoes, stirring frequently, until they become very pulpy and darken slightly. Add the powdered spices -- the coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala, paprika and turmeric. Mix well and cook for another couple of minutes.
d1482ded-b681-4136-b930-5df5da1d9d17 Make the tikka masala sauce: Add 2 cups of vegetable stock to the saucepan and mix well. Chop the "chicken" tikka pieces into smaller, bite-sized bits and add to the sauce. Bring everything to a boil.
d1482ded-b681-4136-b930-5df5da1d9d17 Make the tikka masala sauce: Add the cashew paste and salt to taste. Add the green peppers and shallots. If the sauce seems too thick at this point, add some vegetable stock. The sauce will thicken as it cooks in the oven, so don't make it too thick at this point. Once you have the desired consistency, turn off the heat.
d1482ded-b681-4136-b930-5df5da1d9d17 Assemble and bake the pot pies: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F.
d1482ded-b681-4136-b930-5df5da1d9d17 Assemble and bake the pot pies: Ladle out the tikka masala sauce into four ramekins. You can also make this in one large ramekin. Place the ramekins on a baking sheet.
d1482ded-b681-4136-b930-5df5da1d9d17 Assemble and bake the pot pies: Roll out the pastry dough on a floured surface, and, using an empty ramekin as the guide, cut four circles of dough large enough to fit the mouth of the ramekins.
d1482ded-b681-4136-b930-5df5da1d9d17 Assemble and bake the pot pies: Place each circle of dough on top of the tikka masala sauce in the ramekin. Cut a couple of vents into the top of the puff pastry using a sharp or serrated knife.
d1482ded-b681-4136-b930-5df5da1d9d17 Assemble and bake the pot pies: Place the baking sheet with the ramekins in the preheated oven and bake 20 minutes. Turn the heat down to 350 degrees and continue baking 15-20 minutes or until the pastry is golden-brown and the sauce is bubbling down the sides or through the vents in the pastry.
d1482ded-b681-4136-b930-5df5da1d9d17 Assemble and bake the pot pies: Remove the ramekins from the oven and let stand five minutes at least before serving.
a3490337-bd9d-47af-8e67-9b02f6d8c048
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
a3490337-bd9d-47af-8e67-9b02f6d8c048
Heat the oil in a saucepan. Add the garlic and, when they sizzle, add the leeks and thyme. Season with salt and ground black pepper and cook for about 15 minutes, covered, until the leeks are tender. Stir in the cornstarch and mix. Turn off heat.
a3490337-bd9d-47af-8e67-9b02f6d8c048
While the leeks are cooking, season the sourdough cubes with salt and ground black pepper. Spray on some cooking spray and toast in the oven for 15 minutes or until the bread cubes are lightly golden.
a3490337-bd9d-47af-8e67-9b02f6d8c048
Add the toasted cubes of sourdough to the leek mixture and toss together.
a3490337-bd9d-47af-8e67-9b02f6d8c048
Place the nondairy milk in a bowl and whisk in the garlic powder, onion powder, salt and ground black pepper to taste.
a3490337-bd9d-47af-8e67-9b02f6d8c048
In a small baking dish (I used an oval baking dish about 9 inches long and 5 inches wide, but a square 8-inch dish would work as well), place the sourdough-leek mixture and spread evenly.
a3490337-bd9d-47af-8e67-9b02f6d8c048
Pour all but ½ cup of the nondairy milk mixture over the bread-leek mixture. Press slightly to submerge the cubes of bread, but not all the way.
a3490337-bd9d-47af-8e67-9b02f6d8c048
Let the pudding stand for 5 minutes, then pour in the remaining nondairy milk.
a3490337-bd9d-47af-8e67-9b02f6d8c048
Bake in the preheated oven for 1 hour or until the pudding is set and the tops of the bread are golden-brown.
6fb7ad67-395c-4b48-a497-8e3220546d0d
In a pan, bring 1 ½ cups of water to a boil. Add the drained, soaked rice to it along with the bay leaves and enough salt to flavor the rice.
6fb7ad67-395c-4b48-a497-8e3220546d0d
Bring the mixture back to a boil, cover with a tight lid, and let the rice steam on the lowest heat setting for 10 minutes. Turn off the heat and let the rice stand.
6fb7ad67-395c-4b48-a497-8e3220546d0d
Heat the oil in a large, heavy-bottomed pan. Add the shahjeera or caraway seeds, cardamom pods, and cloves. When they begin to turn color, add the onions and bell peppers.
6fb7ad67-395c-4b48-a497-8e3220546d0d
Saute the onions and the peppers until the onions start to brown.
6fb7ad67-395c-4b48-a497-8e3220546d0d
Add the ginger and garlic along with the green chilies, mint and coriander leaves. Saute for 30 seconds.
6fb7ad67-395c-4b48-a497-8e3220546d0d
Add the pumpkin puree and mix well. Cook the pumpkin puree, stirring frequently, about 5 minutes.
6fb7ad67-395c-4b48-a497-8e3220546d0d
Add the cashew paste and lemon juice and mix thoroughly. Cook for another two to three minutes, stirring frequently.
6fb7ad67-395c-4b48-a497-8e3220546d0d
Fluff the cooked rice with a fork and add i to the pumpkin mixture in the large pan.
6fb7ad67-395c-4b48-a497-8e3220546d0d
Carefully, taking care not to break the grains of rice, stir them with the pumpkin mixture to coat evenly.
6fb7ad67-395c-4b48-a497-8e3220546d0d
Sprinkle on the non-dairy milk mixed with saffron threads.
6fb7ad67-395c-4b48-a497-8e3220546d0d
Cover the pot with a very tight lid and let the biryani steam on a very low heat setting for 15 minutes.
6fb7ad67-395c-4b48-a497-8e3220546d0d
Turn off the heat and let it stand for another 10 minutes before opening.
6fb7ad67-395c-4b48-a497-8e3220546d0d
Sprinkle on some candied or dry cranberries and sauteed pumpkin seeds, as well as the spring onions.
6fb7ad67-395c-4b48-a497-8e3220546d0d
Serve hot.
6fb7ad67-395c-4b48-a497-8e3220546d0d
Make candied cranberries:
6fb7ad67-395c-4b48-a497-8e3220546d0d
In a small baking pan, place the cranberries and sprinkle sugar over them.
6fb7ad67-395c-4b48-a497-8e3220546d0d
Cover tightly with aluminum foil and bake in a 350-degree oven for 1 hour. Stir the cranberries occasionally.
6fb7ad67-395c-4b48-a497-8e3220546d0d
Let them cool and preferably chill before using.
6fb7ad67-395c-4b48-a497-8e3220546d0d
SERVING IDEAS:
6fb7ad67-395c-4b48-a497-8e3220546d0d
Serve the biryani with some of this creamy Kofta Curry or Tofu Makhani.
96733385-76a6-4417-953c-db8f6d488867
To make the tart shell, mix the flour, cornmeal, salt and black pepper in a bowl.
96733385-76a6-4417-953c-db8f6d488867
Cut the coconut oil into the all purpose flour with a fork or a pastry cutter until you have small pieces of the fat dispersed throughout the flour.
96733385-76a6-4417-953c-db8f6d488867
Drizzle in ice-cold water and mix with a fork until the dough comes together in a ball. Add the water slowly because you don't want a wet dough-- it should be moist enough to just hold together.
96733385-76a6-4417-953c-db8f6d488867
Press the dough into a flat disc and wrap tightly in cling wrap. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
96733385-76a6-4417-953c-db8f6d488867
In the meantime, make the filling.
96733385-76a6-4417-953c-db8f6d488867
Heat the oil in a large saucepan and add the onions, sugar and a little salt. Cook, stirring frequently, until the onions start to caramelize and become golden brown. This took me about 20 minutes over medium heat.
96733385-76a6-4417-953c-db8f6d488867
When the onions are browned, stir in the thyme, then add the cognac to deglaze the pan and scrape up all the tasty brown bits stuck at the bottom. If you'd rather not use cognac, use vegetable stock or plain old water.
96733385-76a6-4417-953c-db8f6d488867
Turn off the heat and set the onions aside to cool.
96733385-76a6-4417-953c-db8f6d488867
In a blender, crumble in the tofu then add soymilk, nutritional yeast if you're using it, mustard and salt to taste. Blend until you have a very smooth mixture.
96733385-76a6-4417-953c-db8f6d488867
Scrape the tofu mixture into the pan with the onions and mix well.
96733385-76a6-4417-953c-db8f6d488867
To assemble the tart:
96733385-76a6-4417-953c-db8f6d488867
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit.
96733385-76a6-4417-953c-db8f6d488867
Remove the tart dough from the refrigerator and roll it out on a floured surface to a diameter two inches larger than the base of the tart pan (mine is 9 inches wide). Fold the dough in half and then transfer to a tart pan and open it so it lies evenly across the pan. If the dough tears, don't worry. Patch it up once you have transferred it to the pan. No one will be able to tell.
96733385-76a6-4417-953c-db8f6d488867
Run the rolling pin across the edges of the tart pan and remove any excess dough hanging over the sides.
96733385-76a6-4417-953c-db8f6d488867
With a fork, prick the bottom of the tart shell in several places. Then cover with aluminum foil and fill it to the brim with rice or beans or pie weights. I keep some rice in a box and reuse it every time I need to blind bake a pie or tart crust.
96733385-76a6-4417-953c-db8f6d488867
Bake the filled tart crust for 10 minutes, then carefully remove the foil with the rice or beans in it, and continue to bake the crust for another 10 minutes until it is quite dry.
96733385-76a6-4417-953c-db8f6d488867
Remove the crust from the oven and increase the heat to 425 degrees. Brush the bottom of the crust with some extra virgin olive oil. Now scrape in the filling and smooth it.
96733385-76a6-4417-953c-db8f6d488867
Return the tart pan to the oven and bake for 40 minutes until the top of the tart is golden-brown.
96733385-76a6-4417-953c-db8f6d488867
Remove the tart to a rack and cool 10 minutes. Then unmold it -- I do that by placing the tart on top of a mason jar and letting the rim slide off. Slide the tart off the base and onto the rack and continue cooling it for another 10 minutes.
96733385-76a6-4417-953c-db8f6d488867
Serve warm or at room temperature.
83e948b2-2f00-49f8-a255-d869bdd25bb0
Heat the oil in a saucepan. Add the onions, carrots and celery along with a dash of salt and ground black pepper. Sweat the vegetables until the onions are translucent. You don't want to brown them.
83e948b2-2f00-49f8-a255-d869bdd25bb0
Add the garlic, saute a few seconds, then add the potatoes, rosemary and thyme. Mix well.
83e948b2-2f00-49f8-a255-d869bdd25bb0
Add the all purpose flour and saute for a couple of minutes, stirring constantly. Add in the entire bottle of Guinness. Alcohol is highly flammable, so when adding it to anything that's on the stove, make sure you either turn your flame off, or reduce it really low so it doesn't catch any spatter.
83e948b2-2f00-49f8-a255-d869bdd25bb0
Stir the stew and let it bubble away for a couple of minutes. It will look really thick at this stage because of the all purpose roux, but that's fine.
83e948b2-2f00-49f8-a255-d869bdd25bb0
Add the tomatoes and let the stew continue to cook, covered, for about 10 minutes. You want to let the potatoes get tender and you want the bitterness of the Guinness to dissipate to your liking. The more you let the stew cook, the more you'll cook out the alcohol.
83e948b2-2f00-49f8-a255-d869bdd25bb0
Add the chick'n pieces to the pot and, if needed, add some of the vegetable stock to thin out your stew. You can make this as thick or thin as you want. I prefer my pot pie filling really thick, so I used less.
83e948b2-2f00-49f8-a255-d869bdd25bb0
Check to see if you need more salt and ground black pepper, and turn off the heat after the stew comes to a boil. Stir in the vegan butter and the basil.
83e948b2-2f00-49f8-a255-d869bdd25bb0
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit.
83e948b2-2f00-49f8-a255-d869bdd25bb0
To assemble your Guinness pie, pour the stew into a two quart baking dish (a deep-dish pie plate works too)
83e948b2-2f00-49f8-a255-d869bdd25bb0
Cut the puff pastry sheet into strips with a pastry cutter or pizza cutter. Depending on the width or diameter of your baking dish, you may need to roll out the puff pastry a little to fit. Now layer on the strips over the stew, as nicely as you can, forming a lattice top. Trim any overhanging edges. Or, if you'd rather not do this, just place the puff pastry sheet over the stew and cut a few slits in the middle, as you would for a pie.
83e948b2-2f00-49f8-a255-d869bdd25bb0
Place the Guinness Pie in the oven and bake 30 minutes or until the puff pastry is all golden and the stew is bubbling around the edges.
83e948b2-2f00-49f8-a255-d869bdd25bb0
Remove from the oven and serve hot.
754b58c7-f169-411c-a638-481b186f2118 Make the meatballs: Pour a cup of boiling water over the dry shiitake mushrooms in a bowl and let them steep for 20 minutes. Drain the mushrooms and squeeze out as much water from them as possible. Reserve the stock for use in the gravy.
754b58c7-f169-411c-a638-481b186f2118 Make the meatballs: Place the mushrooms in a food processor and pulse five or six times until they are broken down into small bits. Add the rest of the ingredients, except the oil, to the food processor and pulse a few times until they are thoroughly mixed and the mixture holds together when you form a ball.
754b58c7-f169-411c-a638-481b186f2118 Make the meatballs: Shape into 20 meatballs. Heat the oil in a large skillet and fry the meatballs, turning them to brown all over. Remove the meatballs to a bowl large enough to hold the sauce.
754b58c7-f169-411c-a638-481b186f2118 Make the gravy: Blend the cashews with ½ cup water into a very thick cream. Set aside.
754b58c7-f169-411c-a638-481b186f2118 Make the gravy: Heat oil in a large saucepan. Add the onions and garlic along with some salt and pepper and saute for five to six minutes over medium heat. The onions should brown nicely so your sauce has great flavor, but don't let the garlic burn. Stir frequently.
754b58c7-f169-411c-a638-481b186f2118 Make the gravy: Add the mushrooms to the pan along with the apple cider vinegar. Saute until the mushrooms have expressed most of their water and it has evaporated, another five to six minutes over medium-high heat. Now add the flour and stir until it gets absorbed into the mushrooms.
754b58c7-f169-411c-a638-481b186f2118 Make the gravy: Stir in the rosemary, then pour the vegetable stock in, stirring constantly, so the flour dissolves in it. Bring the stock to a boil. It will look very soupy at this stage, but don't worry -- you need to let the stock reduce to about four cups, which will take about 10-15 minutes over high heat. Stir occasionally to ensure nothing sticks to the bottom.
754b58c7-f169-411c-a638-481b186f2118 Make the gravy: Once the sauce has reduced and is quite thick, season with salt and pepper. Wait until the sauce has cooled a little or, if doing this while the sauce is still hot, very carefully strain it into a large bowl.
754b58c7-f169-411c-a638-481b186f2118 Make the gravy: Pour the sauce back into the saucepan and bring to a boil over medium-low heat. Stir in the liquid aminos or soy sauce and cashew cream. Turn off the heat and pour over the meatballs. Garnish with parsley and serve hot or warm.
2aa95ca7-f180-4490-8e89-216bdbe25ec1
Make the mashed potatoes by mixing together the potatoes, olive oil, almond milk and salt and ground black pepper. Set aside.
2aa95ca7-f180-4490-8e89-216bdbe25ec1
Heat the oil for the filling in a saucepan. Add the onions, celery. peas and carrots and the minced garlic. Add salt and a good pinch of ground black pepper. Saute until the onions turn translucent.
2aa95ca7-f180-4490-8e89-216bdbe25ec1
Add the mushrooms and tempeh and the whiskey. Saute, stirring frequently, until the liquid has evaporated.
2aa95ca7-f180-4490-8e89-216bdbe25ec1
Add the tamari, mustard, thyme, mint, paprika, cayenne and some ground black pepper. Mix well, then add the lentils.
2aa95ca7-f180-4490-8e89-216bdbe25ec1
Cook until most of the moisture has evaporated. Add salt.
2aa95ca7-f180-4490-8e89-216bdbe25ec1
Oil a baking dish (I used an oval one that's 10 inches long). Spoon the lentil-tempeh filling into the dish.
2aa95ca7-f180-4490-8e89-216bdbe25ec1
Layer on the mashed potatoes evenly. When you're done, run the tines of the fork through the top of the potatoes to give it a pretty, traditional look.
2aa95ca7-f180-4490-8e89-216bdbe25ec1
