Spray the top with some oil. Preheat an oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit and bake the Shepherd's Pie for 25 minutes.
2aa95ca7-f180-4490-8e89-216bdbe25ec1
Serve hot.
c5b94af7-5819-448a-8763-143905143659
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.
c5b94af7-5819-448a-8763-143905143659 Make the almond cookie crust: Place all ingredients for the crust in a food processor and add water, a tablespoon at a time, until the mixture comes together.
c5b94af7-5819-448a-8763-143905143659 Make the almond cookie crust: Dump the almond cookie dough into an 8-inch tart pan and press down with the heel of your hand to form an even layer. Press the dough up the sides of the pan with your fingers until the entire pan is covered. Prick the bottom of the crust all over with the tines of a fork and refrigerate until you make the filling.
c5b94af7-5819-448a-8763-143905143659 Make the filling: Place all ingredients for the filling in the food processor and process until smooth. Pour into the tart shell. Use a knife or spatula to spread it evenly.
c5b94af7-5819-448a-8763-143905143659 Make the praline: Place all ingredients for the praline in the food processor and process until the nuts are chopped into fairly small pieces. You can stop earlier, if you prefer larger pieces of pecans.
c5b94af7-5819-448a-8763-143905143659 Make the praline: Spread the praline evenly over the top of the filling.
c5b94af7-5819-448a-8763-143905143659 Make the praline: Place the tart pan on a cookie sheet and bake 40 minutes or until the top feels firm.
c5b94af7-5819-448a-8763-143905143659 Make the praline: Remove and let cool thoroughly. Chill for an hour before serving.
72370f4e-2c66-4244-920f-6a79ee1a786b
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit.
72370f4e-2c66-4244-920f-6a79ee1a786b
Mix the apples with the sugar in a large bowl.
72370f4e-2c66-4244-920f-6a79ee1a786b
Roll out the puff pastry sheet to fit in your tart pan. I used a 12 X 8 inch rectangular pan with a removable bottom, but a round one would work too.
72370f4e-2c66-4244-920f-6a79ee1a786b
Place the puff pastry inside the pan and press in the sides to fit to the pan. You can use a rolling pin to cut any overhanging pastry dough, or tuck it under the edges to get a neat look. With a fork, prick the dough all over to keep it from rising in the pan.
72370f4e-2c66-4244-920f-6a79ee1a786b
Layer the sliced apples inside the puff pastry in a decorative pattern, tucking any small pieces into the corners to ensure the surface is evenly covered. If you're working with a round pan, you can layer them in concentric circles.
72370f4e-2c66-4244-920f-6a79ee1a786b
Place the tart on a rimmed baking sheet to catch any juices that spill over, and then in the oven. Bake 45 minutes, turning around once halfway through baking. Remove to a rack.
72370f4e-2c66-4244-920f-6a79ee1a786b
Heat the apricot jam with the water or liqueur in a small saucepan until it's runny enough to work with. Brush on top of the apples once the tart is out of the oven. If your pan has a removable bottom, unmold before the tart cools down completely because any running juices could cause the pastry to stick to the pan. Continue cooling on a rack. Slice and serve at room temperature.
905b0bfc-ad1d-4c83-bdc4-995788dc4e2d Make the crust: Mix the flour, salt, and sugar in a bowl. Add the cubed butter. Using a pastry cutter, cut the butter into the flour until you have large crumbs of butter dispersed through the dough.
905b0bfc-ad1d-4c83-bdc4-995788dc4e2d Make the crust: Using a fork to mix, drizzle ice cold water into the flour, a little at a time, until the dough comes together in a ball. Don't add too much water, the dough shouldn't be wet. It should just hold together without any dry flour remaining.
905b0bfc-ad1d-4c83-bdc4-995788dc4e2d Make the crust: Divide the dough into two and wrap tightly in cling wrap, shaping each ball into a disc. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or overnight. You can make the dough the earlier day.
905b0bfc-ad1d-4c83-bdc4-995788dc4e2d Make the pie filling: Place the cherries in a saucepan and stir for a couple of minutes until they begin to express liquid. Let the cherries cook another five minutes at which point they will have expressed a good amount of liquid. Using a spider strainer or a slotted spoon, remove the cherries to a bowl, leaving the juices behind. Bring the juice to a boil and let it reduce to about half, which should take around 5-10 minutes.
905b0bfc-ad1d-4c83-bdc4-995788dc4e2d Make the pie filling: Add the sugar to the cherry juice and stir until dissolved. Now add the cornstarch to the liquid, a tablespoon at a time, whisking in each time until thoroughly dissolved. Once all the cornstarch has been dissolved in the cherry juices, turn off the heat and pour the juice into the cherries. Mix in the vanilla and set aside.
905b0bfc-ad1d-4c83-bdc4-995788dc4e2d Assemble the pie: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit.
905b0bfc-ad1d-4c83-bdc4-995788dc4e2d Assemble the pie: To assemble the pie, roll out one disc of dough to a width slightly larger than your pie plate. Fit it into the bottom of the pie plate, leaving a slight overhang. Refrigerate while you roll out the top crust.
905b0bfc-ad1d-4c83-bdc4-995788dc4e2d Assemble the pie: You can make a decorative lattice top, like I did (not the best looking lattice, I'll admit, but it still looks quite nice), or just make a plain crust that'll still look beautiful when it bakes up all golden and flaky. To make a lattice top, roll out the dough to a disc slightly wider than the pie plate and cut it into thin strips using a pizza cutter. Arrange the strips in a lattice pattern on top of the pie and then seal the edges, cutting out any overhanging dough. The filling is rather juicy which makes the lattice top harder to arrange, so if you aren't very comfortable doing it, just make a plain top crust. To do this, place the rolled-out dough on top of the filling, press down the edges of the dough to seal with the edges of the bottom crust using the tines of a fork, and cut four vents at the top of the pie to let the steam out as the pie bakes.
905b0bfc-ad1d-4c83-bdc4-995788dc4e2d Assemble the pie: Place the pie on a cookie sheet and bake in the preheated oven for 50 minutes.
905b0bfc-ad1d-4c83-bdc4-995788dc4e2d Assemble the pie: Remove the pie plate to a rack and cool thoroughly for 3-4 hours before cutting and serving.
37165005-8581-4a3b-9977-a0a664ed7d87 Make the pie crust: Place the flour in a bowl with sugar and salt. Whisk together, then add the cold cubes of butter and cut into the flour with a pie cutter or a fork until you have a crumbly mixture with some pea-sized pieces of butter.
37165005-8581-4a3b-9977-a0a664ed7d87 Make the pie crust: Drizzle in the water, a little at a time, while mixing with a fork. As soon as the dough comes together and holds, turn it out into cling wrap and wrap tightly while shaping into a disc with your palms. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
37165005-8581-4a3b-9977-a0a664ed7d87 Make the filling: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees.
37165005-8581-4a3b-9977-a0a664ed7d87 Make the filling: Blend the cashews with ¼ cup water until very smooth.
37165005-8581-4a3b-9977-a0a664ed7d87 Make the filling: Prick the sweet potatoes all over with a knife or fork. Place on a baking sheet and bake for 35-45 minutes or until a knife inserted in the center slides easily all the way through without pressure. Remove the sweet potatoes from the oven and set aside until cool enough to handle.
37165005-8581-4a3b-9977-a0a664ed7d87 Make the filling: Peel the sweet potatoes and place them in a food processor (or you can do this in a bowl), along with the cashew cream, sugar, tapioca starch, coconut oil, cinnamon, nutmeg and pure vanilla extract. Process until you have a very smooth mixture.
37165005-8581-4a3b-9977-a0a664ed7d87 Assemble the pie: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees.
37165005-8581-4a3b-9977-a0a664ed7d87 Assemble the pie: On a floured surface, roll out the pie dough into a circle big enough to fit your pie plate. Place the circle of dough into the pie plate and crimp the edges with a fork or your fingers.
37165005-8581-4a3b-9977-a0a664ed7d87 Assemble the pie: To make a decorative design the way I did, you'll need extra pie crust dough. I doubled my pie crust recipe and then cut out stars using a cookie cutter. You can make all sorts of designs -- leaves, flowers, hearts, circles, they all work.
37165005-8581-4a3b-9977-a0a664ed7d87 Assemble the pie: Pour the filling into the pie crust. The filling is quite thick, so smooth it down with a spatula.
37165005-8581-4a3b-9977-a0a664ed7d87 Assemble the pie: Bake the pie for 15 minutes, then turn down the heat to 350 degrees and bake 40 minutes. At this point, if you have a top crust, tent the pie loosely with aluminum foil and continue baking another 15 minutes or until the top is set and a knife near the center comes out almost clean. Your filling won't set completely in the oven the way it would if you were using eggs, but it will set as it cools down.
37165005-8581-4a3b-9977-a0a664ed7d87 Assemble the pie: Remove the pie from the oven and let it stand on a rack until completely cool. You can also chill the pie for about 30 minutes in the refrigerator.
37165005-8581-4a3b-9977-a0a664ed7d87 Assemble the pie: Slice and serve.
586682ee-d075-47af-b15e-b61db8348858
Make the crust: You can do this in a food processor or in a bowl. If using a food processor, place all ingredients except water in the food processor and pulse a few times, drizzling water in a tablespoon at a time, until the dough comes together. You don't want a wet dough because that will encourage gluten formation, making your crust chewy. Err, if you will, on the side of using less water than more.
586682ee-d075-47af-b15e-b61db8348858
If you're doing this by hand, place all the ingredients except water in a bowl and, using a fork, cut the pieces of butter into the flour until they break down into smaller bits but don't melt.
586682ee-d075-47af-b15e-b61db8348858
Drizzle in the water, a tablespoon at a time, mixing with your fork, until the dough just comes together. Again, try not to add too much water.
586682ee-d075-47af-b15e-b61db8348858
Wrap the dough in cling wrap, patting with your fingers to shape it into a disc. Refrigerate while you make the filling.
586682ee-d075-47af-b15e-b61db8348858
Make the filling: Place the sliced apples in a bowl with the sugar, lemon, and ground ginger. Mix well.
586682ee-d075-47af-b15e-b61db8348858
Set aside for 15 minutes.
586682ee-d075-47af-b15e-b61db8348858
Assemble the crostata:Preheat the oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit.
586682ee-d075-47af-b15e-b61db8348858
Prepare a baking sheet by lining it with some parchment paper or foil.
586682ee-d075-47af-b15e-b61db8348858
Flour your rolling pin and the kitchen counter. Roll the dough into a disc about 12 inches across, trying to keep it as round as possible. If the edges start to fray, knock them back into a cleaner line by tapping with your fingers.
586682ee-d075-47af-b15e-b61db8348858
Be sure to keep turning the dough as you roll to ensure it doesn't stick to the surface, and dust with more flour if needed.
586682ee-d075-47af-b15e-b61db8348858
Fold the crust once and transfer to the baking sheet. Unfold.
586682ee-d075-47af-b15e-b61db8348858
Arrange the apple slices inside the crostata, leaving a 1-½ inch border. You can either overlap them in a circle, as I did, or you can just pile them in and spread them so they are in an even layer.
586682ee-d075-47af-b15e-b61db8348858
Fold the edges of the crostata over. You can be as precise or casual about this as you like: it's going to look great either way. If there is some juice left at the bottom of the bowl with apples, reserve it.
586682ee-d075-47af-b15e-b61db8348858
Place the crostata in the preheated oven and bake for 40 minutes.
586682ee-d075-47af-b15e-b61db8348858
Remove the crostata, brush the crust and the tops of the apples with the reserved juice from the apples.
586682ee-d075-47af-b15e-b61db8348858
Put the crostata back in the oven and bake another 15 minutes. The crust should be golden.
586682ee-d075-47af-b15e-b61db8348858
Remove the crostata from the oven and, using a wide spatula, transfer immediately from the parchment lined sheet to a rack. Be careful because the dough still feels pliable at this time-- it will firm up as it cools.
586682ee-d075-47af-b15e-b61db8348858
Scatter cranberries and almonds on top.
586682ee-d075-47af-b15e-b61db8348858
Serve after the crostata has cooled thoroughly.
ca03cb27-f508-428a-aafa-399edc913167 Make the shortbread crust: Cut the butter into 1-cm cubes and place in the food processor along with the flour, sugar and salt. Pulse a few times, for a few seconds each time, until the dough forms clumps.
ca03cb27-f508-428a-aafa-399edc913167 Make the shortbread crust: Take an eight-inch tart pan with a removable bottom. Empty all of the filling into the the tart pan and then, working from the center, press the dough evenly around the bottom and the sides of the tart pan. When you have a fairly even layer, use a spoon or spatula to smooth it out.
ca03cb27-f508-428a-aafa-399edc913167 Make the shortbread crust: Pierce the bottom of the tart shell several times with the tines of a fork. This will keep it from puffing up when you bake.
ca03cb27-f508-428a-aafa-399edc913167 Make the shortbread crust: Cover the tart pan with cling wrap and freeze it for 15 minutes.
ca03cb27-f508-428a-aafa-399edc913167 Make the shortbread crust: Remove from the freezer and bake in a preheated 425 degree oven for 18 minutes. Meanwhile, make the filling.
ca03cb27-f508-428a-aafa-399edc913167 Make the chocolate hazelnut filling: Drain the hazelnuts from the soaking water, then place it in a high-powered blender with 1 ½ cups of water. Blend until very smooth.
ca03cb27-f508-428a-aafa-399edc913167 Make the chocolate hazelnut filling: Strain the hazelnut paste through a medium sieve. I really only do this to get any big bits of skin out. The strained paste will be quite thick, like the consistency of pancake batter.
ca03cb27-f508-428a-aafa-399edc913167 Make the chocolate hazelnut filling: Heat the hazelnut paste in a small saucepan until it starts to bubble, which it will quite fast. Don't leave it unsupervised.
ca03cb27-f508-428a-aafa-399edc913167 Make the chocolate hazelnut filling: Once the hazelnut paste has heated, stir in the chocolate chips, maple syrup, vanilla and salt. Turn off the heat and mix until the filling is very smooth.
ca03cb27-f508-428a-aafa-399edc913167 Make the chocolate hazelnut filling: Pour the filling into the tart shell and after about an hour carefully transfer to the refrigerator where it should remain for at least six hours until it's completely chilled and the filling is set. Dust with some cocoa powder, if you wish.
ca03cb27-f508-428a-aafa-399edc913167 Make the chocolate hazelnut filling: Remove the tart from the pan and slice.
5fac9021-519e-4c15-af04-6b668c6eaa07 Make the crust: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F
5fac9021-519e-4c15-af04-6b668c6eaa07 Make the crust: Place all the crust ingredients in the food processor or a bowl and mix until they come together in a ball.
5fac9021-519e-4c15-af04-6b668c6eaa07 Make the crust: Remove the dough to a pie plate and pat the crust into it in an even layer, making sure you come up all the way up the sides.
5fac9021-519e-4c15-af04-6b668c6eaa07 Make the crust: Place the pie plate in the oven and bake 11 minutes or until the edges are light gold. Remove and set aside to cool.
5fac9021-519e-4c15-af04-6b668c6eaa07 Make the white chocolate filling: Place the cocoa butter in a bowl along with the coconut oil and place the bowl on a saucepan with at least an inch of water in it. Turn on the heat. The cocoa butter will melt into a clear liquid. Keep stirring until there are no pieces of cocoa buttter remaining. Add the sugar to the bowl and turn off the heat after two minutes.
5fac9021-519e-4c15-af04-6b668c6eaa07 Make the white chocolate filling: Blend the cashews with ½ cup water into a very smooth, silky paste. If your blender isn't powerful, you may need to soak the cashews first for at least 30 minutes.
5fac9021-519e-4c15-af04-6b668c6eaa07 Make the white chocolate filling: Add the cashew paste to the food processor along with the cocoa butter and sugar mixture, vanilla extract and cream cheese. Process for a few seconds until everything is thoroughly incorporated into a very silky paste.
5fac9021-519e-4c15-af04-6b668c6eaa07 Make the white chocolate filling: Pour the white chocolate filling into the prepared and baked pie crust. Freeze for at least two hours.
5fac9021-519e-4c15-af04-6b668c6eaa07 Make the white chocolate filling: If making the raspberry drizzle, heat the raspberry jam in a saucepan with the water until smooth and fairly runny. Drizzle over the cheesecake before serving.
7337e2fa-deff-4ccb-ac58-98b9c8b81a28 Make the crust: Mix the flour and sugar in a bowl.
7337e2fa-deff-4ccb-ac58-98b9c8b81a28 Make the crust: Cut the butter into ¼-inch cubes and add to the flour. Using a pastry cutter or a fork, "cut" the butter into the flour until you have small pieces of butter evenly dispersed through the flour.
7337e2fa-deff-4ccb-ac58-98b9c8b81a28 Make the crust: Drizzle ice-cold water into the dough, a little at a time, mixing with a fork, until the dough is moist enough to hold together.
7337e2fa-deff-4ccb-ac58-98b9c8b81a28 Make the crust: Divide the dough into two, and shape each half into a disc. Wrap tightly in cling wrap and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or as much as 2 days. If making well in advance, freeze and thaw completely before using.
7337e2fa-deff-4ccb-ac58-98b9c8b81a28 Make the filling: Place all the ingredients for the filling in a large bowl. Mix thoroughly and let the filling stand at least 30 minutes before baking. You can also make the filling the day before and refrigerate.
7337e2fa-deff-4ccb-ac58-98b9c8b81a28 Assemble and bake the pie: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees.
7337e2fa-deff-4ccb-ac58-98b9c8b81a28 Assemble and bake the pie: Roll out one of the crusts so it's big enough to fit into a 9-inch cast iron skillet. Place the crust into the skillet and fit it to the sides. Refrigerate until you make the top crust.
7337e2fa-deff-4ccb-ac58-98b9c8b81a28 Assemble and bake the pie: Roll out the other crust to a diameter about 2 inches wider than the top of the cast iron skillet. You need to make vents in the upper crust for steam to escape while baking. You can either do this with a knife after you place the top crust on the filling or, if you want to cut a decorative shape with a cookie cutter (I cut a star), do it before placing the crust on the filling.
7337e2fa-deff-4ccb-ac58-98b9c8b81a28 Assemble and bake the pie: Pour the apple filling and any juices into the bottom crust in the skillet. Then fold the top crust in half and carefully transfer to the skillet, covering the filling completely. Fold in any overhanging dough and crimp with your fingers or with a fork for a decorative edge, and to seal in the apples.
7337e2fa-deff-4ccb-ac58-98b9c8b81a28 Assemble and bake the pie: For a golden crust, brush on a mixture of 1 tbsp oil and 1 tbsp nondairy milk on the top crust.
7337e2fa-deff-4ccb-ac58-98b9c8b81a28 Assemble and bake the pie: Bake in the oven for 45 minutes or until the top is golden brown.
7337e2fa-deff-4ccb-ac58-98b9c8b81a28 Assemble and bake the pie: Let the pie cool thoroughly on a rack before cutting into it. Exercise care when you handle the hot iron skillet because it is heavy and extremely hot. Make sure you wear oven mitts at all times when handling it before it cools down thoroughly.
d8f0db69-349f-42d8-a4af-88637f4d72a5
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
d8f0db69-349f-42d8-a4af-88637f4d72a5
Oil and flour a 9-inch springform pan or a bundt pan.
d8f0db69-349f-42d8-a4af-88637f4d72a5
Mix the flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt in a bowl.
d8f0db69-349f-42d8-a4af-88637f4d72a5
Put the oil, sugar and applesauce in a large bowl or the bowl of a stand mixer and beat on medium speed for two minutes. Scrape down the bottom and sides of bowl, then add the lemon juice, zest, vanilla, apple cider vinegar and milk.
d8f0db69-349f-42d8-a4af-88637f4d72a5
Add the flour to the milk-oil mixture in two batches, mixing for no more than 20 seconds after each addition. Scrape down the sides of the bowl with a spatula to make sure everything's mixed.
d8f0db69-349f-42d8-a4af-88637f4d72a5
Remove the bowl from the mixer and stir in the blueberries. You can toss the blueberries with a tablespoon of flour first if you want to make sure they don't sink to the bottom of the cake. I didn't coat them and they didn't sink.
d8f0db69-349f-42d8-a4af-88637f4d72a5
Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan, place the pan on a baking sheet, and bake for 45-55 minutes or until a toothpick in the center comes out clean.
d8f0db69-349f-42d8-a4af-88637f4d72a5
Remove the cake pan to a rack and let it cool in the pan for 10 minutes before unmolding. If using a bundt pan, unmold by placing a plate over the mouth of the pan and flipping in a quick motion.
d8f0db69-349f-42d8-a4af-88637f4d72a5 Make the lemon blueberry topping Place the blueberries in a saucepan with the sugar, ½ cup water and lemon juice and zest. Bring to boil over medium heat and let the blueberries cook, covered, until they begin to burst. Continue cooking for another 10 minutes over medium-low heat. Stir in the vanilla.
d8f0db69-349f-42d8-a4af-88637f4d72a5 Make the lemon blueberry topping Whisk the tapioca with the water and add it to the blueberry mixture, whisking as you add. The topping should thicken. Turn off the heat. This is a fairly runny topping, which we like in our home -- if you want a thicker topping, double the amount of tapioca.
d8f0db69-349f-42d8-a4af-88637f4d72a5 Make the lemon blueberry topping Pour the topping over the cooled cake, slice and serve.
eaf089cd-159e-4090-85bb-9960e8068ee0
In a large bowl, whisk the flours, spices, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Set aside.
eaf089cd-159e-4090-85bb-9960e8068ee0
Mix the almond milk and the apple cider vinegar and set aside for a couple of minutes to curdle.
eaf089cd-159e-4090-85bb-9960e8068ee0
In the bowl of a stand mixer, or with a hand mixer, beat the sugar and the oil for a minute. Then add ½ cup of the almond milk, vanilla extract, and flax meal and continue to beat for another two minutes until the mixture is quite fluffy.
eaf089cd-159e-4090-85bb-9960e8068ee0
Add the flour and the almond milk to the sugar mixture in three batches, alternating and beating for 20 seconds after each addition. Scrape down the sides and the bottom of the bowl with a spatula frequently to ensure everything is well-mixed.
eaf089cd-159e-4090-85bb-9960e8068ee0
Finally add the pumpkin puree and mix for 20 seconds.
eaf089cd-159e-4090-85bb-9960e8068ee0
Scrape the batter into an oiled and floured bundt pan.
eaf089cd-159e-4090-85bb-9960e8068ee0
Bake in a preheated oven set at 350 degrees Fahrenheit for 1 hour and 5 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center of the bundt cake comes out clean or with a few crumbs sticking to it.
eaf089cd-159e-4090-85bb-9960e8068ee0
Set on a rack to cool for 30 minutes, then unmold and continue cooling the cake on a rack.
eaf089cd-159e-4090-85bb-9960e8068ee0
I just serve this with a dusting of powdered sugar, but you could serve with whipped vegan cream or some vanilla ice cream.
b211bc0c-1708-493d-961b-3dd22c5836eb
Whisk the flour, salt and sugar in a bowl and add the butter. Cut it into the flour using a pastry cutter or a fork until you have small lumps of butter dispersed througout the dough. The butter should not melt into the flour if you want a flaky pastry, so work fast.
b211bc0c-1708-493d-961b-3dd22c5836eb
Drizzle the cold water into the bowl, a tablespoon at a time, and mix with a fork until the dough is just moistened and comes together in a ball. Do not overmix or overmoisten. You don't want to develop too much gluten in the flour because that will make your crust hard.
b211bc0c-1708-493d-961b-3dd22c5836eb
Divide the dough into two balls and wrap tightly in cling wrap, flattening the ball into a disc as you wrap. Refrigerate the two discs of dough while you make the filling.
b211bc0c-1708-493d-961b-3dd22c5836eb Make the filling: Place the fruit in a bowl and add the cinnamon, sugar, flour, lemon and salt. Stir well to mix and set aside for at least 15 minutes.
b211bc0c-1708-493d-961b-3dd22c5836eb Assemble the pie: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees.
b211bc0c-1708-493d-961b-3dd22c5836eb Assemble the pie: Take one of the discs of dough from the refrigerator and roll into a circumference about an inch larger than your pie plate (use a 9- to 10-inch pie plate for this). Place the dough into the pie plate -- it's best to fold your rolled dough into half and then lift it into the plate to keep it from tearing.
b211bc0c-1708-493d-961b-3dd22c5836eb Assemble the pie: Fit the dough into the pie pan and fold over any overhang. I prefer not to cut it out-- more crust! You can crimp the edges of your crust with your fingers or a fork for a decorative look.
b211bc0c-1708-493d-961b-3dd22c5836eb Assemble the pie: Place the pie plate in the refrigerator while you make your lattice top. To make the lattice top, roll the second disc of dough until it's slightly larger than the circumference of the top of your pie plate. Cut it into 10 equal strips using a pizza cutter or a knife or a fluted pastry wheel, if you have it.
b211bc0c-1708-493d-961b-3dd22c5836eb Assemble the pie: Place the filling inside the prepared pie plate, including any juices, and then form the lattice over the top of the filling by laying out five strips over the pie and then weaving the rest of the strips crosswise through them. It doesn't have to be perfect-- do your best and it will look great anyway. If you can't be bothered, skip the lattice and cover the pie with the rolled dough, then cut decorative vents in it to let it steam.
b211bc0c-1708-493d-961b-3dd22c5836eb Assemble the pie: Place the pie plate on a cookie sheet to catch any juices that may drip during baking, then place in the hot oven. Bake 60 minutes or until the top is golden-brown- to ensure a better color, brush on a mix of 1 tsp nondairy milk and 1 tsp oil on the top crust before placing into the oven.
b211bc0c-1708-493d-961b-3dd22c5836eb Assemble the pie: Once the pie comes out of the oven, place it on a rack and let it cool thoroughly before cutting. This can take 4-5 hours. You can slice your pie while it's still a little warm, but that could mean some of the juices may not have thickened yet and could run.
e29c0105-cf32-49e4-bd11-5dd1a5d65fef
Sift together the flour, salt, baking soda, baking powder and cinnamon.
e29c0105-cf32-49e4-bd11-5dd1a5d65fef
Beat together the oil, sugar and vanilla for about a minute to aerate.
e29c0105-cf32-49e4-bd11-5dd1a5d65fef
Add the flaxmeal mixture, beat for a few more seconds to mix, and then add the flour mixture.
e29c0105-cf32-49e4-bd11-5dd1a5d65fef
Stir with a spatula to get the ingredients well-mixed. The dough will be very stiff, but don't worry -- the apples will express juices as they bake. Add the apples and the walnuts and mix well.
e29c0105-cf32-49e4-bd11-5dd1a5d65fef
Pour the batter into an 8-inch oiled and floured square pan (or use a round cake pan if that's what you have). To make the cake easier to unmold, line the pan with parchment paper or aluminum foil and then oil and flour. (The first time I baked this cake years ago, I didn't take that extra step and unmolding this cake from the pan was a small battle.)
e29c0105-cf32-49e4-bd11-5dd1a5d65fef
Bake in a preheated 350-degree oven for 40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
e29c0105-cf32-49e4-bd11-5dd1a5d65fef
Cool on a rack for at least 10 minutes. Unmold and continue cooling.
e29c0105-cf32-49e4-bd11-5dd1a5d65fef Make the applesauce drizzle: Whisk together all of the glaze ingredients in a bowl. Drizzle over the cake just before serving. (Adding the drizzle in advance will cause it to seep into the cake, making it more moist -- it will be totally delicious, but will get too tender.)
c24ae5d9-b879-4ee0-b313-3a92ce64bbde
Make the crust:
c24ae5d9-b879-4ee0-b313-3a92ce64bbde
Place all the ingredients except the water in a glass or steel bowl. Using a fork, mix the ingredients.
c24ae5d9-b879-4ee0-b313-3a92ce64bbde
Then slowly drizzle the cold water, a tablespoon at a time, over the flour, mixing with the fork quickly until the dough starts to clear the sides of the bowl and comes together.
c24ae5d9-b879-4ee0-b313-3a92ce64bbde
Divide the dough into half and place each half in cling wrap, shaping into a disc as you wrap.
c24ae5d9-b879-4ee0-b313-3a92ce64bbde
Place both dough discs in the refrigerator for an hour at least or longer.
c24ae5d9-b879-4ee0-b313-3a92ce64bbde
Make the strawberry filling:
c24ae5d9-b879-4ee0-b313-3a92ce64bbde
Let the strawberries thaw to the point where they are no longer icy but can be cut into halves.
c24ae5d9-b879-4ee0-b313-3a92ce64bbde
Cut into halves and place in a bowl. Mix in all the other ingredients and stir thoroughly.
c24ae5d9-b879-4ee0-b313-3a92ce64bbde
Set aside for 15 minutes.
c24ae5d9-b879-4ee0-b313-3a92ce64bbde
Put your pie together:
c24ae5d9-b879-4ee0-b313-3a92ce64bbde
Preheat the oven to 425 degrees.
c24ae5d9-b879-4ee0-b313-3a92ce64bbde
Take one of the discs of dough and roll it out to about 12 inches, using as much flour as you need to keep it from sticking to the surface. Keep moving the dough as you roll it to ensure it does not stick.
c24ae5d9-b879-4ee0-b313-3a92ce64bbde
Fold into half and lift into a 9-inch pie pan (regular, not deep-dish).
c24ae5d9-b879-4ee0-b313-3a92ce64bbde
Unfold the dough and fit it into the pie pan. Fold any overhanging dough under itself so you have a neat-looking crust.
c24ae5d9-b879-4ee0-b313-3a92ce64bbde
Pour the filling into the crust. Place the pie pan into the refrigerator while you prepare the top crust using the second disc of dough.
c24ae5d9-b879-4ee0-b313-3a92ce64bbde
If you are making just a regular, covered pie, roll the disc out so it is slightly bigger than the diameter of the dish. Place on top of the pie dish and with your fingers or with a fork crimp the edges to seal them. Cut four slits at the top of the pie, preferably in a cross pattern.
c24ae5d9-b879-4ee0-b313-3a92ce64bbde
If you are making a lattice crust, cut the dough into strips and then weave them into a lattice top following
c24ae5d9-b879-4ee0-b313-3a92ce64bbde
these instructions
c24ae5d9-b879-4ee0-b313-3a92ce64bbde
If you want to make a crust like the one I did, use a small cookie cutter in any shape (you can even use fun animal shapes if you have kids) to cut out little pieces of the dough. Keep them on a cold baking sheet while you cut out the others. Gather the scraps, roll out the dough, and cut more shapes until you have exhausted the dough.
c24ae5d9-b879-4ee0-b313-3a92ce64bbde
Arrange the shapes on top of the strawberries in a decorative pattern-- I arranged them in concentric circles.
c24ae5d9-b879-4ee0-b313-3a92ce64bbde
Sprinkle 1 tbsp of sugar on the crust. This gives some additional sweetness and helps the crust brown.
c24ae5d9-b879-4ee0-b313-3a92ce64bbde
Place the pie pan on a baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes. Then lower the heat to 400 degrees and bake another 30 minutes. Once more lower the heat to 350 degrees and cook 20 more minutes or until the juices have thickened and are bubbling.
c24ae5d9-b879-4ee0-b313-3a92ce64bbde
Remove the pie pan to a rack and cool thoroughly before cutting and serving. Because of the tartness of the strawberries, this pie would be great with some vegan whipped cream.
87ef3acb-d87d-4c30-95d3-53df785dc158
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
87ef3acb-d87d-4c30-95d3-53df785dc158
Prepare an 8 X 8 baking pan by lining with parchment paper.
87ef3acb-d87d-4c30-95d3-53df785dc158
Place all of the ingredients for the cookie base or crust in a food processor and pulse a few times until the dough comes together. Press the dough into the prepared baking pan using your fingers, until you have an even layer. It can be a little annoying to work with the parchment paper sliding under your fingers, but you'll get there. Don't worry if the top isn't perfectly smooth-- you'll be pouring the topping over it.
87ef3acb-d87d-4c30-95d3-53df785dc158
Place the baking pan in the oven and bake the crust for 15 minutes.
87ef3acb-d87d-4c30-95d3-53df785dc158
While the crust is baking, make the topping by placing all ingredients except the pecans in a saucepan. Stir to help the sugar melt. Let the mixture reach a boil, continue to let it boil for a minute, then turn off the heat and add the pecans.
87ef3acb-d87d-4c30-95d3-53df785dc158
Pour the pecan topping evenly over the baked crust and return to the oven for 15 more minutes.
87ef3acb-d87d-4c30-95d3-53df785dc158
Remove the baking pan and cool it thoroughly on a rack. You can cut the bars at this point, or transfer the baking pan to a refrigerator and let it cool for at least a couple of hours before cutting.
16a65575-875b-4fd2-9c73-d61c4f4ab1e0
Place 22 Oreos in the food processor with the melted butter or oil. Process or pulse until the cookies are broken down into very fine crumbs.
16a65575-875b-4fd2-9c73-d61c4f4ab1e0
Press the Oreo crust into a pie pan and freeze for at least an hour.
16a65575-875b-4fd2-9c73-d61c4f4ab1e0
Make the filling by placing the cream cheese, peanut butter, vanilla and maple syrup in a food processor. Once the ingredients are mixed, open the food processor tube and whip for another two minutes to make the filling fluffy.
16a65575-875b-4fd2-9c73-d61c4f4ab1e0
Scrape the filling into the prepared pie crust, smooth the top, then crumble on the remaining Oreos. You can skip the Oreos and use another cookie or candy to make this your own.
16a65575-875b-4fd2-9c73-d61c4f4ab1e0
Freeze another hour, then slice and serve
afa2da90-a07a-4c7b-984f-564c48c2bf87 Make the vegan banana cake: Mix the nondairy milk with the apple cider vinegar and set aside for a minute.
afa2da90-a07a-4c7b-984f-564c48c2bf87 Make the vegan banana cake: Combine the flour, baking soda, baking powder and salt in a bowl.
afa2da90-a07a-4c7b-984f-564c48c2bf87 Make the vegan banana cake: Beat together the oil and sugar with a handheld mixer or in a stand mixer or with a whisk for about two minutes.
afa2da90-a07a-4c7b-984f-564c48c2bf87 Make the vegan banana cake: Add the nondairy milk and beat until just mixed.
afa2da90-a07a-4c7b-984f-564c48c2bf87 Make the vegan banana cake: Add the mashed bananas and applesauce and beat in. Make sure there are no big lumps.
afa2da90-a07a-4c7b-984f-564c48c2bf87 Make the vegan banana cake: Add the flour to the sugar-banana mixture in two batches, mixing well after each addition until the mixture is smooth. Don't overdo it.
afa2da90-a07a-4c7b-984f-564c48c2bf87 Make the vegan banana cake: Line the bottom of two 9-inch cake pans with parchment or wax paper. Oil and flour the pans.
afa2da90-a07a-4c7b-984f-564c48c2bf87 Make the vegan banana cake: Divide the batter equally between the two pans and bake 25-30 minutes in a 350-degree oven until a toothpick inserted in the center of each cake comes out clean.
afa2da90-a07a-4c7b-984f-564c48c2bf87 Make the vegan banana cake: Place on a rack to cool, about 10 minutes. Unmold, peel off the parchment paper, and leave on the rack to cool thoroughly before frosting.
afa2da90-a07a-4c7b-984f-564c48c2bf87 Make the vegan peanut butter frosting: Have the peanut butter and vegan butter at room temperature. Place them in a bowl and mix with a handheld or stand mixer or whisk until everything's combined and smooth.
afa2da90-a07a-4c7b-984f-564c48c2bf87 Make the vegan peanut butter frosting: Add the sugar ½ cup at a time, beating in well after each addition. Confectioner's sugar can lump up sometimes, in that case pass the sugar through a sieve. If the frosting feels stiff, add in some nondairy milk, a tablespoon at a time, beating after each addition, until you have a smooth, frosting-like consistency
afa2da90-a07a-4c7b-984f-564c48c2bf87 Assemble the cake: Place one cake on a cake stand or flat dish. Put about ⅓rd of the frosting (recipe follows) in the center of the cake and using a spatula spread it evenly across the surface.
afa2da90-a07a-4c7b-984f-564c48c2bf87 Assemble the cake: Carefully place the second cake on top of the first one. Put the remaining icing in the center of the cake and evenly frost the top and sides.
afa2da90-a07a-4c7b-984f-564c48c2bf87 Assemble the cake: Garnish with chopped, roasted peanuts.
a2ef462d-2b91-4061-9961-4f2ca81df94c Make the filling: Mix the cinnamon and sugar in a bowl and set aside.
a2ef462d-2b91-4061-9961-4f2ca81df94c Make the streusel: In another bowl, mix the flour, cinnamon, butter and sugar until everything comes together. Set aside.
a2ef462d-2b91-4061-9961-4f2ca81df94c Make the cake: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
a2ef462d-2b91-4061-9961-4f2ca81df94c Make the cake: Prepare a large baking pan (mine is a round one, about 11 inches in diameter, but a rectangular 9 X 13 inch pan would be fine).
a2ef462d-2b91-4061-9961-4f2ca81df94c Make the cake: Mix the flour with the baking soda, baking powder and salt in a bowl and set aside.
a2ef462d-2b91-4061-9961-4f2ca81df94c Make the cake: Mix the nondairy milk and apple cider vinegar and set aside to curdle.
a2ef462d-2b91-4061-9961-4f2ca81df94c Make the cake: In a large bowl or the bowl of a stand mixer, beat the sugar with the oil and applesauce using the whisk attachment until everything is well mixed, about a minute. Add the aquafaba and beat on medium-high speed for another two minutes. The mixture will look curdled but don't worry.
a2ef462d-2b91-4061-9961-4f2ca81df94c Make the cake: Add the vanilla and nondairy milk to the bowl, mix, and then add the flour in three batches. Make sure everything is mixed well and scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl after each addition.
a2ef462d-2b91-4061-9961-4f2ca81df94c Make the cake: Pour half the batter into the prepared pan. Sprinkle the cinnamon filling over the batter and use a knife to gently swirl it into the batter. Now pour the remaining batter over the top of the filling. Scatter the prepared streusel over the top evenly.
a2ef462d-2b91-4061-9961-4f2ca81df94c Make the cake: Bake the cake in the preheated oven for 50-55 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean or with crumbs sticking to it.
a2ef462d-2b91-4061-9961-4f2ca81df94c Make the cake: Remove the cake from the rack and allow it to cool.
a2ef462d-2b91-4061-9961-4f2ca81df94c Make the glaze: While the cake is cooling, place all ingredients for the glaze-- the cashews, the milk, vanilla, cinnamon and sugar -- in a blender and blend into a very, very smooth paste.
a2ef462d-2b91-4061-9961-4f2ca81df94c Make the glaze: Drizzle the glaze over the cooled cake. Cut and serve the cake right out of the pan.
5f01a5cc-2545-4eee-8d34-8af2af7cfea6 Make the pie crust: Place 1 ¼ cups of unbleached all purpose flour in a bowl. Mix in 1 tablespoon of sugar and ¼ teaspoon of salt. Then cut in 8 tablespoons of very cold vegan butter into the flour.
5f01a5cc-2545-4eee-8d34-8af2af7cfea6 Make the pie crust: Once the butter’s been incorporated into the flour, drizzle in very cold, iced water into the bowl slowly, mixing with your fork at the same time, until the dough comes together into a ball.
5f01a5cc-2545-4eee-8d34-8af2af7cfea6 Make the pie crust: Lift it out of the bowl and into a sheet of cling wrap. Wrap it tight, and shape the dough into a disc by patting it with your fingers. Try not to handle the dough as much as possible because your body heat is not kind to a pie crust. You want those buttery pockets to stay intact, remember, so your crust gets flaky, not dense. Refrigerate the crust for at least 30 minutes.
5f01a5cc-2545-4eee-8d34-8af2af7cfea6 Make the pie crust: Form the dough into a disc and put it in the refrigerator while you get the rest of the ingredients ready.
5f01a5cc-2545-4eee-8d34-8af2af7cfea6 Make the apple filling: Melt the vegan butter in a skillet (if you plan to bake the entire tart in a skillet, a 10-inch cast-iron skillet works best).
5f01a5cc-2545-4eee-8d34-8af2af7cfea6 Make the apple filling: Once the butter’s melted, sprinkle one cup of sugar into the pan. Then add in five sliced apples. It may seem like a lot to begin with, but the apples will soften and settle down as they release their juices. At this stage I add in a small pinch of salt to help them do that.
5f01a5cc-2545-4eee-8d34-8af2af7cfea6 Make the apple filling: Stir the apples gently into the butter, trying not to break them. Continue to cook the apples over medium-high heat for about 10 minutes, turning them over gently every now and then, until the apples are softened and have released their juices. Turn off the heat.
5f01a5cc-2545-4eee-8d34-8af2af7cfea6 Make the apple filling: When I’m using a cake tin, I butter the tin and line the bottom with parchment paper for extra insurance. You don’t have to use the parchment because the tarte tatin does slide out quite easily when it’s still quite warm, but do butter the pan.
5f01a5cc-2545-4eee-8d34-8af2af7cfea6 Make the apple filling: Using tongs, lift out the apple slices and arrange them in circles around the pan, overlapping them slightly. You should have enough apples to make two layers. Pour the juice remaining in the saucepan evenly over the apples. If you’re going to continue baking in the skillet, you can just leave your apples free-form because arranging them into a pattern in a hot skillet will be tougher — you’ll have a more rustic-looking but still very pretty tart.
5f01a5cc-2545-4eee-8d34-8af2af7cfea6 Assemble the tart: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees.
5f01a5cc-2545-4eee-8d34-8af2af7cfea6 Assemble the tart: Flour the countertop and roll out the pastry dough into a circle slightly larger than the diameter of your cake pan or skillet. Make sure you keep moving your dough as you roll, flouring the surface more if needed, so the dough doesn’t stick to the countertop. Once your dough is rolled out, if you want a more finished look, try and cut any rough edges away with a knife. I have two cake tins of the same size, so I use the other as a guide.
5f01a5cc-2545-4eee-8d34-8af2af7cfea6 Assemble the tart: Gently lift your pastry dough (easiest way to do this is to fold it once, and then once more before lifting), and carefully place it on top of the apples. Unfold it and if it is slightly larger than the cake tin, just gently fold in the edges. If you’re doing this in your skillet be careful — the skillet’s hot and you don’t want to burn yourself!
5f01a5cc-2545-4eee-8d34-8af2af7cfea6 Assemble the tart: Place the cake pan or the skillet in the oven and bake 35 minutes. The puff pastry should be a light gold when you remove the tart from the oven.Let the pan or skillet cool on a rack for 30 minutes. Then run a knife along the sides of the pan to loosen the tart and place a dish on top of the pan. In a quick motion, invert the pan — the tart should drop quite easily into the plate.
5f01a5cc-2545-4eee-8d34-8af2af7cfea6 Assemble the tart: Remove the pan and the parchment, if it comes off with the tart. If any of the apple slices have gone askew, just rearrange them. Et voila.If you baked your tart in a skillet, be careful when you invert the tart because the skillet is still quite warm. Use oven mitts when doing this.
5f01a5cc-2545-4eee-8d34-8af2af7cfea6 Assemble the tart: Let the tart cool thoroughly before serving.
b134ac0a-d99f-478a-a698-a9f6dc6c62b6 Make the crust: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
b134ac0a-d99f-478a-a698-a9f6dc6c62b6 Make the crust: Pulse 1 cup of graham crackers with 1 cup of walnuts in a food processor with 2 tbsp of softened vegan butter until the nuts are broken down but not powdery.
b134ac0a-d99f-478a-a698-a9f6dc6c62b6 Make the crust: Press the crust into an even layer in the bottom of a 10-inch springform pan, place the pan on a baking sheet, and bake the crust for 10 minutes. Remove and set aside while you make the filling.
b134ac0a-d99f-478a-a698-a9f6dc6c62b6 Make the crust: Make the mango cheesecake filling:
b134ac0a-d99f-478a-a698-a9f6dc6c62b6 Make the crust: Blend ½ cup of cashews with ½ cup of any nondairy milk until very creamy.
b134ac0a-d99f-478a-a698-a9f6dc6c62b6 Make the crust: In a bowl or in the bowl of a stand mixer, beat 20 oz of room temperature vegan cream cheese with 1 cup sugar until well-mixed. Add the cashew cream, 1 tsp green cardamom powder, 3 tbsp of cornstarch and the mango puree. Mix until you have a very smooth, creamy texture.
b134ac0a-d99f-478a-a698-a9f6dc6c62b6 Make the crust: Before you start baking the cake, place a small, ovenproof pan filled with water on a lower shelf of the oven. Pour the mango filling into the springform pan which should still be standing on a baking sheet (to make it easier to get the pan in and out of the oven).
b134ac0a-d99f-478a-a698-a9f6dc6c62b6 Make the crust: Place the pan and baking sheet into the oven and bake 30 minutes, then lower the heat to 325 degrees and continue baking another 30 minutes.
b134ac0a-d99f-478a-a698-a9f6dc6c62b6 Make the crust: When the cheesecake is done, the sides will look firm and the center might still look slightly jiggly, which is okay.
b134ac0a-d99f-478a-a698-a9f6dc6c62b6 Make the crust: Make the sour cream topping:
b134ac0a-d99f-478a-a698-a9f6dc6c62b6 Make the crust: About 15 minutes before the cake comes out of the oven, blend 1 cup of vegan sour cream with ¼ cup sugar and ½ tsp of cardamom.
b134ac0a-d99f-478a-a698-a9f6dc6c62b6 Make the crust: As soon as the cake comes out of the pan, pour the filling on the cake and, using oven mitts, gently tilt the pan around so the topping is evenly distributed over the cake. Return the cake to the oven and continue baking another 15 minutes.
b134ac0a-d99f-478a-a698-a9f6dc6c62b6 Make the crust: Remove the cake from the oven and let it cook thoroughly on a rack. Once cool, run a knife gently along the edges to loosen the cake from the pan. Then, with the cheesecake still inside the pan, refrigerate it for several hours or overnight until thoroughly chilled.
b134ac0a-d99f-478a-a698-a9f6dc6c62b6 Make the crust: Unmold, slice and eat.
94435c01-4229-40ea-8fc0-04bd3f12a7df Make the cake: Place the orange juice, sugar, oil, vinegar and vanilla in a large bowl or in the bowl of a stand mixer. Use a whisk or the whisk attachment of the stand mixer to mix for one minute or until everything appears to be well-mixed.
94435c01-4229-40ea-8fc0-04bd3f12a7df Make the cake: Add the baking soda, salt and flour to the bowl and mix. Scrape down the sides of the pan after 20 seconds of mixing and mix for 20 seconds more, but no longer.
94435c01-4229-40ea-8fc0-04bd3f12a7df Make the cake: Spray two 8- or 9-inch cake pans with cooking spray or oil. Preferably line the bottom with parchment paper, or, if you don't have this, flour the pans. Divide the batter equally between the two pans.
94435c01-4229-40ea-8fc0-04bd3f12a7df Make the cake: Bake the cakes in a 350-degree oven for 30-35 minutes until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
94435c01-4229-40ea-8fc0-04bd3f12a7df Make the cake: Cool on a rack for 10 minutes, then slide a thin knife around the edges of each cake
94435c01-4229-40ea-8fc0-04bd3f12a7df Make the cake: Gently flip each cake onto a plate, slide onto a rack, and continue cooling before you frost.
94435c01-4229-40ea-8fc0-04bd3f12a7df Make the frosting: Place the orange marmalade, vanilla and butter in a bowl or the bowl of a stand mixer. Beat until combined, around 30 seconds.
94435c01-4229-40ea-8fc0-04bd3f12a7df Make the frosting: Add the powdered sugar, half a cup at a time, incorporating well into the butter mixture after each addition. Your frosting should be smooth, creamy and fluffy.
94435c01-4229-40ea-8fc0-04bd3f12a7df Assemble the cake: Place one of the cakes, on a plate or cake stand. Dump half of the frosting on the cake, use an offset spatula or knife to spread it evenly, then place the second cake on top, taking care to ensure they line up evenly. Spread the remaining frosting evenly over the top of the cake, using anything that remains for the sides.
94435c01-4229-40ea-8fc0-04bd3f12a7df Assemble the cake: Slice and serve.
244e5a38-6a7d-4aea-ba67-5b0b2cda9690
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
244e5a38-6a7d-4aea-ba67-5b0b2cda9690
In a bowl, mix the flour, baking soda, baking powder, cornstarch, and salt.
244e5a38-6a7d-4aea-ba67-5b0b2cda9690
In a larger bowl, mix the oil, sugar, yogurt, vanilla extract, and lemon juice and zest until combined.
244e5a38-6a7d-4aea-ba67-5b0b2cda9690
Add the flour to the wet mixture in three batches, mixing thoroughly with a spatula after each addition. Make sure you scrape the bottom and sides of the bowl after each addition.
244e5a38-6a7d-4aea-ba67-5b0b2cda9690
Prepare a bundt pan by spraying with cooking spray. Pour the batter evenly into the bundt pan. Place it in the oven and bake 50-60 minutes or until a skewer inserted in the center of the cake comes out clean.
244e5a38-6a7d-4aea-ba67-5b0b2cda9690
Place the bundt pan on a rack and unmold the cake after 10 minutes. It should come out very easily, but if you need help, run a knife gently along the edges.
244e5a38-6a7d-4aea-ba67-5b0b2cda9690
Prepare the syrup by melting the sugar with the lemon juice. Poke some holes into the bundt cake with a toothpick, and drizzle on the syrup. Let the cake cool thoroughly.
244e5a38-6a7d-4aea-ba67-5b0b2cda9690
Once the cake has cooled, prepare the glaze by mixing the confectioners' sugar with the lemon juice. Drizzle it over the bundt cake, and reserve some glaze to drizzle over individual slices.
b9ad144e-39a5-4a69-9995-2802cc0976bf Make the dough for the wrapper: Mix the flour, carom seeds, oil and salt in a large bowl or in a stand mixer.
b9ad144e-39a5-4a69-9995-2802cc0976bf Make the dough for the wrapper: Add water, half a cup at first and then a tablespoon at a time, and knead until you have a very stiff dough. You want to be very sure your dough is very stiff and not soft. Cover the dough and set aside while you make the filling
b9ad144e-39a5-4a69-9995-2802cc0976bf Make the peas potato filling: Crumble the potatoes with your fingers so you have a few lumps -- you don't want to mash these like you would if you were making mashed potatoes. You want some texture in here.
b9ad144e-39a5-4a69-9995-2802cc0976bf Make the peas potato filling: Heat the oil.
b9ad144e-39a5-4a69-9995-2802cc0976bf Make the peas potato filling: Add the cumin seeds and, as they start to brown, add the ginger.
b9ad144e-39a5-4a69-9995-2802cc0976bf Make the peas potato filling: Saute the ginger for 30 seconds, the add the coriander leaves and the green chili pepper. Saute for a few seconds.
b9ad144e-39a5-4a69-9995-2802cc0976bf Make the peas potato filling: Add the coriander powder, turmeric, pomegranate seed powder and chaat masala (or lemon juice if you're using that instead). Stir to mix.
b9ad144e-39a5-4a69-9995-2802cc0976bf Make the peas potato filling: Add the potatoes and mix well.
b9ad144e-39a5-4a69-9995-2802cc0976bf Make the peas potato filling: Add the peas and stir-fry until the peas are tender and the mixture is very dry, about two to three more minutes.
b9ad144e-39a5-4a69-9995-2802cc0976bf Make the peas potato filling: Add salt to taste. Turn off the heat and let the filling cool slightly.
b9ad144e-39a5-4a69-9995-2802cc0976bf Make the samosas: Divide the dough into 7 equal balls.
b9ad144e-39a5-4a69-9995-2802cc0976bf Make the samosas: Roll out each ball into an oval, about six inches long and four inches wide. Use some oil to coat the countertop if needed to keep the dough from sticking.
b9ad144e-39a5-4a69-9995-2802cc0976bf Make the samosas: Using a pizza cutter, cut across the long side of the oval to create two semicircular pieces.
b9ad144e-39a5-4a69-9995-2802cc0976bf Make the samosas: Coat the edges of each semicircle with water.
b9ad144e-39a5-4a69-9995-2802cc0976bf Make the samosas: Pick the two corners of the semicircle and bring them together, edges overlapping slightly, to form a cone. Press down on the seam to stick it. It's important to do this thoroughly because you don't want your samosas to open while you're frying them.
b9ad144e-39a5-4a69-9995-2802cc0976bf Make the samosas: Inside the cone, place a few teaspoons of the filling.
b9ad144e-39a5-4a69-9995-2802cc0976bf Make the samosas: Now seal the top of the samosa by pressing the top seam together and back.
b9ad144e-39a5-4a69-9995-2802cc0976bf Make the samosas: Repeat for remaining 13 samosas.
b9ad144e-39a5-4a69-9995-2802cc0976bf Make the samosas: In a wok or a frying pan, heat three inches of oil.
b9ad144e-39a5-4a69-9995-2802cc0976bf Make the samosas: When the oil reaches 300 degrees Fahrenheit, drop the samosas, one at a time, taking care not to crowd the pan or you'll end up bringing the oil temperature down very fast. I have an eight-inch wok and I fry three samosas at a time.
b9ad144e-39a5-4a69-9995-2802cc0976bf Make the samosas: Fry the samosas, turning over occasionally, until they are golden-brown.
b9ad144e-39a5-4a69-9995-2802cc0976bf Make the samosas: Drain on paper towels before serving with a date-tamarind chutney.
d4d6da66-7537-4f8e-b9d9-4a679580e2d7
Place the potatoes in a bowl with all of the ingredients and mix well, kneading with your fingers or a fork.
d4d6da66-7537-4f8e-b9d9-4a679580e2d7
Shape the tikkis into discs and pat the sides to make them even. I like to make my tikkis about an inch and a half in diameter.
d4d6da66-7537-4f8e-b9d9-4a679580e2d7
Heat the oil in a skillet. You don't need a lot but you should have enough to coat the bottom of the skillet evenly. If you make sure that your oil is hot enough that the tikki sizzles and sputters as soon as you place it in the skillet, your tikkis won't absorb much oil.
d4d6da66-7537-4f8e-b9d9-4a679580e2d7
Working in batches, and making sure not to crowd them, fry the tikkis until they are golden brown, first on one side then the other.
d4d6da66-7537-4f8e-b9d9-4a679580e2d7
Serve hot with any green chutney or tamarind chutney.
0fc0fbb3-649d-4b3a-9f61-238b6ddcacc7
Mix together all the ingredients and add just enough water so they hold together.
0fc0fbb3-649d-4b3a-9f61-238b6ddcacc7
Heat oil, about 1 ½ inches deep, in a pan.
0fc0fbb3-649d-4b3a-9f61-238b6ddcacc7
When the oil reaches about 350-375 degrees, lower the heat to about medium and drop about a tablespoon of the mixture, one at a time, into the oil. Don't worry about shaping the pakoras which should be rather shapeless. Also, don't crowd the pan.
0fc0fbb3-649d-4b3a-9f61-238b6ddcacc7
Deep-fry each pakora on both sides until golden-brown. This should take 4-5 minutes. If they brown too fast, lower the heat because the outside will get cooked and the inside will remain raw.
f95aef16-3e12-4306-9926-3897cef83718
Cook the potatoes in the microwave in a bowl of water, or on the stovetop by covering with water, until they are fork-tender. When cool enough to handle, drain the potatoes and coarsely mash them with a fork.
f95aef16-3e12-4306-9926-3897cef83718 Make the tamarind chutney: Place all the ingredients in a blender with ¼ cup water and blend into a smooth paste. If the paste is too thick, add a little more water.
f95aef16-3e12-4306-9926-3897cef83718 Make the green chutney: Place all ingredients in the blender with 2 tbsp water and blend into a smooth paste. Again, add more water if too thick, a teaspoon at a time.
f95aef16-3e12-4306-9926-3897cef83718 Make the bread pakora: Place the chickpea flour in a bowl along with the cayenne, turmeric and salt. Use a whisk to mix as you drizzle in enough water to make a runny batter that should coat the back of a spoon.
f95aef16-3e12-4306-9926-3897cef83718 Make the bread pakora: Heat the oil for frying in a flat-bottomed skillet. I use a skillet just large enough to hold the sandwich, so I can use less oil.
f95aef16-3e12-4306-9926-3897cef83718 Make the bread pakora: To the mashed potatoes, add a couple of tablespoons of the tamarind chutney, the chaat masala, and salt to taste. Mix well.
f95aef16-3e12-4306-9926-3897cef83718 Make the bread pakora: Smear some green chutney on a slice of bread, and some tamarind chutney on the other slice. Place a thick layer of potato stuffing on one of the slices and cover with the other. The potato will help glue them together.
f95aef16-3e12-4306-9926-3897cef83718 Make the bread pakora: Dip the prepared sandwich into the chickpea batter, making sure you coat it thoroughly. Shake off the excess batter and place in the hot oil. Fry on each side until golden-brown. Repeat for the remaining three sandwiches.
f95aef16-3e12-4306-9926-3897cef83718 Make the bread pakora: Remove to a cutting board and cut the pakora diagonally into two triangles. You can also cut it into rectangles or squares.
f95aef16-3e12-4306-9926-3897cef83718 Make the bread pakora: Serve with any remaining green chutney drizzled on top.
f4c610b2-deed-479c-9e01-e5d9a2ec2fc4 Make the samosa wrapper dough: Mix all the ingredients except the water in a large bowl. Trickle in the water and mix into a stiff but smooth dough. Set aside in an air-tight tin for at least half an hour.
f4c610b2-deed-479c-9e01-e5d9a2ec2fc4 Make the samosa wrapper dough: Make the samosa filling:
f4c610b2-deed-479c-9e01-e5d9a2ec2fc4 Make the samosa wrapper dough: Heat the oil. Add the onions and saute until brown spots appear.
f4c610b2-deed-479c-9e01-e5d9a2ec2fc4 Make the samosa wrapper dough: Add the ginger garlic paste and stir-fry for 30 seconds.
f4c610b2-deed-479c-9e01-e5d9a2ec2fc4 Make the samosa wrapper dough: Add the tomato ketchup, mix, add the garam masala, coriander and cumin powders, soy sauce, turmeric, paprika, and cayenne, if using. Stir well to mix.
f4c610b2-deed-479c-9e01-e5d9a2ec2fc4 Make the samosa wrapper dough: Add the carrots and potatoes and stir to mix. Saute for a couple of minutes.
f4c610b2-deed-479c-9e01-e5d9a2ec2fc4 Make the samosa wrapper dough: Add the TVP. Mix well, then cover and let the filling cook until all the water has dried up. Once the TVP starts sticking slightly to the bottom, you will be done.
f4c610b2-deed-479c-9e01-e5d9a2ec2fc4 Make the samosa wrapper dough: Add the green peas and let them warm through until tender.
f4c610b2-deed-479c-9e01-e5d9a2ec2fc4 Make the samosa wrapper dough: Add salt if needed, coriander leaves, and lemon juice. Mix well and turn off the heat. There should be no visible moisture in the filling.
f4c610b2-deed-479c-9e01-e5d9a2ec2fc4 Make the samosa cover: Divide the dough into 24 pieces. If you want bigger samosas, you can just make fewer pieces. It won't change the baking time. Or do as I did and make a few big ones and a few small ones.
f4c610b2-deed-479c-9e01-e5d9a2ec2fc4 Make the samosa cover: Roll each piece of dough into a smooth ball. Then roll it out, using enough flour, into a very thin circle, about three to four inches in diameter.
f4c610b2-deed-479c-9e01-e5d9a2ec2fc4 Make the samosa cover: Moisten the edges of each circle. Place a heaping tablespoon of filling in the center of each of the circles, then fold over to form a half-moon shape. Press down on the edges to seal. The dough will stretch a bit and help you along, but don't tear it. You can also shape these in the traditional samosa shape. .
f4c610b2-deed-479c-9e01-e5d9a2ec2fc4 Make the samosa cover: Press down on the edges with a fork to seal it tight.
f4c610b2-deed-479c-9e01-e5d9a2ec2fc4 Make the samosa cover: Place the samosas on baking sheets sprayed with oil. Spray or brush some oil on the top of the samosas which will help them crisp up and also give them a nice color.
f4c610b2-deed-479c-9e01-e5d9a2ec2fc4 Make the samosa cover: Bake in a 350-degree preheated oven for 45 minutes or until the edges are lightly brown and crispy.
f4c610b2-deed-479c-9e01-e5d9a2ec2fc4 Make the samosa cover: Let stand on a rack for five minutes, then serve hot with chutney.
6be1ec45-15e0-4100-9e17-e788c99d0a6f
Place the tofu in a baking dish or a dish large enough to hold all six slices, then slather on the first marinade, spreading it evenly. Let the tofu stand for an hour in the marinade.
6be1ec45-15e0-4100-9e17-e788c99d0a6f
Make the second marinade by mixing all the ingredients together. Slather the second marinade on to the tofu slices, again making sure you spread it evenly. Let the tofu stand for at least 15 more minutes.
6be1ec45-15e0-4100-9e17-e788c99d0a6f
While the tofu is marinating for the second time, preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Place the tofu on a baking sheet covered with parchment paper or tinfoil and bake 40 minutes, turning over once halfway through baking.
6be1ec45-15e0-4100-9e17-e788c99d0a6f
Once the tofu has baked 40 minutes, turn the broiler on to 500 degrees. Broil the tofu for another 3-5 minutes or until some black spots appear on it.
6be1ec45-15e0-4100-9e17-e788c99d0a6f
Remove from the oven, let the tofu stand for five minutes, then serve.
644c5913-1bdf-4352-a68a-cfd291858a60
Place the flaxmeal, cornstarch, paprika, ginger and garlic along with the water and salt to taste in a blender and blend into a very smooth paste.
644c5913-1bdf-4352-a68a-cfd291858a60
Place the cauliflower florets in a very large bowl and pour the cornstarch mixture over the florets. Using your hands or a spoon, toss the cauliflower in the mixture until thoroughly coated. Let it stand 20 minutes for the flavors to penetrate the cauliflower.
644c5913-1bdf-4352-a68a-cfd291858a60
Preheat the oven to 450 degrees. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and spray with oil. Place the cauliflower florets on the baking sheet in a single layer.
644c5913-1bdf-4352-a68a-cfd291858a60
Bake the cauliflower for 20 to 25 minutes or until the florets are tender enough but have a slight bite. You don't want the florets to be too soft.
644c5913-1bdf-4352-a68a-cfd291858a60
In a large wok, heat the coconut oil.
644c5913-1bdf-4352-a68a-cfd291858a60
Add the mustard seeds and when they sputter, add the curry leaves and green chili pepper, if using. Saute for a minute.
644c5913-1bdf-4352-a68a-cfd291858a60
Add the roasted cauliflower florets and toss in the mustard oil. Squeeze on the lemon juice and mix. Turn off the heat.
644c5913-1bdf-4352-a68a-cfd291858a60
I love to serve this with some sliced raw onion on the side.
14deec45-4b08-46f3-b4ec-54c67cff3f57
To make the filling, place each boiled potato on a chopping board and use a heavy fork to mash the potato (the way you would if you were making smashed potatoes), then cut into small bits. You want your potato filling to be a crumbly, semi-mashed mix for an authentic filling, not cut in a neat dice.
14deec45-4b08-46f3-b4ec-54c67cff3f57
Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F.
14deec45-4b08-46f3-b4ec-54c67cff3f57
Heat the oil in a skillet. Add the cumin seeds and as they darken and become fragrant, add the onions, ginger, garlic and green cilantro, chili peppers or red pepper flakes. Stir to mix and saute until the onions turn translucent and start to change color.
14deec45-4b08-46f3-b4ec-54c67cff3f57
Add the turmeric, stir it in, then add the crumbly potatoes and salt and lemon juice. Mix well and saute for a couple of minutes, then turn off the heat. Your potato mixture should be very dry.
14deec45-4b08-46f3-b4ec-54c67cff3f57
To make the pastry squares, place one puff pastry sheet on the countertop. Use the folds in the puff pastry as a guide to cut into three strips. Cut each strip further into three equal squares. You should have eighteen squares in all -- nine from each sheet.
14deec45-4b08-46f3-b4ec-54c67cff3f57
Use water to moisten one of the pastry squares along the edges. Place a couple of tablespoons of filling in the middle. The more crumbly your filling is, the more you'll be able to accommodate on the square. Take another pastry square and place it over the filling and press the edges of the top and bottom squares together with your fingers to seal them, making a pocket. Use the tines of a fork to press down on the edges -- this also creates a decorative pattern. Use a sharp knife to cut a cross on the top of the square.
14deec45-4b08-46f3-b4ec-54c67cff3f57
Continue doing this for the remaining pastry and filling. Then place the squares on a baking sheet, at least an inch apart. Bake in the preheated oven 15 minutes until gold and crispy. You can brush on some vegetable oil on the tops of the squares before baking for a deeper gold color to your puff pastry squares.
14deec45-4b08-46f3-b4ec-54c67cff3f57
Serve hot or warm or at room temperature. To reheat, heat the oven to 350 degrees and pop in for 2-3 minutes or until hot. These will keep in the refrigerator for about a week.
ddb7d81d-e8f5-4858-a142-bbfaff2c6ee8
Mix all the ingredients well.
ddb7d81d-e8f5-4858-a142-bbfaff2c6ee8
Heat the oil in a pan wide enough to deep-fry in. If possible, use a thermometer to ensure it reaches between 350 and 375 degrees before you begin to fry.
ddb7d81d-e8f5-4858-a142-bbfaff2c6ee8
Make a ball of the potato dough, about ¾ of an inch in diameter, and place it on your fingers.
ddb7d81d-e8f5-4858-a142-bbfaff2c6ee8
Using the thumb of the same hand, flatten it out into a disc, about 1 ½ inches wide.
ddb7d81d-e8f5-4858-a142-bbfaff2c6ee8
Slip the wadas into the oil, as many as the pan will take at a time without becoming overcrowded.
ddb7d81d-e8f5-4858-a142-bbfaff2c6ee8
Fry each side until golden-brown.
ddb7d81d-e8f5-4858-a142-bbfaff2c6ee8
Serve hot with chutney or just enjoy by itself.
2e41f460-be5d-46e4-9bd8-8b46aba53a27
In a dry saucepan or cast iron skillet, roast the garlic, skin on, for a couple of minutes, turning over once, until slightly soft. Peel and place in a blender with the soaked chilies and ½ cup of water or the soaking liquid. Blend until smooth and set aside.
2e41f460-be5d-46e4-9bd8-8b46aba53a27
In a large wok or saucepan, heat the oil. Add the mustard seeds and when they sputter, add the fenugreek and fennel seeds and turmeric. Stir for half a minute, then add the potatoes.
2e41f460-be5d-46e4-9bd8-8b46aba53a27
Stir well to coat the potatoes with the spices. Turn the heat to medium and place a tight-fitting lid on the pan. Pour some water over the lid (a rimmed lid works best for this-- the water on the lid helps the potatoes steam without sticking or burning). Cook the potatoes for 15 minutes or until they are fork-tender but not mushy.
2e41f460-be5d-46e4-9bd8-8b46aba53a27
Add the red chili-garlic paste and stir well to mix. Let the potatoes cook in the past for 2-3 minutes until the water dries out. Add salt to taste and lime juice and garnish, if desired, with coriander.
2e41f460-be5d-46e4-9bd8-8b46aba53a27
Serve hot with rice and dal.
9c6bf6fa-1c69-4ac8-8694-d653a8255dfc
Boil the green beans and carrots until tender but not mushy. I do this by putting them in a bowl, adding about ¼ cup of water, and zapping them, covered, in a microwave, about five minutes on high. Drain all water.
9c6bf6fa-1c69-4ac8-8694-d653a8255dfc
Heat oil in a skillet. Add the cumin seeds, and, once they sputter, add the onions and ginger.
9c6bf6fa-1c69-4ac8-8694-d653a8255dfc
Stir-fry the onions for about a couple of minutes until they start to soften.
9c6bf6fa-1c69-4ac8-8694-d653a8255dfc
Add the chilli and turmeric powders, stir into the oil, then add the peas, carrots, and green beans. Cook for another two or three minutes until they are quite tender. Stir in the coriander leaves. Place the cooked veggie mixture in a food processor and pulse three to four times for five seconds each. You don't want a paste. Some bits of the veggies should still be visible.
9c6bf6fa-1c69-4ac8-8694-d653a8255dfc
Add the veggies to the mashed potatoes and stir well together. Add salt to taste, and lemon juice.
9c6bf6fa-1c69-4ac8-8694-d653a8255dfc
Turn off the heat and stir in the flour.
9c6bf6fa-1c69-4ac8-8694-d653a8255dfc
Heat a cast-iron or non-stick skillet.
9c6bf6fa-1c69-4ac8-8694-d653a8255dfc
Spray or spread on a film of oil.
9c6bf6fa-1c69-4ac8-8694-d653a8255dfc
Take a 1-inch ball of the potato-veggie mixture and flatten it into a disc.
9c6bf6fa-1c69-4ac8-8694-d653a8255dfc
Dip the cutlets in the chickpea-water mixture to coat on both sides. Then dredge them in the bread crumbs crumbs so you have a fairly even coating on both sides.
9c6bf6fa-1c69-4ac8-8694-d653a8255dfc
Place the cutlets one by one in the hot skillet, without overcrowding. Cook on each side until golden-brown.
9c6bf6fa-1c69-4ac8-8694-d653a8255dfc
Serve hot with ketchup or chutney.
b5a4b449-3414-4f7f-ade5-8857a068a737
Place the yeast in a large bowl or the bowl of a stand mixer. Add the sugar, nondairy milk, and ½ cup water. Let the yeast stand at least five minutes until it starts to look frothy and "blooms"
b5a4b449-3414-4f7f-ade5-8857a068a737
Add the flour and salt to the bowl and begin to knead, slowly drizzling in additional water until your dough comes together in a ball that's just slightly sticky (traces of the dough will stick to your fingers when you touch it). Keep in mind that you may not need all of the water, so don't dump it all in at one go.
b5a4b449-3414-4f7f-ade5-8857a068a737
Drizzle the oil on top of the dough, turn it over once or twice to make sure the oil coats the dough, cover the bowl tightly with cling wrap or a lid or a kitchen towel, and set it aside to rise in a warm place for an hour to 90 minutes.
b5a4b449-3414-4f7f-ade5-8857a068a737
After the dough has risen, turn it out on your work surface. Knead it lightly, form into a disc and cut into eight even pieces, the way you would a pizza. Roll each piece into a ball (it won't be firm), dust each ball lightly with flour, and set them aside, covered, for 15 minutes.
b5a4b449-3414-4f7f-ade5-8857a068a737
Meanwhile, make your garlic butter mixture by heating the butter in a small saucepan along with the garlic. Let the butter and garlic cook together for 3-4 minutes over medium-low heat until the garlic flavor infuses the butter and the garlic starts to turn a light golden. You don't want the garlic to burn. At this point, turn off the heat and stir in the herbs. Set aside.
b5a4b449-3414-4f7f-ade5-8857a068a737
To shape the naan, either roll each ball into a teardrop shape or a round with a rolling pin. You can dust your work surface lightly with flour if needed. Or use your fingers to shape each ball into a small disc, then lift the disc by its edge and let the dough stretch and fall with the aid of gravity. Continue shaping by moving your fingers along the edges. If you're not used to doing this, it's possible your dough could tear, so be careful. If you do get a tear, patch it up by pressing the dough together and continue shaping with a rolling pin.
b5a4b449-3414-4f7f-ade5-8857a068a737
Heat a cast-iron or any griddle over high heat until it's screaming hot. Place the naan on the griddle. You will immediately see it start to bubble up and turn opaque. Once the underside gets golden-brown spots, turn over and continue cooking the other side. This process should take you no more than two minutes or less on either side.
b5a4b449-3414-4f7f-ade5-8857a068a737
As soon as you take the naan off the griddle, brush it with the garlic-herb-butter mixture on one side. Keep your naans wrapped in a kitchen towel until ready to serve.
b5a4b449-3414-4f7f-ade5-8857a068a737
You can reheat any leftover naans on the griddle before serving.
72ca4edb-e0d7-4e4a-b4b6-0387a7b98010 Make the dough: Place all the ingredients except water in a bowl or in a stand mixer. Trickle in the water slowly, kneading as you go, until you have a stiff but pliable dough. Set aside for at least 30 minutes for the dough to relax.
72ca4edb-e0d7-4e4a-b4b6-0387a7b98010 Make the stuffing: Place all the ingredients in a bowl and mix well. Divide into 16 equal-sized portions and form into balls.
72ca4edb-e0d7-4e4a-b4b6-0387a7b98010 Make the parathas: Divide the dough into 16 equal-sized portions and shape into balls.
72ca4edb-e0d7-4e4a-b4b6-0387a7b98010 Make the parathas: Dust the surface and roll out one of the balls of dough into a disc, about four inches in diameter. Keep the center thicker and make the edges thin.
72ca4edb-e0d7-4e4a-b4b6-0387a7b98010 Make the parathas: Place the stuffing in the center and pull the edges over the top of the stuffing. Pinch to make a tight seal and squeeze off any excess dough.
72ca4edb-e0d7-4e4a-b4b6-0387a7b98010 Make the parathas: Flatten into a disc, flour both sides, and roll into a circle about six to seven inches in diameter.
72ca4edb-e0d7-4e4a-b4b6-0387a7b98010 Make the parathas: Heat a griddle and spray with oil. Place the flatbread on the griddle and let it cook until golden-brown spots appear. Flip over and cook the other side. Flip over a couple more times if needed until the surface is evenly cooked and covered with golden-brown spots.
72ca4edb-e0d7-4e4a-b4b6-0387a7b98010 Make the parathas: Serve hot with chutney or a cucumber raita or Indian pickles.
61e3c249-6c73-4661-8b99-5404ea6e3b73
Slice the tofu into six pieces. Cover a baking sheet with tin foil and arrange the slices of tofu about an inch apart. Bake in a preheated 400 degree oven for 30 minutes, flipping over once halfway. Set aside to cool.
61e3c249-6c73-4661-8b99-5404ea6e3b73
In a wok or a skillet, lightly roast the chickpea flour until it turns a couple of shades darker and smells fragrant. Set aside.
61e3c249-6c73-4661-8b99-5404ea6e3b73
Add the tofu and chickpea flour to the food processor with the remaining stuffing ingredients. Pulse until crumbly, with small bits of tofu. The mixture will look dry but should come together in a ball when shaped.
61e3c249-6c73-4661-8b99-5404ea6e3b73
Knead the paratha ingredients into a smooth dough using enough water to yield a firm but pliable dough. Set aside for at least 15 minutes before making the parathas.
61e3c249-6c73-4661-8b99-5404ea6e3b73
Divide the dough into approximately 15 balls.
61e3c249-6c73-4661-8b99-5404ea6e3b73
On a lightly floured surface, roll each ball into a 3-inch disc. Place 1 heaping tablespoon of the stuffing in the center and gather up the sides, pinching off the top if you have too much excess dough.
61e3c249-6c73-4661-8b99-5404ea6e3b73
Roll out into a paratha about 5 inches in diameter. Flour the rolling pin and the paratha as needed.
61e3c249-6c73-4661-8b99-5404ea6e3b73
Heat a griddle and when hot but not smoking, place the paratha on it. Turn when small bubbles start to form. Cook on both sides until golden brown. You can make this without any added oil by using a nonstick pan or a well-seasoned cast iron pan, or spray lightly with cooking spray.
61e3c249-6c73-4661-8b99-5404ea6e3b73
Serve piping hot with mint chutney or spicy Indian pickle.
62fa404d-4d6a-40ef-a7fd-cadd5071c535 Make the dough: Place the flour in a bowl along with the salt and mix. Add the sourdough discard, if using, or the baking powder. Drizzle in water, a little at a time, kneading until you have a shaggy dough that sticks to your fingers. I needed just under ¾ths cup of water.
62fa404d-4d6a-40ef-a7fd-cadd5071c535 Make the dough: Add 2 tsp of oil and continue kneading until incorporated.
62fa404d-4d6a-40ef-a7fd-cadd5071c535 Make the dough: Cover the bowl and set it aside in a warm place for 2-3 hours. If using baking powder, you can go to the next step after 15 minutes.
62fa404d-4d6a-40ef-a7fd-cadd5071c535 Make the dough: Flour your work surface. Using your fingers or a rolling pin, stretch the dough out to a rectangle about six inches wide and eight inches long. Brush on some oil, sprinkle on some flour. Pick the two long sides and fold them over so they overlap, creating three layers. Roll out the dough again and once again oil, flour, fold. Repeat one more time for a total of three times.
62fa404d-4d6a-40ef-a7fd-cadd5071c535 Make the dough: After you've done this three times, roll the dough into a cylinder and cut lengthwise into eight pieces. Roll each piece into a ball and set aside, covered with a kitchen towel.
62fa404d-4d6a-40ef-a7fd-cadd5071c535 Make the stuffing: Place the mashed potatoes in a bowl with all the spices. Add salt to taste and mix well with your hands or a fork until everything is incorporated.
62fa404d-4d6a-40ef-a7fd-cadd5071c535 Assemble the kulchas: Heat a griddle over medium-high heat.
62fa404d-4d6a-40ef-a7fd-cadd5071c535 Assemble the kulchas: Take a ball of dough and with your fingers or a rolling pin, roll it into a diameter of about four inches. Form the stuffing into a ball almost as big as the ball of dough and place it into the center. Pull up the sides of the dough over the stuffing and form a seal at the top.
62fa404d-4d6a-40ef-a7fd-cadd5071c535 Assemble the kulchas: Place a bowl of water next to you. Wet your fingertips and press into the dough with them to shape the dough into a diameter of about six inches. You can also just roll the dough with a rolling pin and press into it with wet fingertips at the end, or just brush on some water with a pastry brush.
62fa404d-4d6a-40ef-a7fd-cadd5071c535 Assemble the kulchas: Place the kulcha, wet side down, on the griddle. If adding the cilantro and onion seeds at this point, sprinkle them on, then press into them very carefully with your fingertips so they are embedded within the dough. You can skip this step if not comfortable working with heat.
62fa404d-4d6a-40ef-a7fd-cadd5071c535 Assemble the kulchas: Cover with a lid and let the kulcha steam-cook for about a minute or two or until the underside has golden-brown spots. Flip over and cook until golden spots appear on the other side.
62fa404d-4d6a-40ef-a7fd-cadd5071c535 Assemble the kulchas: Remove and brush on some vegan butter. If you didn't add the cilantro earlier, you can mix it into the vegan butter and brush it on at this time.
62fa404d-4d6a-40ef-a7fd-cadd5071c535 Assemble the kulchas: Pick up the kulcha with your palms as soon as you can handle it and crush it between your palms to make it separate slightly into flaky layers.
62fa404d-4d6a-40ef-a7fd-cadd5071c535 Assemble the kulchas: Serve.
bb9bd50d-2727-4921-acae-0f09223fa176
Place the flour, salt and oil in a bowl and mix until the oil has dispersed through the flour.
bb9bd50d-2727-4921-acae-0f09223fa176
Add enough water to make a stiff but pliable dough. Set the dough aside for at least 30 minutes so it can relax and roll out easily.
bb9bd50d-2727-4921-acae-0f09223fa176
Roll the dough on a floured surface into a rectangle, about 10 X 7 inches.
bb9bd50d-2727-4921-acae-0f09223fa176
Brush the entire top surface lightly with some oil, then dust lightly with a little flour.
bb9bd50d-2727-4921-acae-0f09223fa176
Lift the sides of the rectangle and fold them one over the other horizontally, so you have three layers.
bb9bd50d-2727-4921-acae-0f09223fa176
Place the rectangle of dough in the refrigerator on a flat surface, like a cookie sheet.
bb9bd50d-2727-4921-acae-0f09223fa176
After half an hour, pull out the dough, roll it again into a rectangle about 10 X 7 inches, brush with oil, dust with flour, and fold again to get three more layers. Put it back in the refrigerator.
bb9bd50d-2727-4921-acae-0f09223fa176
Repeat the entire process two more times.
bb9bd50d-2727-4921-acae-0f09223fa176
After you've folded and refrigerated the dough four times, roll it again into a rectangle and brush it with oil. This time, roll the dough horizontally the way you would a jelly roll.
bb9bd50d-2727-4921-acae-0f09223fa176
When you have a cylinder, tuck the seam under and, using a knife, cut it into 10 equal portions.
bb9bd50d-2727-4921-acae-0f09223fa176
Take one roll, flatten it, and then roll it into a circle, about 6 inches in diameter. Don't make the paratha too think, or you will end up flattening the layers. Use some flour to help you roll, if the dough sticks. Repeat for all the remaining 9 portions.
bb9bd50d-2727-4921-acae-0f09223fa176
