Heat a griddle until it's piping hot. Lower the heat to medium-high, place a paratha on the griddle, and wait until bubbles appear.
bb9bd50d-2727-4921-acae-0f09223fa176
Flip over the paratha and lightly brush some oil on the surface. When the underside is cooked and golden-brown spots appear, flip over once more and cook for a few more seconds or until golden spots appear.
bb9bd50d-2727-4921-acae-0f09223fa176
Serve rightaway.
4ac6b76e-bfff-4ac8-8a17-983e6e6ea64a Make the idli batter: Place the black gram lentils in a bowl with the flattened rice and fenugreek seeds and cover by at least two inches of water. Set aside to soak at least six hours or overnight.
4ac6b76e-bfff-4ac8-8a17-983e6e6ea64a Make the idli batter: Mix the parboiled rice and brown rice in another bowl and cover them with at least two inches of water. Set aside, again for at least six hours or overnight.
4ac6b76e-bfff-4ac8-8a17-983e6e6ea64a Make the idli batter: Drain the lentils and grind them in a high powered blender, adding just enough water to get a batter that's the consistency of a thick pancake batter. The batter should be very smooth. Remove the batter to a large bowl.
4ac6b76e-bfff-4ac8-8a17-983e6e6ea64a Make the idli batter: Add the rice to the blender, again with enough water to create the consistency of a thick pancake batter. This time, grind until the batter still has a slight coarseness -- you don't want to see broken grains of rice, but the batter should have a slight grittiness, like that of cornmeal, when you rub it between your fingers.
4ac6b76e-bfff-4ac8-8a17-983e6e6ea64a Ferment the batter: Add the rice batter to the lentil batter and mix them both, preferably with your very clean hands. The reason for this is that the warmth of your hand helps start and hastens the fermentation process.
4ac6b76e-bfff-4ac8-8a17-983e6e6ea64a Ferment the batter: Cover the bowl very tightly with cling wrap. Your bowl should be large enough that the batter reaches only half way up because the batter will rise. If you're not sure, slide a plate or a baking sheet under your bowl to catch any overflow.
4ac6b76e-bfff-4ac8-8a17-983e6e6ea64a Ferment the batter: Place the bowl in a warm place or in a cold oven with the pilot light turned on and let it stand overnight or at least eight hours. By that time it should have become puff and risen.
4ac6b76e-bfff-4ac8-8a17-983e6e6ea64a Steam the idlis: In a large stockpot with a vented lid that lets steam escape, or in a pressure cooker with a removable pressure regulator, place a trivet and an inch of water.
4ac6b76e-bfff-4ac8-8a17-983e6e6ea64a Steam the idlis: Spray the idli molds lightly with cooking spray and fill them up, stopping just short of filling them up all the way because the idlis will puff up a bit as they steam. I first fill in the bottom-most plate of the mold, then slide on the second one, fill it up, slide on the third, fill it and so on.
4ac6b76e-bfff-4ac8-8a17-983e6e6ea64a Steam the idlis: Place the idli mold in the stockpot or pressure cooker and cover with the lid. Do not put the pressure regulator on the pressure cooker vent.
4ac6b76e-bfff-4ac8-8a17-983e6e6ea64a Steam the idlis: Place your stockpot or cooker on medium-high heat. When you see wisps of steam rise from the vent in the lid or the pressure cooker, set the timer to 10 minutes and let the idlis steam away. At the end of 10 minutes, turn off the heat and let the idlis stand for a couple of minutes before opening and removing the mold.
4ac6b76e-bfff-4ac8-8a17-983e6e6ea64a Steam the idlis: Disassemble the mold and let the idlis stand in the plates for another five minutes or so. Then slide them off, either with your fingers or with a spoon.
a6fdd41c-872d-4ccf-8705-a89147396a77
Cover the brown rice with water in a microwave-safe bowl and nuke it for five minutes.
a6fdd41c-872d-4ccf-8705-a89147396a77
Allow the rice to sit in the hot water for another half an hour.
a6fdd41c-872d-4ccf-8705-a89147396a77
Now add the rice to the remaining ingredients, along with the water. Add more water to cover the lentils and rice. Allow them to soak for at least 5 hours and more if you have the time. Drain.
a6fdd41c-872d-4ccf-8705-a89147396a77
Blend the rice-dal mixture, in several batches, adding enough water to make a smooth batter that's runny enough to spread into a crepe, but thick enough to coat the back of a spoon. At this point, you can leave the batter to ferment overnight, which helps beneficial probiotic bacteria in the batter grow. You can also make the dosas rightaway.
a6fdd41c-872d-4ccf-8705-a89147396a77
To make dosas, heat a cast-iron or non-stick griddle. The griddle should be hot enough that when you sprinkle a few drops of water on it, they sizzle and evaporate.
a6fdd41c-872d-4ccf-8705-a89147396a77
Using a ladle with a rounded bottom, pour some batter into the center of the griddle and, in a quick but smooth motion, spread outward in circles. Don't be afraid if you make holes: just add a small drop of batter to patch it. If your dosa does not spread smoothly, it's possible your ladle is hot. Turn off or lower the heat, and try again.
a6fdd41c-872d-4ccf-8705-a89147396a77
Pour a few drops of oil around the dosa's edges to help it crisp up. Once the underside is golden brown, loosen the dosa gently from the skillet and flip over. If your griddle was hot enough to begin with, this step will be very, very easy.
a6fdd41c-872d-4ccf-8705-a89147396a77
Cook the other side for a few seconds, giving more time if your dosa is thicker. Serve hot with some sambar or chutney or both.
a6fdd41c-872d-4ccf-8705-a89147396a77
To make the chutney, just give all the ingredients a whir in the blender until the cilantro is completely broken down. Check salt and serve with the dosas.
4ec23ad1-97db-42f9-b74b-a195d08c69ed Make the potato sabzi: Make the potato subzi:
4ec23ad1-97db-42f9-b74b-a195d08c69ed Make the potato sabzi: Boil the potatoes in their jackets until a fork inserted in the thickest portion goes cleanly through. Dice the potatoes into a fairly small dice. I leave the skins on because I love them, but you can peel your potatoes if you'd rather.
4ec23ad1-97db-42f9-b74b-a195d08c69ed Make the potato sabzi: Heat the oil in a wok or a large saucepan
4ec23ad1-97db-42f9-b74b-a195d08c69ed Make the potato sabzi: Add the mustard seeds and when they crackle, add the red chili peppers and onions.
4ec23ad1-97db-42f9-b74b-a195d08c69ed Make the potato sabzi: Saute, stirring frequently, until the onion just starts to turn color
4ec23ad1-97db-42f9-b74b-a195d08c69ed Make the potato sabzi: Add the ginger and saute a few more seconds. Add the diced bell peppers and ground black pepper.
4ec23ad1-97db-42f9-b74b-a195d08c69ed Make the potato sabzi: Cook, stirring occasionally, for about five minutes or until the peppers start to soften. Add the potatoes.
4ec23ad1-97db-42f9-b74b-a195d08c69ed Make the potato sabzi: Let the potatoes cook over medium-high heat until they start to form a crust at the bottom. Stir a few times so they don't stick. With a potato masher or a heavy ladle, mash the potatoes slightly.
4ec23ad1-97db-42f9-b74b-a195d08c69ed Make the potato sabzi: Season with salt and stir in the lemon juice.
4ec23ad1-97db-42f9-b74b-a195d08c69ed Make the potato sabzi: Sprinkle the cilantro and mix.
4ec23ad1-97db-42f9-b74b-a195d08c69ed Make the dosas: Mix the flours, baking soda and salt in a bowl with enough water to make a runny batter. You want something far runnier than a pancake batter because you want to spread it fairly thin.
4ec23ad1-97db-42f9-b74b-a195d08c69ed Make the dosas: Heat a griddle over medium-high heat. Using a round-bottomed ladle, pour about half a cup of batter into the center of the griddle. Quickly, spread outward in a circular motion with the bottom of the ladle. You want your dosa to be fairly thin if you like it crispy.
4ec23ad1-97db-42f9-b74b-a195d08c69ed Make the dosas: Sprinkle or spray some oil around the edges. Cook until the top is dry and the edges are browned. Remove to a plate.
4ec23ad1-97db-42f9-b74b-a195d08c69ed Make the dosas: Place the stuffing inside the dosa, fold over, and serve with some chutney.
4ec23ad1-97db-42f9-b74b-a195d08c69ed Make the dosas: Enjoy!
8475e019-55fc-4779-b0b9-747ce48becc0
Mix the parboiled brown rice and the two dals, cover with at least 2 inches of water, and let them soak for 5-6 hours.
8475e019-55fc-4779-b0b9-747ce48becc0
Drain the soaked dals and rice and place in a blender along with the remaining ingredients. Add water and blend into a smooth batter that should be about the consistency of a pancake batter.
8475e019-55fc-4779-b0b9-747ce48becc0
Heat a cast-iron or nonstick griddle on a medium flame until a drop of water flicked on the surface skitters and evaporates.
8475e019-55fc-4779-b0b9-747ce48becc0
Pour about ½ cup of the uthappam batter in the center and, if needed, coax a little with the ladle to form a circle about 5-6 inches in diameter. You can make your uthappam thicker if you like. Either use more batter or shape it into a smaller circle.
8475e019-55fc-4779-b0b9-747ce48becc0
Sprinkle on some of the chopped onions and any other veggies or herbs you’re using.
8475e019-55fc-4779-b0b9-747ce48becc0
Drizzle a few drops of oil along the edges of the uthappam. This makes for a crisper edge and also makes it easier to flip the uthappam.
8475e019-55fc-4779-b0b9-747ce48becc0
Place a lid on top of the pan and let the uthappam cook about two minutes. It is important to cover the pan because if you don’t you might end up with semi-cooked batter on the inside and that wouldn’t taste any good. You want the uthappam to steam thoroughly on the inside.
8475e019-55fc-4779-b0b9-747ce48becc0
Flip the uthappam once it is golden brown on the bottom and cook for about a minute more.
8475e019-55fc-4779-b0b9-747ce48becc0
Serve hot with some Sundried Tomato Chutney (recipe follows) or with a traditional coriander-coconut chutney.
8475e019-55fc-4779-b0b9-747ce48becc0
Place all the ingredients in a blender and blend into a smooth paste. Serve with the Brown Rice Uthappam.
fe417206-202d-4602-95cf-98fa0681b964
Heat the oil in a large saucepan. Add the cumin seeds and saute for a few seconds. Once they start to change color, add the other spices (if using all or some of them) at this point, one by one, and stir to mix in the end. Otherwise, skip to the next step.
fe417206-202d-4602-95cf-98fa0681b964
Add the rice to the saucepan and stir-fry for a couple of minutes until the rice starts to turn opaque.
fe417206-202d-4602-95cf-98fa0681b964
Add four cups of water and the salt, stir, and bring to a boil over high heat.
fe417206-202d-4602-95cf-98fa0681b964
Cover the saucepan with a tight-fitting lid and turn the heat down to low. Cook for 15 minutes, never removing the lid from the pan.
fe417206-202d-4602-95cf-98fa0681b964
Once you turn off the heat, don't yet take the lid off. Wait at least 10 minutes, then open and fluff the grains of rice with a fork to separate.
fe417206-202d-4602-95cf-98fa0681b964
Serve hot.
fe19f808-f19b-4bb4-8bd2-6e77d6c1f603
Place 2 cups of water in a microwave safe bowl along with three green cardamom pods, three cloves, cinnamon, bay leaves and half the caraway seeds. Add salt to your taste. Add the rice to the bowl and microwave for eight minutes. Let the rice stand in the microwave until ready to use.
fe19f808-f19b-4bb4-8bd2-6e77d6c1f603
After putting the rice in the microwave, chop your veggies, and simultaneously heat the oil in a large saucepan with an airtight lid. When the oil is hot, add the remaining green cardamom pods and cloves, brown cardamom pods and the remaining caraway seeds.
fe19f808-f19b-4bb4-8bd2-6e77d6c1f603
Let the spices cook in the oil for a minute, then add the chopped carrots and potatoes. Season with salt and pepper and then cover and cook over medium-low heat for 5 minutes or until the veggies are almost tender. If the veggies are sticking to the pan at this time, add ¼ cup of water or vegetable stock and scrape up any bits.
fe19f808-f19b-4bb4-8bd2-6e77d6c1f603
Add the ginger-garlic paste, cilantro, mint and dill and stir to mix. Add the biryani masala, cashews if using, half the fried onions, tofu cubes and yogurt and stir well. Check if there's enough salt and add more if needed. Bring the masala to a boil.
fe19f808-f19b-4bb4-8bd2-6e77d6c1f603
Lower the heat and bring the rice out of the microwave. Run a fork through it to loosen the grains. The rice should be almost done when you take it out, but not quite. Spread it evenly on top of the veggies and masala in the pot.
fe19f808-f19b-4bb4-8bd2-6e77d6c1f603
Sprinkle the remaining fried onions on top of the rice. Cover with the airtight lid and let the biryani cook over low heat for 10 minutes, undisturbed. Let the biryani stand 10 minutes after cooking is done before opening to serve.
fe19f808-f19b-4bb4-8bd2-6e77d6c1f603
Serve hot with Cucumber Raita (recipe link below)
efc46409-9940-46f0-818a-c66e2dd45760
Blend the raw cashews with 1 cup of water and the lemon juice. Set aside.
efc46409-9940-46f0-818a-c66e2dd45760
In a saucepan, place 2 cups of water, cardamom, bay leaves, shahjeera. Add salt to taste.
efc46409-9940-46f0-818a-c66e2dd45760
Pour in the drained rice and place over a medium fire. When the water starts to boil, cover the saucepan with a tight-fitting lid and then turn down the heat to the lowest setting.
efc46409-9940-46f0-818a-c66e2dd45760
Let the rice steam for 8 minutes. Turn off the heat.
efc46409-9940-46f0-818a-c66e2dd45760
Heat the oil in a large saucepan with a tight-fitting lid. Add the shahjeera seeds ir cumin seeds and, when they start to change color, add the mint and coriander leaves. Stir to mix.
efc46409-9940-46f0-818a-c66e2dd45760
Add the ginger and garlic pastes and saute another couple of minutes, stirring frequently to ensure they do not stick to the bottom of the pan. Sprinkle on some salt and pepper to season.
efc46409-9940-46f0-818a-c66e2dd45760
Add the turmeric, cayenne or paprika, biryani masala, half of the fried onions, and the blended cashew-lemon paste. Stir well to mix and let it cook for a minute. Add salt.
efc46409-9940-46f0-818a-c66e2dd45760
Add the mushrooms to the saucepan and stir to coat with the spices. If the mixture looks too dry, add ½ cup of water or vegetable stock. Let the sauce come to a boil.
efc46409-9940-46f0-818a-c66e2dd45760
Turn off the heat. Spread the cooked rice on top of the sauce in an even layer. Sprinkle on the remaining fried onions and the saffron with the milk.
efc46409-9940-46f0-818a-c66e2dd45760
Cover with a tight lid. If the lid you have doesn't fit snugly, you can cover with a sheet of aluminum foil and then place the lid on top to make it as airtight as possible.
efc46409-9940-46f0-818a-c66e2dd45760
Turn the heat to high for about three minutes, then lower it to the lowest setting, and let the biryani cook, undisturbed, for 20 minutes. Turn off the heat and let it stand for at least 10 minutes, uncovered, before serving.
1e861367-8c2e-4a88-84cf-6ef859cd709a
Bring a large pot of water to boil, lightly salt it, then add the rice and cook until the rice grains are almost tender but not fully cooked. Drain and set aside.
1e861367-8c2e-4a88-84cf-6ef859cd709a
Mix the saffron with the nondairy milk and set aside.
1e861367-8c2e-4a88-84cf-6ef859cd709a
Heat 1 ½ tbsp oil. Add the cardamoms, cloves, cinnamon, bay leaf and cumin seeds. Stir-fry until the spices release their fragrance and begin to turn color.
1e861367-8c2e-4a88-84cf-6ef859cd709a
Add the potatoes, saute for 2-3 minutes, then add the carrots and saute for another 2-3 minutes. Add the cauliflower and green beans and saute for a couple of minutes. Add green peas, then add some salt, cover the pot and let the veggies cook over a medium-low flame for about five minutes. Stir a couple of times to ensure they do not stick. You don't want the veggies to brown.
1e861367-8c2e-4a88-84cf-6ef859cd709a
When the potatoes are almost cooked and the cauliflower is al dente, mix in the rice, tofu cubes and the saffron in milk. Cover and let the rice continue cooking over low heat for 10 more minutes.
1e861367-8c2e-4a88-84cf-6ef859cd709a
Meanwhile, heat the remaining ½ tbsp oil in a small saucepan. Add the cashews and raisins to it, and finally the blanched, sliced almonds. Cook until the nuts are a light gold, then pour over the rice and mix.
1e861367-8c2e-4a88-84cf-6ef859cd709a
Serve hot.
94bfc2c9-32d5-45d7-902e-6065cf874344
Place the chopped cucumbers in a colander with a bowl underneath to collect the juices. Sprinkle a little salt on the cucumbers and set aside for 10 minutes. After 10 minutes, press down on the cucumbers to release their juices. Set the juices aside. This step helps you control the amount of liquid you add to the yogurt rice while not wasting all of the delicious flavor of the cucumbers.
94bfc2c9-32d5-45d7-902e-6065cf874344
Cook the rice. You can use the microwave or, if cooking on the stovetop, bring 2 cups of water to a boil, add the rice, bring back to a boil, cover and cook for 15 minutes. Let the rice stand a few minutes before opening.
94bfc2c9-32d5-45d7-902e-6065cf874344
Measure out the reserved cucumber juices in a half-cup measure and add enough nondairy milk to make a half cup. Place this in a blender along with the tofu and the lemon juice and blend into a very smooth paste. If using cashew yogurt, you can skip this step.
94bfc2c9-32d5-45d7-902e-6065cf874344
Add the blended tofu to a bowl along with the cooked rice and cucumbers and mix well. If using cashew yogurt, add it now to the bowl with the rice and cucumbers and mix in the cucumber juices. You can add some nondairy milk if the rice is too dry. Your curd rice should have the consistency of a risotto-- a little runny and very creamy.
94bfc2c9-32d5-45d7-902e-6065cf874344
Heat the oil in a small skillet. Add the mustard seeds and, when they sputter, add the black gram lentils. Once they start to turn a light golden color, add the jalapenos and curry leaves. Saute for a few seconds, then add the peanuts and cashew nuts if using. Saute until the nuts are lightly golden.
94bfc2c9-32d5-45d7-902e-6065cf874344
Add the mustard seed-curry-leaf-nuts mixture to the bowl with the yogurt and rice and mix well. Add salt to taste.
94bfc2c9-32d5-45d7-902e-6065cf874344
Serve at room temperature or cold.
590d4057-da6d-4158-a6f1-7ccd34a3c3b9
In a large saucepan, add the drained rice and the coconut milk along with 1 cup water and salt to taste.
590d4057-da6d-4158-a6f1-7ccd34a3c3b9
When the liquid begins to boil, cover the saucepan with a tight-fitting lid, lower heat to low, and let the rice cook 15 minutes.
590d4057-da6d-4158-a6f1-7ccd34a3c3b9
In a small skillet, heat half the oil and add the chana dal, half of the urad dal, and the red chili peppers. Roast until golden and then powder in a spice grinder or with a mortar and pestle.
590d4057-da6d-4158-a6f1-7ccd34a3c3b9
In the same small skillet, heat the remaining oil and add the mustard seeds. When they sputter, add the remaining urad dal, cashews and the curry leaves. Saute until the dal and cashews are lightly golden. Add the shredded coconut and continue to saute until the coconut starts to just turn a very light gold.
590d4057-da6d-4158-a6f1-7ccd34a3c3b9
Add this and the powdered dals to the rice and mix gently with a fork, taking care not to mash the rice. Add salt if needed and serve.
b1cb51b6-8159-40fd-90d4-a3605e98f77e
If you have a pressure cooker, heat oil in the pressure cooker. Otherwise use a large saucepan.
b1cb51b6-8159-40fd-90d4-a3605e98f77e
Add the cumin seeds and when they sputter, add the onions and curry leaves.
b1cb51b6-8159-40fd-90d4-a3605e98f77e
Saute, stirring, until brown spots appear on the onions.
b1cb51b6-8159-40fd-90d4-a3605e98f77e
Add the ginger and saute another minute.
b1cb51b6-8159-40fd-90d4-a3605e98f77e
Add the tomato puree, turmeric, cayenne and coriander powder. Mix well and cook, stirring frequently, until the tomato puree darkens a couple of shades and bubbles at the corners.
b1cb51b6-8159-40fd-90d4-a3605e98f77e
Add the vegetables. If you're using frozen peas, don't add them now.
b1cb51b6-8159-40fd-90d4-a3605e98f77e
Add the rice and lentils.
b1cb51b6-8159-40fd-90d4-a3605e98f77e
Mix everything well together, then add six cups of water or vegetable stock.
b1cb51b6-8159-40fd-90d4-a3605e98f77e
If you're cooking in a pressure cooker, cover now and let the khichdi cook for 20 minutes after the cooker comes to pressure.
b1cb51b6-8159-40fd-90d4-a3605e98f77e
On the stovetop, if not using a pressure cooker, bring the water to a boil, cover the pot with a tight-fitting lid and cook 45 minutes or until the rice and lentils are really soft. Add more water if needed at any time. You want the khichdi to have a slightly runny consistency, like a risotto. It shouldn't be too dry.
b1cb51b6-8159-40fd-90d4-a3605e98f77e
Open the pressure cooker or pot. If you're using frozen peas, add them at this point and stir the khichdi well. Add the garam masala and salt and return the khichdi to heat to let it warm through.
b1cb51b6-8159-40fd-90d4-a3605e98f77e
Garnish with the coriander or mint leaves.
b1cb51b6-8159-40fd-90d4-a3605e98f77e
Serve hot.
3ead51a7-2d7e-4a55-a545-68fc05698742
Crush the peppercorns and cumin seeds coarsely with a mortar and pestle. It's important that you don't grind them too fine -- you want big pieces.
3ead51a7-2d7e-4a55-a545-68fc05698742
Place the rice and beans with six cups of water in a pressure cooker or Instant Pot. If using a pressure cooker, turn off the heat after six whistles. In an Instant Pot, let the rice and dal cook for 10 minutes on high pressure, then either wait for it to release, or force-release after 10 minutes.
3ead51a7-2d7e-4a55-a545-68fc05698742
Once the rice and lentils are cooked, they should have a slightly runny, creamy consistency. Stir with a ladle, mashing the rice and lentils a bit, and add a little more water if needed to get to this consistency. If you add more water, do it over medium heat so the rice warms through.
3ead51a7-2d7e-4a55-a545-68fc05698742
Make the tempering by heating the oil in a skillet. Add the cumin seeds, pepper and ginger and stir for a minute.
3ead51a7-2d7e-4a55-a545-68fc05698742
Add the nuts and stir until lightly golden.
3ead51a7-2d7e-4a55-a545-68fc05698742
Add the tempering to the cooked rice and lentils along with the coconut milk and salt to taste. Mix well.
3ead51a7-2d7e-4a55-a545-68fc05698742
Serve hot.
c15ee4eb-642c-49fd-8c54-22f1669ee39e
Heat the oil in a large saucepan. Add the bay leaves cardamom and when they start to brown lightly, in about a minute, add the onion. Saute for a minute or two until the onion starts to turn translucent.
c15ee4eb-642c-49fd-8c54-22f1669ee39e
Add the dill leaves, pistachios, and the turmeric. Stir to mix. Add the rice and stir-fry for a minute or until the rice begins to turn slightly opaque.
c15ee4eb-642c-49fd-8c54-22f1669ee39e
Add the vegetable stock and salt and ground black pepper to taste. Stir to mix and let the water come to a boil.
c15ee4eb-642c-49fd-8c54-22f1669ee39e
Cover the saucepan with a tight-fitting lid, reduce heat to medium-low, and cook for 15 minutes.
c15ee4eb-642c-49fd-8c54-22f1669ee39e
Turn off the heat and let the rice stand, undisturbed, for another 10 minutes. Uncover, fluff the rice with a fork, garnish with more pistachios if desired, and serve.
31c98a24-686c-4333-af77-091c13b781d3
Heat the oil in a large saucepan with a tight-fitting lid. Add the cumin seeds, bay leaves, cloves, cinnamon and cardamom and saute a few seconds until the bay leaves start to turn color. Add the onions, a pinch of salt, and stir-fry until the onions are golden-brown.
31c98a24-686c-4333-af77-091c13b781d3
Add the green chili pepper, garlic and ginger and continue to saute another minute. Add the tomatoes along with the turmeric, cayenne and coriander powder. Mix well. Let the tomatoes cook, stirring frequently, until they are mostly broken down and pulpy.
31c98a24-686c-4333-af77-091c13b781d3
Add the garam masala and the Maggi masala magic if using. Add the soy chunks to the pan, mix well, cover and cook another seven or eight minutes until the soy chunks have absorbed some of these yummy flavors.
31c98a24-686c-4333-af77-091c13b781d3
Add the drained rice to the pan, mix well, then add four cups of water. Add enough salt that the water tastes a little saltier than you'd like your rice to be. Bring to a boil, cover with a lid, and continue cooking on medium heat for five minutes. Turn down the heat to the lowest point and continue cooking another 15 minutes.
31c98a24-686c-4333-af77-091c13b781d3
Turn off the heat and let the rice stand, undisturbed, for another 10 minutes. Serve hot with a raita.
907c58e8-91cb-4c1a-8769-adf2b36648bb
Spray a skillet with cooking spray. Place the slices of tofu on the skillet in a single layer and cook both sides until lightly golden. When cool, cut into a ½-inch dice. Set aside
907c58e8-91cb-4c1a-8769-adf2b36648bb
Heat the oil. Add the cloves, cardamom and cinnamon and, when they start to color, add the cumin seeds. As they start to darken, add the onions and the garlic. Saute for a few minutes until the onions become golden-brown.
907c58e8-91cb-4c1a-8769-adf2b36648bb
Add the ginger-garlic paste, saute for a couple of minutes, then add the tomatoes. Add the turmeric, cayenne, cumin and coriander powders and mix well. Cover and let the tomatoes cook until they are very soft and pulpy.
907c58e8-91cb-4c1a-8769-adf2b36648bb
Add the kasoori methi, if using, and mix well. Add the spinach puree, mix, and let the sauce come to a boil. Lower the heat and continue cooking the spinach for 10 minutes. Add some vegetable stock or water if it looks too thick, but don't add too much liquid at this point-- you want the spinach to cook thoroughly and lose any raw flavor.
907c58e8-91cb-4c1a-8769-adf2b36648bb
Add the garam masala, cubes of tofu and salt. Mix well and let it all simmer another two minutes.
907c58e8-91cb-4c1a-8769-adf2b36648bb
Turn off the heat and add the cashew paste, if using. The cashew paste adds a rich, luxurious finish, but if you want a nut-free recipe, it's completely optional.
907c58e8-91cb-4c1a-8769-adf2b36648bb
Serve hot or warm with naan or roti.
6ddf3aca-ffe7-4f17-8b70-d3dba97c23a6
In a large saucepan, place the spinach and mustard greens with ½ cup of water. Cover and let the greens cook five minutes or until they are completely wilted and tender. Remove with the liquid to a food processor and blend into a smooth puree. Set aside.
6ddf3aca-ffe7-4f17-8b70-d3dba97c23a6
Make sure the saucepan is dry and heat the oil. Add the cornmeal and cook it, stirring to make sure it doesn't stick, for a minute or so.
6ddf3aca-ffe7-4f17-8b70-d3dba97c23a6
Add the tomato onion sauce and mix well. Add the pureed greens and bring everything to a boil. Lower the heat so the sauce continues to simmer with gentle bubbling in the pot. If your curry looks too dry, add a little vegetable stock or water. Let the curry cook for 15 minutes.
6ddf3aca-ffe7-4f17-8b70-d3dba97c23a6
Sprinkle on the garam masala and add salt to taste.
6ddf3aca-ffe7-4f17-8b70-d3dba97c23a6
Serve hot, preferably with makki ki roti or any Indian flatbread like naan or roti. Because this is a rustic dish, it tastes great served with an Indian pickle, slices of raw onion and wedges of lime or lemon.
16dea2cd-feb1-46b0-a052-3c537987c13a
Heat a saucepan and add the onion and garlic to it. Add 2 tbsp water and saute the onion and garlic over medium heat until the onions soften and start to change color, about five minutes.
16dea2cd-feb1-46b0-a052-3c537987c13a
Add the tomatoes along with the coriander powder, cumin powder, cayenne, turmeric and kasoori methi. Stir well, cover, and cook for 5 minutes or until the tomatoes are very soft and mushy. Stir in the cashew nuts and turn off the heat.
16dea2cd-feb1-46b0-a052-3c537987c13a
Let the onions and tomatoes cool slightly, then add a cup of cold water and use an immersion blender to blend to a smooth consistency or transfer to a blender and blend into a very smooth paste. Use caution. When blending hot liquids, I fill the blender only halfway, remove the blender's center insert and hold a kitchen towel over the top, and then blend. This keeps steam from building up inside the blender which could blow the lid off.
16dea2cd-feb1-46b0-a052-3c537987c13a
Rinse the saucepan and place over the stove over medium heat. Add the mushrooms to the pan along with a little salt and pepper. Stir-fry the mushrooms in the dry pan until they begin to caramelize, about three to four minutes. Add the peas and cover until peas are cooked, which should take no more than two to three minutes.
16dea2cd-feb1-46b0-a052-3c537987c13a
Add the blended sauce to the pan and give it a good stir. Add the garam masala and check if more salt is needed. Add water if the sauce looks too dry. Stir in the sugar.
16dea2cd-feb1-46b0-a052-3c537987c13a
Heat through and once the mixture comes to a boil, turn it off. Garnish with coriander, if you wish, or serve as is.
5848e5ce-b924-41aa-a1e9-70107c289f75
Place the cauliflower, carrots, green beans and potatoes in a large saucepan. Add half a cup of water, bring to a boil, cover and cook for five minutes. After five minutes, add the green beans and bell peppers and continue cooking another five minutes or until potatoes are tender. Drain and remove to a bowl. You can reserve the cooking water and use it as a stock instead of water later in the recipe.
5848e5ce-b924-41aa-a1e9-70107c289f75
Place the onion in a saucepan, cover with water, bring to a boil, cover and cook for 10 minutes. Drain the onion, put it in a blender, and make a smooth paste.
5848e5ce-b924-41aa-a1e9-70107c289f75
Crush the garlic, ginger and green chili peppers, preferably with a mortar and pestle (or food processor is fine). Set aside.
5848e5ce-b924-41aa-a1e9-70107c289f75
Blend half the cashews (¼ cup) into a very smooth paste in the blender with ½ cup water)
5848e5ce-b924-41aa-a1e9-70107c289f75
In a large saucepan (you can use the one you cooked the veggies in), add 1 tbsp of oil and add the cinnamon stick, cloves, cardamom and peppercorns. Saute for a minute until they start to change color and become fragrant.
5848e5ce-b924-41aa-a1e9-70107c289f75
Lower the heat and add the onion paste. Continue cooking for another 7-8 minutes, stirring frequently to keep the paste from sticking to the bottom of the pan.
5848e5ce-b924-41aa-a1e9-70107c289f75
Add the crushed ginger-garlic-green-chili-pepper paste and saute another minute. Now add the cashew paste and the yogurt, mix, and continue cooking for another five minutes. Stir frequently to avoid sticking.
5848e5ce-b924-41aa-a1e9-70107c289f75
Add all of the cooked vegetables and tofu. Mix well and add a little more water if needed (you can use the reserved water from cooking the vegetables as needed). You want the gravy to be thick enough to coat the veggies, and not too runny. Add salt to taste.
5848e5ce-b924-41aa-a1e9-70107c289f75
Let the korma come to a boil and cook another five minutes for all of the flavors to blend. Turn off the heat.
5848e5ce-b924-41aa-a1e9-70107c289f75
In a small saucepan, heat the remaining ½ tbsp oil and add the remaining ¼ cup of cashews and raisins. Stir-fry until the raisins become puffy and the cashews start to become golden.
5848e5ce-b924-41aa-a1e9-70107c289f75
Pour the cashews and raisins into the korma, sprinkle on the garam masala powder, stir once to mix, and serve.
72f193db-31d6-4ae6-8b16-7fcd6f40bfe1
Heat the oil in a skillet or wok.
72f193db-31d6-4ae6-8b16-7fcd6f40bfe1
Add the cumin seeds. As they begin to turn a little darker and fragrant, add the onions with the green chili pepper and half the cilantro. Add some salt. Stir-fry over medium heat until the onions start to caramelize, about five minutes.
72f193db-31d6-4ae6-8b16-7fcd6f40bfe1
Add the tomatoes, coriander powder and the ginger garlic paste. Continue to stir-fry until the tomatoes have broken down completely in a pulp.
72f193db-31d6-4ae6-8b16-7fcd6f40bfe1
Add the turmeric, cayenne or paprika, if using, mango powder or lemon juice, and stir to mix. Add the potatoes and mix well.
72f193db-31d6-4ae6-8b16-7fcd6f40bfe1
Add the cauliflower, mix, and and sprinkle on a couple of tablespoons of water. Turn the heat to medium-low. Cover the wok or skillet with a tight lid, preferably one that can hold a couple of tablespoons of water poured over the lid. This helps the veggies to steam-cook without burning them. If you don't have a lid that can hold water, just monitor your wok more closely and sprinkle on more water if the veggies start to stick to the bottom before they are cooked.
72f193db-31d6-4ae6-8b16-7fcd6f40bfe1
Once the veggies are done, sprinkle on the garam masala and mix. You might want to add a little at a time to suit your taste. Check for salt and add more if needed.
72f193db-31d6-4ae6-8b16-7fcd6f40bfe1
Garnish with the remaining cilantro and serve hot.
9cc0f0c8-93bd-4b2b-9a17-3539c04dea71
Place all the cut veggies into a large pot with 1 cup of water and turmeric.
9cc0f0c8-93bd-4b2b-9a17-3539c04dea71
Place the coconut milk in the blender with the cumin, green chili peppers, and bengal gram dal or rice. Blend into a paste. Set aside.
9cc0f0c8-93bd-4b2b-9a17-3539c04dea71
When the veggies are cooked -- it should take no more than 15-20 minutes -- add the coconut paste to the veggies and stir well to mix. Let the curry come to a gentle boil over medium-low heat.
9cc0f0c8-93bd-4b2b-9a17-3539c04dea71
Turn off the heat and add the yogurt or lime juice. Stir to mix but be careful not to mash up the veggies because they'll be very tender at this stage.
9cc0f0c8-93bd-4b2b-9a17-3539c04dea71
Heat the coconut oil. Add mustard seeds and when they sputter, add the curry leaves and the ginger. Saute for a minute or two until the fragrance permeates the house.
9cc0f0c8-93bd-4b2b-9a17-3539c04dea71
Pour the tempering over the avial and stir to mix. Garnish, if you wish, with coriander and some fresh coconut.
9cc0f0c8-93bd-4b2b-9a17-3539c04dea71
Serve hot with rice.
3fe5c805-530d-4d24-933d-3303af5411a5
Toss the okra with ½ tsp of oil and place in an air fryer basket. Air fry at 375 degrees for 8 minutes, tossing halfway through, or until the okra is almost tender. The okra should still look green, and should have a slight bite when your teeth dig into it. Set aside. (If you don't have an air-fryer, spread the okra on a baking sheet in a single layer and bake in a preheated 375 degree oven for 20-30 minutes or until almost cooked. A third option, the more traditional one, is to stir-fry the okra in 2 tbsp of oil until almost done.)
3fe5c805-530d-4d24-933d-3303af5411a5
Heat the remaining oil in a kadhai or wok or skillet. Add the cumin seeds and when they darken slightly, add the onions with a pinch of salt. Saute until the onions are translucent and begin to brown. Add the ginger and garlic and green chili peppers if using and continue to saute for a couple more minutes.
3fe5c805-530d-4d24-933d-3303af5411a5
Add the tomatoes, mix, then add the powdered spices -- coriander powder, turmeric, paprika or cayenne, amchoor and garam masala. You want to saute the tomatoes only until they are very mushy and have let go of all their liquid, making a nice sauce. If you overcook your tomatoes to the point where they have lost most of their moisture, they will also lose their sweetness, so don't overdo it. You want a hint of sweetness in this recipe to balance out the spicy, salty and tangy flavors. If your tomatoes aren't too sweet, add a teaspoon of sugar -- it'll do the trick.
3fe5c805-530d-4d24-933d-3303af5411a5
Add a cup of water to the tomatoes and onions and bring to a boil. Season with salt and add the prepped okra to the sauce. Stir to mix and continue cooking 3-4 minutes until the flavors meld together and the okra is cooked to your liking. I like my okra with just a little bite to it. Keep in mind that the longer you cook the okra, the more discolored it will get, losing that bright green color. It will still taste awesome, though.
3fe5c805-530d-4d24-933d-3303af5411a5
Sprinkle on the cilantro and serve hot.
3fe5c805-530d-4d24-933d-3303af5411a5 If making it with the basic tomato onion sauce: Prep the okra in the air fryer or oven or stove top. Heat two cups of the tomato onion sauce in the wok or skillet, then add the coriander powder, amchur and garam masala. Add a teaspoon of sugar. Add a cup of water, and when everything comes to a boil, add the okra and cook for 3-4 minutes until the flavors meld. Garnish with coriander and serve.
207be2dc-7a71-4556-a9bd-445fe767ad40
Blend the cashews and coconut milk into a very smooth paste. Set aside.
207be2dc-7a71-4556-a9bd-445fe767ad40
Heat 1 tsp of coconut oil in a saucepan. Add the onions and ginger-garlic paste and saute until the onions turn transparent but not brown. Add a couple of tablespoons of water if the ginger-garlic paste starts to stick.
207be2dc-7a71-4556-a9bd-445fe767ad40
Transfer the onions to a blender, add ¼ cup of water and the chili peppers and blend into a smooth paste.
207be2dc-7a71-4556-a9bd-445fe767ad40
In the same saucepan, heat the remaining teaspoon of coconut oil. Add the onion-ginger-garlic paste and bring it to a simmer.
207be2dc-7a71-4556-a9bd-445fe767ad40
Add the cauliflower florets and ½ cup of water along with the cardamom powder, pepper, chat masala, and kasoori methi.
207be2dc-7a71-4556-a9bd-445fe767ad40
Stir well to mix, bring to a boil, and cover with a lid. Cook on a medium-low flame, stirring occasionally, for 15 minutes or until the cauliflower is tender but still has a bite. If you like your cauliflower softer, continue to cook a little longer.
207be2dc-7a71-4556-a9bd-445fe767ad40
Add the cashew-coconut cream and stir well to mix. Add water if the mixture is too thick, and thin it out to your liking. I like this curry rather thick and creamy.
207be2dc-7a71-4556-a9bd-445fe767ad40
Once the curry comes to a boil, turn off the heat and add the lemon juice. Add salt to taste.
207be2dc-7a71-4556-a9bd-445fe767ad40
Serve hot with rotis or naan.
da83a7f7-4c34-489d-abe6-b6b41d7e29dc
Heat the oil in a wok or large fry pan. Add the cumin seeds and as they start to darken slightly, add the curry leaves, green chili peppers, and turmeric.
da83a7f7-4c34-489d-abe6-b6b41d7e29dc
Stir quickly to mix and add the boiled potatoes.
da83a7f7-4c34-489d-abe6-b6b41d7e29dc
Stir-fry the potatoes for a couple of minutes to warm them through. Add salt and turn off heat. You can squeeze some lemon juice into this sabzi, but I prefer it without any.
af93f9cb-3fa3-4570-a532-9d42da3d482a
Place potatoes in a large pot with enough water to cover by an inch. Bring the water to a boil, cover with the lid, lower the heat, and cook another 10 minutes or until a knife pierced in the center of the potato goes in cleanly.
af93f9cb-3fa3-4570-a532-9d42da3d482a
Drain the potatoes immediately and set aside. Place the frozen peas in the warm pot you cooked the potatoes in and cover. This should be enough to warm them without overcooking them.
af93f9cb-3fa3-4570-a532-9d42da3d482a
To make the dressing, heat the oil in a small saucepan. Add the mustard seeds. When they crackle, add the turmeric, red pepper flakes, and ginger. Stir-fry for 30 seconds, then turn off heat. Let it cool for a few minutes, then stir in the coconut milk.
af93f9cb-3fa3-4570-a532-9d42da3d482a
Halve the potatoes and place in a large bowl. Add in the green peas, the turmeric-coconut dressing, and the spring onions. Squeeze in the lemon juice. Add salt to taste and toss everything together.
af93f9cb-3fa3-4570-a532-9d42da3d482a
Serve warm or cold.
e4e8fc0e-51d9-441f-9501-245e9af2d0fd
Grind together the masala ingredients with enough water to make a thick paste. Set aside.
e4e8fc0e-51d9-441f-9501-245e9af2d0fd
Mix the oil, chili powder, turmeric, and salt to taste and toss the potatoes in the mixture. Place in a 400-degree oven and roast 30 minutes or until the potatoes are cooked through. (Pierce with a fork to test).
e4e8fc0e-51d9-441f-9501-245e9af2d0fd
In a saucepan, bring the ground paste to a boil, adding more water or vegetable stock if it's too thick. Then add half the coconut milk and the baked potatoes.
e4e8fc0e-51d9-441f-9501-245e9af2d0fd
Once the sauce starts to bubble, turn the heat to the lowest setting and place a tight-fitting lid over the saucepan. Let cook 20 minutes. Add some water or vegetable stock if the sauce dries up.
e4e8fc0e-51d9-441f-9501-245e9af2d0fd
Add the remaining coconut milk, more salt if needed, and the mint/coriander leaves and lemon juice. Stir well and turn off the heat.
e4e8fc0e-51d9-441f-9501-245e9af2d0fd
Serve hot with pooris or rotis or rice.
c3bc96d8-7b7b-4333-a01f-e5c2207e1242
Blend the cashews with ¼ cup water or vegetable stock into a smooth paste and set aside.
c3bc96d8-7b7b-4333-a01f-e5c2207e1242
Blend the onions, garlic, ginger and the paprika with ¾ cup water or vegetable stock. Place the tofu cubes in a bowl and add half a cup of the onion-ginger-garlic-paprika puree to the bowl. Toss the tofu cubes in the puree.
c3bc96d8-7b7b-4333-a01f-e5c2207e1242
Set the Instant Pot to the saute function. Add the oil and when it's hot, add the tofu cubes. Saute, stirring frequently, about 2-3 minutes. Then add the remaining onion-ginger-garlic-paprika puree, the tomato puree, coriander powder, cayenne and kasoori methi. Add salt to taste, give it a stir, and put the lid on. Set the Instant Pot to cook at high pressure for 10 minutes.
c3bc96d8-7b7b-4333-a01f-e5c2207e1242
After cooking is complete, release pressure manually after 10 minutes. Open the lid.
c3bc96d8-7b7b-4333-a01f-e5c2207e1242
If the butter tofu is too thick, you can thin it out with more vegetable stock or water. Stir in the garam masala, cashew cream or vegan butter, maple syrup or sugar and lemon or lime juice. Add more salt if needed. Heat the butter chicken tofu, especially if you added more stock or water, by turning the saute function back on. Once it's warmed through, remove to a bowl, garnish with coriander leaves, and serve hot with naan or roti or rice.
84325960-2f48-4260-81d6-6485951265bb Make the kofta: Place the tofu, cashews, potatoes, cornstarch, minced chili peppers, ginger and salt in a bowl and knead until the dough holds together. The dough will be soft but it will hold together. Form 16 smooth balls with the dough. If you're stuffing raisins into the kofta dumplings, flatten the dough first in your palm a little, place two raisins in the middle, then shape into a ball.
84325960-2f48-4260-81d6-6485951265bb Make the kofta: Heat oil in a small wok or saucepan, until a small piece of the kofta dough added to the oil sizzles immediately and rises to the top. Deep fry the kofta balls in batches on a medium flame until they are deep golden on the outside.
84325960-2f48-4260-81d6-6485951265bb Make the kofta: Place the kofta balls in a large serving bowl.
84325960-2f48-4260-81d6-6485951265bb Make the curry sauce: Heat oil in a saucepan. Add the cardamom, cloves and cinnamon
84325960-2f48-4260-81d6-6485951265bb Make the curry sauce: Add the onions and saute until the onions are soft and just beginning to turn color.
84325960-2f48-4260-81d6-6485951265bb Make the curry sauce: Add the ginger and garlic, saute for no more than 30 seconds, then add in the turmeric, cayenne and coriander powders. Stir to mix.
84325960-2f48-4260-81d6-6485951265bb Make the curry sauce: Add the tomatoes and cook until the tomatoes are pulpy and broken down, then add in the cashew nuts, pumpkin seeds and kasoori methi and mix well. Turn off the heat.
84325960-2f48-4260-81d6-6485951265bb Make the curry sauce: Remove the entire mixture to the blender, add two cups of cold water and process to a really smooth paste.
84325960-2f48-4260-81d6-6485951265bb Make the curry sauce: This step is optional, but you can strain the sauce at this point for a really smooth texture.
84325960-2f48-4260-81d6-6485951265bb Make the curry sauce: Add the sauce back to the pan and bring it back to a boil over low heat. If it's too thick to your liking, dilute with more water. Mix in the garam masala and add salt. Stir in the sugar if using, and turn off the heat.
84325960-2f48-4260-81d6-6485951265bb Make the curry sauce: Pour the hot sauce over the kofta balls, and serve immediately.
52b45aa1-8c7f-484f-8e21-a869b5a6ec6c
Heat the oil and add the curry leaves and onions to it. Saute for a few minutes until the onions start to brown, then add in the ginger and garlic and black pepper and continue to saute another minute.
52b45aa1-8c7f-484f-8e21-a869b5a6ec6c
Add the tomatoes and stir in the turmeric and paprika, if using. Mix well and cover the pot and let the tomatoes cook five minutes or until they are completely pulpy and mushy.
52b45aa1-8c7f-484f-8e21-a869b5a6ec6c
Add the potatoes and 2 cups of the vegetable stock along with half of the coconut milk. Mix well, cover and let the curry cook until the potatoes are very tender, about 10 minutes.
52b45aa1-8c7f-484f-8e21-a869b5a6ec6c
When the potatoes are tender, stir in the garam masala and the chick'n pieces or chickpeas. Add the remaining vegetable stock at this point if needed to thin the curry out. You don't want to cook the curry for too long at this point or the chick'n will get too soft. Once the curry comes to a boil, add the remaining coconut milk and turn off the heat. Stir in the cilantro.
52b45aa1-8c7f-484f-8e21-a869b5a6ec6c
Serve the curry with rice, rotis, bread and wedges of lime to squeeze over the curry.
52b45aa1-8c7f-484f-8e21-a869b5a6ec6c To make this recipe with the basic tomato onion sauce: Heat oil, add the curry leaves and stir for a minute in the oil, then add 1 ½ cups of the tomato onion sauce. Once the sauce boils, proceed with step 3 where you add the potatoes.
e43c56f7-c1ef-456f-baf2-5c3f9683c9da
Cut the tofu into six pieces and set aside. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit.
e43c56f7-c1ef-456f-baf2-5c3f9683c9da
In an oven-safe dish, make the tofu marinade by mixing together the coconut milk, ginger-garlic paste, coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala, lemon juice, paprika, half the kasoori methi, and turmeric. Pour out half the marinade into another oven-safe dish.
e43c56f7-c1ef-456f-baf2-5c3f9683c9da
Place the bell pepper chunks and half the onion chopped into 1-inch chunks in one of the oven-safe dishes, and the tofu in the other. Turn the tofu around to coat with the marinade. Toss the vegetables in the other dish with the marinade to coat the veggies evenly.
e43c56f7-c1ef-456f-baf2-5c3f9683c9da
Now place both dishes into a preheated oven and bake for 30 minutes or until the tops of the veggies start to brown. Turn the tofu around once halfway through baking.
e43c56f7-c1ef-456f-baf2-5c3f9683c9da
While the tofu and veggies are baking, blend the tomatoes and the raw cashews with ½ cup of water into a smooth paste.
e43c56f7-c1ef-456f-baf2-5c3f9683c9da
Heat the oil in a large saucepan. Add the finely diced onions and saute for about 8-10 minutes over medium high heat until the onions turn golden-brown.
e43c56f7-c1ef-456f-baf2-5c3f9683c9da
Add the tomato-cashew puree and cover and cook for 20 minutes. If the mixture gets too dry, add ½ cup water.
e43c56f7-c1ef-456f-baf2-5c3f9683c9da
Add the baked veggies and remaining kasoori methi to the tomato sauce and stir well to mix. If there's any marinade sticking to the dish, pour it into the saucepan, adding some water to the dish if needed.
e43c56f7-c1ef-456f-baf2-5c3f9683c9da
Add the tofu to the sauce and again, pour in any marinade, using a little water to release any that is stuck to the dish. Add the sugar or maple syrup, if using. I like this because it rounds out the various flavors in the dish without making it sweet.
e43c56f7-c1ef-456f-baf2-5c3f9683c9da
You want the sauce to be creamy but not watery. If your sauce appears too dry, add some water or vegetable stock. Bring to a boil, add salt, and turn off the heat.
e43c56f7-c1ef-456f-baf2-5c3f9683c9da
Garnish with cilantro. Serve hot with rice or naan.
b518f2b0-9dad-4dc0-a026-1c682e3e0119
To prepare the tofu:
b518f2b0-9dad-4dc0-a026-1c682e3e0119
Mix all the ingredients except the tofu. Now slather the marinade on the slices of tofu you've prepared and set aside for about half an hour.
b518f2b0-9dad-4dc0-a026-1c682e3e0119
Smear the oil evenly in a nonstick or cast-iron griddle. When it's hot, place the slices of tofu in the pan without crowding them. Cook until golden-brown on each side, about four minutes per side. Remove to a plate and, when cool, cut into ¾-inch cubes. Set aside.
b518f2b0-9dad-4dc0-a026-1c682e3e0119
To make the Makhani curry:
b518f2b0-9dad-4dc0-a026-1c682e3e0119
Heat the oil in a saucepan. Add the cumin seeds, and when they sputter add cardamom, cloves, peppercorns and cinnamon. Saute for a minute over medium-high heat.
b518f2b0-9dad-4dc0-a026-1c682e3e0119
Add the onions and a little salt and saute until the onions start to brown, about five minutes. Add ginger and garlic pastes, kasoori methi, and cashew nuts and saute for another minute.
b518f2b0-9dad-4dc0-a026-1c682e3e0119
Add the tomatoes and tomato paste, powdered coriander, turmeric, and chilli powder.
b518f2b0-9dad-4dc0-a026-1c682e3e0119
Saute the mixture until the tomatoes turn really soft and melt into the saucepan. If the mixture starts to get too dry before the tomatoes are done, add some water or vegetable stock and continue cooking.
b518f2b0-9dad-4dc0-a026-1c682e3e0119
Once the tomatoes are really soft, turn off the heat and let the mixture cool. Pour into a blender and add a cup of vegetable stock. Blend to a smooth paste. (Don't blend the mixture while it's still hot because it can be dangerous. If you have a hand blender, this is the time to use it.)
b518f2b0-9dad-4dc0-a026-1c682e3e0119
Pour the blended paste back into the saucepan, turn on the heat, add the remaining vegetable stock if the mixture is thick, and bring to a simmer. Now add the tofu cubes and stir them in. Add salt to taste. Let the mixture simmer for about 10 minutes.
b518f2b0-9dad-4dc0-a026-1c682e3e0119
Add the vegan butter and turn off the heat. Stir to melt the butter into the sauce.
b518f2b0-9dad-4dc0-a026-1c682e3e0119
Add the lemon juice and maple syrup, mix well, garnish with coriander leaves, and serve hot with some boiled rice or naan.
0659aadc-f5d8-4ffc-a714-f788faa43c17 Make the masala: Heat half a tablespoon of oil. Add the cloves, cinnamon, black cumin, coriander seeds, fennel seeds, black peppercorns and red chilies and saute until the coriander is a few shades darker and the spices are fragrant.
0659aadc-f5d8-4ffc-a714-f788faa43c17 Make the masala: Add the onions and garlic with a pinch of salt. Saute, stirring frequently, until the onions start to brown.
0659aadc-f5d8-4ffc-a714-f788faa43c17 Make the masala: Add the coconut (thaw first if frozen). After adding the coconut, don't wander away because coconut can burn fast. Stir frequently until the coconut's turning pale blonde and toasty.
0659aadc-f5d8-4ffc-a714-f788faa43c17 Make the masala: Transfer the mixture to a blender, add a cup of water, and blend into a smooth paste.
0659aadc-f5d8-4ffc-a714-f788faa43c17 Make the curry: Heat the remaining oil. Add the onions and some salt and saute until they start to brown.
0659aadc-f5d8-4ffc-a714-f788faa43c17 Make the curry: Add the tomatoes, turmeric, and paprika, if using. Stir to mix, cover with a lid, and let it all cook until the tomatoes are quite mushy.
0659aadc-f5d8-4ffc-a714-f788faa43c17 Make the curry: Add the ground masala and stir well to mix. If the curry is really thick, add some water to thin it out.
0659aadc-f5d8-4ffc-a714-f788faa43c17 Make the curry: Bring the curry to a boil, add salt, then add the grated nutmeg and tofu cubes. Stir well to mix.
0659aadc-f5d8-4ffc-a714-f788faa43c17 Make the curry: Let the tofu poach in the curry over medium-low heat, about 8 minutes.
0659aadc-f5d8-4ffc-a714-f788faa43c17 Make the curry: Squeeze in the lemon juice and add the coriander leaves.
0659aadc-f5d8-4ffc-a714-f788faa43c17 Make the curry: Serve hot with some rice.
d194e06b-7fa8-420e-aa16-5e9a8ff089d0
Heat the oil in a saucepan. Add the cumin, cardamom, cloves, cinnamon and peppercorns. As the spices start to change color, add the tomato onion sauce and kasoori methi and mix well. You don't need to let the sauce cook through at this stage.
d194e06b-7fa8-420e-aa16-5e9a8ff089d0
Turn off the heat and pour the sauce into a blender. Add the cashews and a cup of water and blend until smooth, then pour it all back into the saucepan and turn on the heat.
d194e06b-7fa8-420e-aa16-5e9a8ff089d0
Add the tofu cubes and let the sauce come to a boil. Stir in the garam masala. If your sauce feels too thick at any time, thin it out with water. You want a sauce that's thick enough to coat the tofu. Let the curry cook another five minutes on medium-low heat.
d194e06b-7fa8-420e-aa16-5e9a8ff089d0
Stir in the lemon juice. Add salt and ground black pepper, if needed, and turn off the heat. Stir in the lemon juice.
d194e06b-7fa8-420e-aa16-5e9a8ff089d0
Serve hot with naan, roti, paratha or rice.
df387610-f80a-48b9-beb4-e077d949e9a0
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees (you can do this in the toaster oven or the air fryer).
df387610-f80a-48b9-beb4-e077d949e9a0
Place the meat substitute in an oven-proof baking dish with the turmeric, 1 tsp paprika, 1 tsp oil and half the ginger-garlic paste. Add salt and, if you like, ground black pepper. Toss to mix well.
df387610-f80a-48b9-beb4-e077d949e9a0
Place the dish in the oven and bake 20 minutes. You might need only about 15 minutes in the air fryer, and if you're using one, check after 10 minutes and toss if needed to make sure they cook evenly. Set aside.
df387610-f80a-48b9-beb4-e077d949e9a0
Heat the remaining teaspoon of oil in a large saucepan. Add the onions along with salt and saute until they start to brown. Add the remaining ginger garlic paste, stir to mix, and add in the tomatoes. Mix well and let the tomatoes cook over medium high heat, stirring frequently, until they turn a darker shade and most of the moisture is gone, about five minutes.
df387610-f80a-48b9-beb4-e077d949e9a0
Add the remaining paprika, coriander powder and garam masala. Saute for another minute so the spices coat the veggies and are lightly toasted, then 2 cups of the vegetable stock. Mix well, and add more stock if you want it thinner. Add in the reserved meat substitute cubes and salt to taste. Bring to a boil and turn off immediately.
df387610-f80a-48b9-beb4-e077d949e9a0
You can, if you wish, add a touch of cashew cream or coconut milk -- no more than ¼ cup -- just before finishing for more creaminess, but this curry is delicious as is.
df387610-f80a-48b9-beb4-e077d949e9a0
Garnish with cilantro or mint and serve hot.
a0b0c821-da68-4446-b6f1-13443095e33c
Blend the cashews with ¼ cup water and set aside.
a0b0c821-da68-4446-b6f1-13443095e33c
Heat the oil and add the cumin seeds. As they begin to darken slightly and become fragrant, add the bell peppers. Saute the peppers three to four minutes or until they soften a bit, then add the kasoori methi, stir it in, then add tomato sauce and salt to taste. Add the tofu and mix.
a0b0c821-da68-4446-b6f1-13443095e33c
When the sauce comes to a boil, add the cashew paste and stir it in. Turn off the heat and serve. Garnish with cilantro, if you wish.
a30aab0b-8ab5-428b-a18d-67be3c2d9aef
Heat 1 tbsp butter in a saucepan.
a30aab0b-8ab5-428b-a18d-67be3c2d9aef
Add the onions, garlic and ginger and saute, stirring frequently, until the onions turn translucent.
a30aab0b-8ab5-428b-a18d-67be3c2d9aef
Add the tomatoes and the cashews. Cook, covered but stirring frequently, until the tomatoes have reduced to a pulp. Add the coriander powder, turmeric and paprika and continue cooking for another 5 minutes. Turn off the heat.
a30aab0b-8ab5-428b-a18d-67be3c2d9aef
Carefully, taking care not to burn yourself, ladle out the tomato-onion-spice mixture into a blender. Or, if you have an immersion blender, use that. Add a cup of water or preferably vegetable stock and blend into a very, very smooth paste.
a30aab0b-8ab5-428b-a18d-67be3c2d9aef
Pour the sauce back into the saucepan. For an even smoother texture to your sauce, you can strain it. Add the garam masala and stir in.
a30aab0b-8ab5-428b-a18d-67be3c2d9aef
Add the kasoori methi and sugar and stir well. If the sauce looks too thick, you can thin it out with more vegetable stock. Bring the sauce to a boil over medium heat.
a30aab0b-8ab5-428b-a18d-67be3c2d9aef
Add the cubes of tofu, season with salt, bring back to a boil, and continue to cook, covered for another five minutes.
a30aab0b-8ab5-428b-a18d-67be3c2d9aef
Turn off the heat, garnish with cilantro, and serve hot with naan or roti or rice.
bc547eca-adfd-43ab-b611-01c11d6b10cb
In a dry, hot skillet, roast the coriander and cumin seeds. Place in a blender.
bc547eca-adfd-43ab-b611-01c11d6b10cb
Heat ½ tsp of oil in the skillet. Add the curry leaves, garlic, chili peppers and shallots and saute until brown spots appear on the onions. Add to the blender, add half a cup of vegetable stock, and blend into a very smooth paste.
bc547eca-adfd-43ab-b611-01c11d6b10cb
Heat the remaining 1 tbsp oil in the skillet. Add the potatoes and stir-fry for five minutes until golden spots appear.
bc547eca-adfd-43ab-b611-01c11d6b10cb
Add the mushrooms and turmeric and saute until the mushrooms begin to soften, about 2-3 minutes.
bc547eca-adfd-43ab-b611-01c11d6b10cb
Now add the blended masala and the tomato puree. Cook for about five minutes, stirring frequently, then add 1 ½ cups of vegetable stock. Check seasoning and add more salt if needed.
bc547eca-adfd-43ab-b611-01c11d6b10cb
Cover and cook about 20 minutes or until the potatoes are tender. If your curry gets too thick, you can thin it out with more vegetable stock.
bc547eca-adfd-43ab-b611-01c11d6b10cb
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.
6e7ad499-df25-4d8c-8b17-299e8eb625b3
Place the sausages in a bowl with turmeric, 1 tsp paprika, cinnamon, ground black pepper, 1 tbsp ginger garlic paste and the vinegar. Mix well to coat the sausage pieces with the spices. Set aside for at least 30 minutes or overnight in the refrigerator.
6e7ad499-df25-4d8c-8b17-299e8eb625b3
Heat oil in a skillet or wok and add the potatoes to it. Stir-fry the potatoes over medium-high heat until they are a light golden-brown. Add the onions, remaining ginger-garlic paste and cilantro along with the remaining paprika and a little salt and stir-fry until the onions begin to turn golden-brown.
6e7ad499-df25-4d8c-8b17-299e8eb625b3
Add the tomatoes and cook until they turn pulpy. Now add the marinated sausages, stir to mix, and then add in a cup of vegetable stock or water.
6e7ad499-df25-4d8c-8b17-299e8eb625b3
Add more salt if needed, and bring the curry to a boil. At this point, you can add more stock or water if you want a saucier curry. Cover and cook the curry for another five minutes or until the potatoes are tender.
6e7ad499-df25-4d8c-8b17-299e8eb625b3
Turn off the heat and serve hot with bread rolls or rice.
fbe8bb7d-b503-4e30-978e-e688fe90c76b
Heat the oil and add the mustard seeds. When they sputter, add the onions.
fbe8bb7d-b503-4e30-978e-e688fe90c76b
Add some salt and saute the onions over medium heat until they start to get brown spots. Add ginger and garlic and saute for a few seconds.
fbe8bb7d-b503-4e30-978e-e688fe90c76b
Add the tomato puree and the powdered spices, including the turmeric, cayenne, paprika, chana masala powder and aamchoor. Let the mixture cook until the tomato puree is a few shades darker and starts to stick to the bottom of the pan. Scrape so it doesn't burn. This should take about 5 minutes.
fbe8bb7d-b503-4e30-978e-e688fe90c76b
Add 2-3 cups of the vegetable stock or water and chickpeas and let the curry come to a boil. Lower the heat and let it simmer for about 5 minutes. Add salt and sugar. If the mixture is too dry, add more stock or water
fbe8bb7d-b503-4e30-978e-e688fe90c76b
Garnish with the coriander and serve hot with rotis, bhatura or rice. I love it with some simple pilaf rice
1dd713e4-dc08-4680-8577-df79ca5a907c
Soak the beans for a couple of hours at least or overnight, then cooked in a pressure cooker until really tender. If you are cooking on the stovetop, place enough water in the pan to cover the beans by an inch, bring to a boil, lower the heat to a simmer, cover, and let the beans cook until tender. You might need to add more water as they cook, so check every once in a way. The beans should take about an hour to become tender. Reserve the beans and the cooking liquid.
1dd713e4-dc08-4680-8577-df79ca5a907c
Heat the oil in a large saucepan. Add the cumin and carom seeds. Stir-fry for 30 seconds, then add the onions.
1dd713e4-dc08-4680-8577-df79ca5a907c
Saute the onions until brown spots start to appear. Add the ginger-garlic paste, saute for a few seconds, then add the tomatoes.
1dd713e4-dc08-4680-8577-df79ca5a907c
Add the garam masala, coriander powder, paprika and cayenne. Stir to mix well. Cover the saucepan with a lid and let the tomatoes cook on medium heat until they are completely broken down. You can help the process along by adding ½ cup of the bean stock.
1dd713e4-dc08-4680-8577-df79ca5a907c
Add the beans to the saucepan, stir well to mix, then add the kasoori methi, crushing the dry leaves as you add to powder them.
1dd713e4-dc08-4680-8577-df79ca5a907c
Add some water or the bean cooking stock to thin out the gravy, if it's too thick. I like to take a potato masher at this point and mash some of the kidney beans to make the gravy thick and creamy.
1dd713e4-dc08-4680-8577-df79ca5a907c
Cover the saucepan with a lid and let the beans cook for another 10 minutes. Add salt to taste.
1dd713e4-dc08-4680-8577-df79ca5a907c
Stir in coriander leaves and take off the heat. Stir in the optional vegan butter at this point.
1dd713e4-dc08-4680-8577-df79ca5a907c
Serve hot over some brown or white rice.
0feacf00-cdb3-4f7b-9050-805f374da674
Place the urad dal and rajma together in a large bowl and wash in three to four changes of water, rubbing the beans to remove all the dirt that may be sticking to them. Finally, top the beans with water by at least three inches. Let the beans soak at least eight hours or overnight.
0feacf00-cdb3-4f7b-9050-805f374da674
Place the drained beans and lentils in a large stockpot along with 1 tsp of garlic and a bay leaf, if using. Cover by at least an inch and a half of water and bring them to a boil. If you see a white, frothy layer accumulate on top, skim it away. Cover and cook the lentils for an hour and a half or until the black lentils are really tender and the kidney beans are cooked but not falling apart.
0feacf00-cdb3-4f7b-9050-805f374da674
Place 1 tbsp of garlic and the ginger in a mortar and pestle and crush into a coarse paste. Set aside.
0feacf00-cdb3-4f7b-9050-805f374da674
Blend the cashews with ¼ cup of water into a very smooth cream. Set aside.
0feacf00-cdb3-4f7b-9050-805f374da674
Heat the oil in a saucepan. Add the ginger-garlic paste, saute until the garlic begins to turn blonde, then add in the paprika and the kasoori methi. Stir quickly and immediately add the tomato puree.
0feacf00-cdb3-4f7b-9050-805f374da674
Cook the tomato puree for five minutes, stirring frequently. Stir in the sugar and add the cooked dal along with the liquid it was cooked in. If it looks like you have too much liquid, hold some back and add according to the consistency you want. If there's too little liquid, add water to thin the dal out.
0feacf00-cdb3-4f7b-9050-805f374da674
Bring the dal to a boil, cover, turn down the heat, and let it cook for five minutes. Use a potato masher or a heavy ladle to mash some of the lentils so the consistency gets creamier. Stir in the vegan butter and salt to taste. Add the cashew cream.
0feacf00-cdb3-4f7b-9050-805f374da674
Check seasoning and add more salt if needed. Turn off the heat and serve hot or warm before serving.
4db089b1-d8fd-44d3-bc21-4f00e0a89e91
Cook the legumes. I will share with you here my "shortcut" way of doing this-- because rajma takes much longer to cook than the two lentils, and because I don't always remember to presoak my beans, I faux-soak the rajma by covering it with 2 inches of water in a microwave-safe dish, zap it for about 10 minutes, add more water if needed, and then zap again for another 10 minutes. Then I place the legumes and the rajma in a pressure cooker and cook them together. If you don't have a pressure cooker, you can cover the lentils and the soaked rajma with water in a large saucepan, slap on a lid, and cook about an hour.
4db089b1-d8fd-44d3-bc21-4f00e0a89e91
Heat the oil in a large saucepan.
4db089b1-d8fd-44d3-bc21-4f00e0a89e91
Add the ginger and garlic, saute for a minute on a medium-low flame, and then add the onions.
4db089b1-d8fd-44d3-bc21-4f00e0a89e91
Saute the onions until brown spots appear, about 8-10 minutes.
4db089b1-d8fd-44d3-bc21-4f00e0a89e91
Add the cumin, coriander, turmeric powders and salt to taste. Add the tomatoes and saute until they are cooked down, about five minutes.
4db089b1-d8fd-44d3-bc21-4f00e0a89e91
Now add the cooked lentils and stir well to mix. Add some water if the dal is too thick.
4db089b1-d8fd-44d3-bc21-4f00e0a89e91
Cover with a lid and cook about 8-10 minutes for all the flavors to meld together. Crush the kasoori methi with your fingers and sprinkle over the dal. Mix in the butter and stir until it's melted into the dal.
4db089b1-d8fd-44d3-bc21-4f00e0a89e91
Stir in the cilantro, turn off the heat, and serve hot.
7ee09a4b-cee6-412b-84f7-86cf0f9b8b2d
In a pressure cooker or in a saucepan, combine the lentils with bay leaves and turmeric. If you're cooking in a saucepan, cover the lentils with an inch of water, bring to a boil, and let the lentils cook at a simmer, covered. Check frequently to ensure they don't dry up and add more water if needed. Cook the lentils until they are really soft and tender.
7ee09a4b-cee6-412b-84f7-86cf0f9b8b2d
In a saucepan, heat the oil. Add the mustard seeds and, when they sputter, add the cloves, cardamom and cinnamon. Saute a minute until the cardamom looks puffy, then add the slivers of coconut, if using, and saute until they get lightly golden brown.
7ee09a4b-cee6-412b-84f7-86cf0f9b8b2d
Add the raisins and ginger, saute for 30 seconds, then add the cooked dal. Stir well to mix. Add some water if the dal is too dry. You want it to have a thicker consistency than most dals do, but not so thick that it's dry.
7ee09a4b-cee6-412b-84f7-86cf0f9b8b2d
Add the jaggery and coconut milk and heat the dal through.
7ee09a4b-cee6-412b-84f7-86cf0f9b8b2d
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.
21dc7abc-23ee-4845-af88-9eeb9be7e9c9
Mix the lentils and turmeric, add water and cook until tender in a pressure cooker. Or cover the peas with an inch of water in a pot and bring to a boil, then slap on a lid, lower to simmer, and boil for 30-45 minutes or until the peas are tender enough to mash. Add more water if needed as they cook.
21dc7abc-23ee-4845-af88-9eeb9be7e9c9
Prepare the ground masala by heating 1 tsp of oil. Add to it the coriander seeds, chana dal, fenugreek seeds and chillies and saute until the coriander seeds and dal turn a few shades darker and are lightly golden-brown. Remove to a blender, add enough water to keep the blades moving, and process to a smooth paste.
21dc7abc-23ee-4845-af88-9eeb9be7e9c9
Heat 1 tsp of the oil, add the pearl onions and stir-fry until the start to turn golden. Add the tamarind extract and let the mixture cook about 8 minutes.
21dc7abc-23ee-4845-af88-9eeb9be7e9c9
Add the ground masala and stir well to mix. Add the cooked tuvar dal and bring everything to a boil.
21dc7abc-23ee-4845-af88-9eeb9be7e9c9
Lower the heat to a simmer, add salt to taste, and let the sambar cook for 10 minutes so all the flavors have a chance to meld together.
21dc7abc-23ee-4845-af88-9eeb9be7e9c9
To temper the sambar-- an important flavor-building step-- heat the last teaspoon of oil in a small saucepan and add the mustard seeds. When they crackle, add the asafetida and curry leaves. Fry for a few seconds, turn off the heat, and pour over the sambar. Mix well.
de845d74-6cd2-48a4-a317-350edf52551f
Cook the dal with turmeric in a pressure cooker or on the stovetop with 2 cups of water until it's really soft. Use a whisk to mash the dal up. Do not discard the stock.
de845d74-6cd2-48a4-a317-350edf52551f
Using a mortar and pestle, or in a food processor, crush 2 cloves of garlic, the green chili pepper, and cumin seeds to a coarse paste.
de845d74-6cd2-48a4-a317-350edf52551f
Crush the remaining garlic cloves slightly but let them hold their shape.
de845d74-6cd2-48a4-a317-350edf52551f
Heat the oil in a saucepan.
de845d74-6cd2-48a4-a317-350edf52551f
Add the mustard seeds and, when it sputters, add the asafetida.
de845d74-6cd2-48a4-a317-350edf52551f
Add the cumin-garlic-chili paste, stir-fry for a few seconds, then add the ginger, curry leaves, coriander leaves, and crushed, whole garlic. Stir-fry for a few seconds until the garlic starts to very slightly change color.
de845d74-6cd2-48a4-a317-350edf52551f
Add the tomatoes and stir-fry until they just start to turn mushy.
de845d74-6cd2-48a4-a317-350edf52551f
Add the tamarind extract with 1 cup of water and bring to a boil. Add the rasam powder and continue to boil for another five minutes.
de845d74-6cd2-48a4-a317-350edf52551f
Add the cooked dal/lentils to the saucepan with salt to taste. Bring the rasam to a rolling boil, reduce heat to medium, and let it boil for another five minutes. If it starts to get thick, add water. Rasam should have a very watery consistency, although if you prefer it thick, you can add less water.
de845d74-6cd2-48a4-a317-350edf52551f
Check salt and add more if needed.
de845d74-6cd2-48a4-a317-350edf52551f
Serve very hot over rice or in a glass or bowl.
0c8c260a-b311-4527-be2e-8916f9e3d802
Combine, wash and cook the lentils with the turmeric, preferably in a pressure cooker. If cooking on a stovetop, cover with an inch of water, bring to a boil, slap on a lid, keep on the lowest setting for the lentils to just simmer, and cook for 30-45 minutes or until the lentils are really soft and easily mushed up. Add more water during the cooking if necessary.
0c8c260a-b311-4527-be2e-8916f9e3d802
In a saucepan, heat the oil.
0c8c260a-b311-4527-be2e-8916f9e3d802
Add the mustard seeds, red chillies and asafetida.
0c8c260a-b311-4527-be2e-8916f9e3d802
When the mustard seeds crackle and sputter, add the garlic and stir-fry until the garlic browns. Don't let it burn-- stir constantly.
0c8c260a-b311-4527-be2e-8916f9e3d802
Add the tomato and cook for a few minutes or until the tomato breaks down.
0c8c260a-b311-4527-be2e-8916f9e3d802
Add the lentils and water, if needed. You want the dal to be runny but not too watery. This is a matter of personal preference, though, so if you like your dals thick, feel free to use less water. Keep in mind that dals do thicken on standing.
0c8c260a-b311-4527-be2e-8916f9e3d802
Bring the lentils to a boil and let them cook for a few minutes.
0c8c260a-b311-4527-be2e-8916f9e3d802
Add the sugar and salt and aamchur and stir to mix.
0c8c260a-b311-4527-be2e-8916f9e3d802
Add the coriander leaves, mix well, and turn off the heat.
0c8c260a-b311-4527-be2e-8916f9e3d802
Serve hot with rice or parathas or roti.
e35b272a-73a5-40bd-b365-5c2a22b3e99b
Cook or pressure-cook the dal along with the ginger, cayenne or paprika and turmeric until tender and mushy. If you want a creamy dal, blend half the cooked dal into a smooth puree and add back to the remaining dal.
e35b272a-73a5-40bd-b365-5c2a22b3e99b
Heat the oil in a large saucepan
e35b272a-73a5-40bd-b365-5c2a22b3e99b
Add the garlic and stir quickly for about a minute. Add the tomatoes and cook until the puree darkens, about five minutes.
e35b272a-73a5-40bd-b365-5c2a22b3e99b
Add the cooked urad dal, garam masala powder (use more or less based on your preference and the brand you have) and the kasoori methi (crush it between your fingers as you add it to the pot). Stir to mix.
e35b272a-73a5-40bd-b365-5c2a22b3e99b
Add water or vegetable stock if the dal is too thick. Bring the dal to a boil and simmer over medium-low heat for 10 minutes.
e35b272a-73a5-40bd-b365-5c2a22b3e99b
Add salt to taste. Stir in the vegan butter and add chopped coriander leaves. Turn off the heat.
e35b272a-73a5-40bd-b365-5c2a22b3e99b
Serve hot with rice or rotis.
7ee8369a-8557-43ba-b9af-1535bae6cbc6
Heat the oil. Add the cumin seeds. When they darken slightly, add the ginger and garlic and saute for a few seconds, then add the coriander and cumin powders, tomato puree, kasoori methi, cayenne and turmeric.
7ee8369a-8557-43ba-b9af-1535bae6cbc6
Stir and cook until the tomato puree darkens and most of the moisture has evaporated.
7ee8369a-8557-43ba-b9af-1535bae6cbc6
Add the cooked dal and stir well to mix. If the dal is too thick, add water to make it more fluid-- you want it to be runny but still fairly thick.
7ee8369a-8557-43ba-b9af-1535bae6cbc6
Bring the dal to a boil, lower the heat, and let it simmer for another 10 minutes.
7ee8369a-8557-43ba-b9af-1535bae6cbc6
Add the garam masala, stir in, and then add the vegan butter and salt to taste.
7ee8369a-8557-43ba-b9af-1535bae6cbc6
Sprinkle on the coriander or spring onions, turn off the heat, and serve hot with some rice or naan.
a858453c-dfb8-4392-8499-3f9ec5257c0d
Mix the marinade ingredients with enough water to make a paste. Toss the tofu cubes in it to coat.
a858453c-dfb8-4392-8499-3f9ec5257c0d
Heat 2 tsp of the oil in a nonstick or cast-iron pan. Saute the tofu cubes on all sides until they are golden-brown. Remove to a plate.
a858453c-dfb8-4392-8499-3f9ec5257c0d
Heat the remaining 1 tsp of oil and add the cumin seeds. When they sputter, add the ginger and garlic and onion.
a858453c-dfb8-4392-8499-3f9ec5257c0d
Saute until the onion becomes transparent. Now add the coriander powder, black pepper, and minced green chilli. Toss to coat with the spices and then add the green pepper.
a858453c-dfb8-4392-8499-3f9ec5257c0d
Stir-fry until the bell pepper starts to soften but still has a good bite to it. Now add the tofu cubes and toss them with the spices. Add the tamari or soy sauce and the cornflour mixed with water (this will give the tofu a nice glaze). Stir until well mixed and remove from the heat.
a858453c-dfb8-4392-8499-3f9ec5257c0d
Toss in the coriander and serve hot.
dcab518d-adba-4de7-b1f6-80619cbebeba Make the manchurian balls: Heat oil for frying in a wok or fryer.
dcab518d-adba-4de7-b1f6-80619cbebeba Make the manchurian balls: Grate all of the veggies, including the onion, with a grater or better, in a food processor.
dcab518d-adba-4de7-b1f6-80619cbebeba Make the manchurian balls: Place the veggies and the rest of the ingredients in the bowl and mix until a ball formed with the veggies holds together. You don't want the balls to be doughy, but if absolutely necessary, add a little more flour if needed to bind.
dcab518d-adba-4de7-b1f6-80619cbebeba Make the manchurian balls: Shape the mixture into ¾-inch balls (you should get about 32) and flatten each slightly before adding to the hot oil. You can fry several at a time but don't overcrowd the pan.
dcab518d-adba-4de7-b1f6-80619cbebeba Make the manchurian balls: Turn the manchurian balls over as needed so they are golden-brown on both sides. Remove them to a dish lined with paper towels and set aside.
dcab518d-adba-4de7-b1f6-80619cbebeba Make the manchurian sauce: To make the sauce, place the wok on high heat and when it is very hot, pour the oil in along the sides of the pan.
dcab518d-adba-4de7-b1f6-80619cbebeba Make the manchurian sauce: Add the garlic and stir-fry for just 10 seconds or so, then immediately add in the bell peppers and onion. Saute just a minute, then add the sauces one by one in the center of the wok--the ketchup, tamari, chili sauce, vinegar, maple syrup and powdered ginger. Mix together quickly and then add four cups of water to the wok. Bring to a boil and taste the sauce. If needed, add salt.
dcab518d-adba-4de7-b1f6-80619cbebeba Make the manchurian sauce: Mix the cornstarch with 4 tbsp water and add a little at a time until the sauce thickens. You don't have to use all of it--stop when the sauce is thick enough for your liking. Cook the sauce until it comes to a boil and becomes glossy, 2-4 minutes. Add the manchurian balls. Turn off heat and season with scallions before serving.
dcab518d-adba-4de7-b1f6-80619cbebeba Make the manchurian sauce: Serve with fried rice.
6a8639b6-9a1b-4e0b-a99b-2f0b0d355272
You can either make the rice in the microwave or the stovetop. To make it in the microwave, place the drained rice in a microwave-safe bowl and add 3 cups water to it. Add salt and mix. Cook on high power for 9 minutes or until the rice is cooked about 90 percent--enough to mash it with some pressure, but not soft. Drain the rice thoroughly if there's any water remaining. To cook this on the stovetop, bring a large pot of salted water to boil, the way you would for pasta. Add the drained rice and cook about 8-9 minutes, again until the rice is about 90 percent done. Drain thoroughly.
6a8639b6-9a1b-4e0b-a99b-2f0b0d355272
Spread the rice on a baking sheet in as thin a layer as possible and set aside for at least 15-20 minutes or even more if possible. The rice should cool down thoroughly.
6a8639b6-9a1b-4e0b-a99b-2f0b0d355272
Heat the wok over very high heat--as high as your stove will go.
6a8639b6-9a1b-4e0b-a99b-2f0b0d355272
Pour in the vegetable oil along the sides of the pan so by the time it pools at the bottom it's already hot.
6a8639b6-9a1b-4e0b-a99b-2f0b0d355272
Immediately add the garlic, green chili peppers, the white part of the scallions, carrots and green bell peppers. Stir-fry rapidly for just about a minute, then add in the sauces--hot chili sauce, tamari, rice vinegar and liquid aminos. Mix them quickly and then add the rice.
6a8639b6-9a1b-4e0b-a99b-2f0b0d355272
Stir-fry the rice, with the wok still on high heat, for a couple of minutes, moving it constantly so every grain of rice has an opportunity to make contact with the hot surface of the wok several times. After two to three minutes, taste the rice and add ground black pepper and more salt if needed. Mix thoroughly, turn off the heat, garnish with the green parts of the scallions and serve hot.
e78280b9-ae79-45e2-a710-45c68a5fd155 Make the vegan egg: In a bowl, whisk together the chickpea flour with the water, turmeric, cayenne and salt until there are no lumps.
e78280b9-ae79-45e2-a710-45c68a5fd155 Make the vegan egg: Heat a non-stick or cast-iron wok or wide skillet. Coat the bottom with oil or cooking spray.
e78280b9-ae79-45e2-a710-45c68a5fd155 Make the vegan egg: When the pan is hot, pour in the chickpea mixture. Cook until brown spots appear, then flip with a wide spatula and cook the other side for 2-3 minutes more until set.
e78280b9-ae79-45e2-a710-45c68a5fd155 Make the vegan egg: Remove to a plate and set aside while you make the rice. When cool enough to handle, roll the omelet and cut into very thin strips.
e78280b9-ae79-45e2-a710-45c68a5fd155 Make the rice: Heat the oil in the same wok or skillet you made the omelet in. Add the garlic and green chilies and saute for a few seconds until the garlic gets fragrant.
e78280b9-ae79-45e2-a710-45c68a5fd155 Make the rice: Add the spring onions and saute for a minute, then add the rice.
e78280b9-ae79-45e2-a710-45c68a5fd155 Make the rice: Stir-fry for 3-4 minutes over high heat. Add salt, stir, and cover with a lid and let the rice cook for 2 minutes, no more.
e78280b9-ae79-45e2-a710-45c68a5fd155 Make the rice: Remove the lid and add the shredded vegan "egg." Mix well.
e78280b9-ae79-45e2-a710-45c68a5fd155 Make the rice: Serve hot with soy sauce and chilli vinegar on the side.
6b1a9631-cf07-488b-a5f5-d2b7b77f0510
