Cook the rice, like pasta, in a large pot of salted boiling water, until about 80 percent done. The grains should still be al dente. This will help keep your rice from turning into mush when you stir-fry it. Spread the rice on a baking sheet in a thin layer to help any additional moisture evaporate.
6b1a9631-cf07-488b-a5f5-d2b7b77f0510
Heat the oil in a large wok and add the chopped garlic to it while it's still cold. Cook the garlic, sauteing frequently, until it is golden brown and almost burnt. Remove three-fourths of the garlic from the oil using a slotted spoon and set aside.
6b1a9631-cf07-488b-a5f5-d2b7b77f0510
Add the green bell pepper to the hot oil along with the baked tofu cubes, if using, and saute for a couple of minutes. Add the red pepper flakes, then add the cooked, cooled rice along with the soy sauce and rice vinegar. Use more or less of the red pepper and vinegar, according to your taste.
6b1a9631-cf07-488b-a5f5-d2b7b77f0510
Stir-fry the rice in the wok over high heat, about five minutes. In the last couple of minutes of cooking, add the chopped spring onions and add salt if needed.
6b1a9631-cf07-488b-a5f5-d2b7b77f0510
Serve hot after sprinkling on the reserved garlic.
59992c1f-0529-4171-8db3-63ea10fbb72e Make the bhaji: Crush the ginger, garlic, cumin and green chile peppers into a paste using a mortar and pestle or a food processor.
59992c1f-0529-4171-8db3-63ea10fbb72e Make the bhaji: Heat the oil in a wide skillet or preferably a wok
59992c1f-0529-4171-8db3-63ea10fbb72e Make the bhaji: Add the onions and saute, until golden spots appear. Add the ginger-garlic paste and continue to saute another minute.
59992c1f-0529-4171-8db3-63ea10fbb72e Make the bhaji: Add the tomatoes and cook over high heat until they begin to darken. Add in the grated cauliflower, peas and bell peppers along with ½ cup water and salt. Cover and cook for five minutes or until the veggies are quite soft.
59992c1f-0529-4171-8db3-63ea10fbb72e Make the bhaji: Add in the boiled potatoes along with the pav bhaji masala, paprika if using, and about 1 ½ cups water or enough to make a thick, gravy-like consistency. You don't want the bhaji to be runny, but it should not be too dry either.
59992c1f-0529-4171-8db3-63ea10fbb72e Make the bhaji: Using a masher, mash down the veggies until most of them are broken down. After the bhaji comes to a boil, turn up the heat, and cook the veggies over high heat for five minutes, stirring constantly to ensure they don't stick. This helps roast some of the veggies and gives your pav bhaji an authentic flavor, much as something from the streets would taste. If the veggies get too dry at any point, add more water. Remember, you want a scoopable, sludgy consistency.
59992c1f-0529-4171-8db3-63ea10fbb72e Make the bhaji: You can add more pav bhaji masala if you like--go with your tastebuds, but remember it shouldn't be too strongly flavored. Add more salt if needed before turning off the heat.
59992c1f-0529-4171-8db3-63ea10fbb72e Make the pav: Mix the sugar, ½ cup warm water and the yeast in a mixing bowl and set aside for about 5minutes until the mixture starts to froth, indicating the yeast is alive and well.
59992c1f-0529-4171-8db3-63ea10fbb72e Make the pav: Sift the flour and baking soda into the bowl. Knead on low speed in a stand mixer or by hand for about 3 minutes, trickling in enough milk until you have a dough that’s smooth but slightly sticky (I needed ¾ to 1 cup of milk).
59992c1f-0529-4171-8db3-63ea10fbb72e Make the pav: Add the oil and continue to knead until the oil has been absorbed by the dough, about 1 more minute.
59992c1f-0529-4171-8db3-63ea10fbb72e Make the pav: Now place in an oiled bowl, turning over once to coat all over with oil, cover with a kitchen towel, and set aside for 2 hours until the dough has risen.
59992c1f-0529-4171-8db3-63ea10fbb72e Make the pav: Punch down the dough and divide into 12 balls
59992c1f-0529-4171-8db3-63ea10fbb72e Make the pav: Shape them into a slightly rectangular shape by pulling at the sides of the dough and tucking under on all four sides.
59992c1f-0529-4171-8db3-63ea10fbb72e Make the pav: Place the tolls in a rectangular 9 X 13 inch baking dish smeared with oil and lightly floured, or on a cookie sheet, close enough but not touching each other. Let the rolls rise for 30 minutes. They will join at the ends when they have risen.
59992c1f-0529-4171-8db3-63ea10fbb72e Make the pav: Preheat the oven to 370 degrees. Brush the tops of the pavs with the a mixture of 1 tsp oil and 1 tsp nondairy milk mixture which gives them a nice color on top.
59992c1f-0529-4171-8db3-63ea10fbb72e Make the pav: Bake 22 minutes. Then turn off the oven and let the pav stand inside for another 4 miuntes before removing it from the oven and allowing it to cool for 10 minutes on a rack.
59992c1f-0529-4171-8db3-63ea10fbb72e Serve the Pav Bhaji: The pav needs to be toasted before serving. To do this, heat a griddle. Slit the pav into two, then smear on some butter and, if you like, sprinkle on some paprika or pav bhaji masala directly on the pav. Place, crumb-side down, on the hot skillet and let the pav toast a minute or so until golden-brown.
59992c1f-0529-4171-8db3-63ea10fbb72e Serve the Pav Bhaji: Next ladle out the piping-hot bhaji on a plate or in a bowl. Add a square of vegan butter and then sprinkle the top with onions and cilantro and squeeze on some lemon juice. Serve with the toasted pav.
43743252-240f-4032-a802-cfd1f590b3a6 Make the ragda: Heat the oil in a skillet and add the ginger-garlic paste. Saute over medium-low heat for a few seconds until fragrant but not burnt, then add the green chili peppers, turmeric, chaat masala, if using, white peas and salt. Add about two cups of the cooking liquid from the white peas, or water.
43743252-240f-4032-a802-cfd1f590b3a6 Make the ragda: Stir together, then bring the sauce to a boil, turn down the heat, and simmer for 10 minutes until the gravy is still a little runny but quite thick. You can add more water if needed.
43743252-240f-4032-a802-cfd1f590b3a6 Make the ragda: Check salt, add more if needed, then turn off the heat.
43743252-240f-4032-a802-cfd1f590b3a6 Make the patties: Place the potatoes and other ingredients and form into 12 flat patties, about 2 ½ inches in diameter and a third of an inch thick.
43743252-240f-4032-a802-cfd1f590b3a6 Make the patties: Heat the skillet, pour enough oil to coat the bottom evenly. When hot, fry the patties in batches. Let each patty cook about 2-3 minutes on medium-high heat or until the surface is a rich golden-brown. Flip over and cook the other side.
43743252-240f-4032-a802-cfd1f590b3a6 Make the tamarind-date chutney: Place all ingredients for the chutney in a blender, add ½ cup water, salt if needed (you may not want it) and blend into a smooth and fairly runny paste, about the consistency of ketchup.
43743252-240f-4032-a802-cfd1f590b3a6 Make the mint chutney: Place all the ingredients into a blender with ½ cup water and salt and blend into a runny paste. This chutney will be more liquid than the tamarind-date chutney.
43743252-240f-4032-a802-cfd1f590b3a6 Put the final dish together: To build you plate of Ragda Pattice, ladle the ragda into a plate. Place two patties on it. Sprinkle on some more chaat masala, if you wish. Drizzle on the tamarind-date and mint chutneys followed by onions, cilantro, and finally the sev.
72e7f1a4-2250-4a18-ba99-a49c21240008 Make the filling: Puree the spinach with ½ cup water.
72e7f1a4-2250-4a18-ba99-a49c21240008 Make the filling: Heat the oil. Add the onions and garlic and saute until the onion softens. Add the tomatoes, cayenne and garam masala and cook until the tomatoes are very soft and pulpy.
72e7f1a4-2250-4a18-ba99-a49c21240008 Make the filling: Add the spinach puree and the marinated and baked tofu cubes. Add salt and cook over medium high heat until the sauce is very thick and coats the tofu. If there's too much liquid in your sauce it'll be difficult to put it in a wrap.
72e7f1a4-2250-4a18-ba99-a49c21240008 Make the filling: Turn off the heat and let stand while you prep the wraps.
72e7f1a4-2250-4a18-ba99-a49c21240008 Get the wraps ready: Make the tofu "egg" wash by placing the tofu in the blender with the nondairy milk and tapioca starch. Blend until very smooth, then pour into a large plate.
72e7f1a4-2250-4a18-ba99-a49c21240008 Get the wraps ready: Add enough oil to coat the bottom of a skillet that's large enough to hold the tortilla.
72e7f1a4-2250-4a18-ba99-a49c21240008 Get the wraps ready: Dip a tortilla into the "egg" wash and turn over to coat both sides with the wash.
72e7f1a4-2250-4a18-ba99-a49c21240008 Get the wraps ready: Place the tortilla into the hot skillet and let it cook until it is golden brown. Carefully turn over and cook the other side until golden brown.
72e7f1a4-2250-4a18-ba99-a49c21240008 Get the wraps ready: Remove the tortilla to a plate and place a fourth of the tofu filling inside it along with any of the other optional fillings. Bring in both ends of the tortilla, then roll into a tight wrap.
72e7f1a4-2250-4a18-ba99-a49c21240008 Get the wraps ready: Serve hot.
40b57682-0e57-41e7-aa0c-093badc3878e
Heat the oil. Add the coriander seeds, cumin seeds, cloves, cinnamon and peppercorns. Saute for a minute or two until the coriander is slightly darker and fragrant. Then the sliced onions and a pinch of salt and saute, stirring, about 2-3 minutes. Add the garlic and ginger and continue to saute.
40b57682-0e57-41e7-aa0c-093badc3878e
When the onions are beginning to get brown spots, remove the onions and spices to a blender.
40b57682-0e57-41e7-aa0c-093badc3878e
Add the coconut to the dry skillet and roast over a low heat until it starts to turn lightly golden. Add to the blender along with the tomatoes.
40b57682-0e57-41e7-aa0c-093badc3878e
Add enough water to make a smooth paste. Set aside.
40b57682-0e57-41e7-aa0c-093badc3878e
In a large saucepan, heat the other teaspoon of oil.
40b57682-0e57-41e7-aa0c-093badc3878e
Add the finely chopped onion and saute until it starts to brown. Add the turmeric and cayenne or paprika. Give everything a good stir.
40b57682-0e57-41e7-aa0c-093badc3878e
Add the ground masala and bring it to a boil. Let the masala cook five minutes on a simmer.
40b57682-0e57-41e7-aa0c-093badc3878e
Add the sprouts and stir them in.
40b57682-0e57-41e7-aa0c-093badc3878e
When the curry comes to a boil, lower the heat, cover, and let it simmer for about 20-30 minutes or until the beans are fully cooked but not mushy. Add salt to taste.
40b57682-0e57-41e7-aa0c-093badc3878e
Turn off the heat and serve hot with the toppings, sliced or quartered lemons on the side, and bread.
40b57682-0e57-41e7-aa0c-093badc3878e
Enjoy!
b71fd538-55b4-45a9-9a8e-a83339c075eb
Roast the chickpea flour lightly, stirring, until it smells fragrant, about 5 minutes on medium-low heat.
b71fd538-55b4-45a9-9a8e-a83339c075eb
Spray oil in a skillet. Add asafetida and sustard seeds. When the seeds sputter, add the onions. Saute until the onions turn translucent but before they start to color.
b71fd538-55b4-45a9-9a8e-a83339c075eb
Add the chilli powder, turmeric, spring onions and chopped green peppers. Saute for a few minutes until the vegetables start to soften.
b71fd538-55b4-45a9-9a8e-a83339c075eb
Add the chickpea flour and salt and stir in. Add 1 cup of water.
b71fd538-55b4-45a9-9a8e-a83339c075eb
Stir well, cover, and cook on medium-low heat about 7-8 minutes, stirring occasionally, until all the water has been absorbed.
b71fd538-55b4-45a9-9a8e-a83339c075eb
Turn off heat. Garnish with the garlic greens or coriander leaves. Serve hot with bhakri (recipe follows).
b71fd538-55b4-45a9-9a8e-a83339c075eb
Mix the flour and salt in a bowl. Add water, a little at a time, kneading the flour until the dough comes together in a ball.
b71fd538-55b4-45a9-9a8e-a83339c075eb
Pull off a lemon-size piece of the dough. Sprinkle the rolling surface liberally with all-purpose or wheat flour and roll out the bhakri carefully into a circle about 4-5 inches in diameter.
b71fd538-55b4-45a9-9a8e-a83339c075eb
These bhakris are extremely difficult to roll, so it might take some time to get it right. I sometimes substitute half the millet flour with regular whole-wheat flour which makes them easier to roll.
b71fd538-55b4-45a9-9a8e-a83339c075eb
Heat a cast-iron or other griddle. Place the bhakri on it and leave alone until the surface starts to turn opaque. Flip over. Smear a little oil over the bhakri. Cook both sides until golden-brown spots appear.
b71fd538-55b4-45a9-9a8e-a83339c075eb
Serve hot with the zunka, and some raw, chopped onions.
fdebb86e-465e-47e4-9abf-a9074b7b0765
Heat the oil and add the turmeric and the asafetida.
fdebb86e-465e-47e4-9abf-a9074b7b0765
Now add the ginger, garlic and chilli pastes and saute just a few seconds. Add the potatoes and salt, mix well, and take off the heat. Mix in the lemon juice.
fdebb86e-465e-47e4-9abf-a9074b7b0765
Allow the mixture to cool before you handle it.
fdebb86e-465e-47e4-9abf-a9074b7b0765
Take the chickpea-chilli mixture and add enough water to make a fairly thick batter, about the consistency of pancake batter.
fdebb86e-465e-47e4-9abf-a9074b7b0765
Make balls with the potato mixture, about 1 inch in diameter. Dunk one at a time into the chickpea batter. Turn to coat and then drop into the oil which should be at between 350 and 375 degrees.
fdebb86e-465e-47e4-9abf-a9074b7b0765
Fry the vadas on all sides until they turn reddish-brown. Don't overcrowd the pan. Remove to paper towels and drain.
fdebb86e-465e-47e4-9abf-a9074b7b0765
One by one roast half the garlic cloves and the rest of the ingredients except the tamarind and salt, allowing everything to turn lightly golden brown and putting each into a plate before moving on to the next ingredient. Be very careful roasting the coconut because it will brown very fast.
fdebb86e-465e-47e4-9abf-a9074b7b0765
Place all the ingredients including the unroasted garlic cloves, the tamarind, salt and 1 tbsp oil in a food processor.
fdebb86e-465e-47e4-9abf-a9074b7b0765
Process until everything breaks down into a coarse powder.
fdebb86e-465e-47e4-9abf-a9074b7b0765
Mix the sugar, ½ cup warm water and the yeast in a mixing bowl and set aside for about 10 minutes until the mixture starts to froth, indicating the yeast is alive and well.
fdebb86e-465e-47e4-9abf-a9074b7b0765
Sift all the flours and baking soda into the bowl. Knead on low speed in a stand mixer or by hand for about 3 minutes, trickling in 1 cup of water until you have a dough that's smooth but slightly sticky
fdebb86e-465e-47e4-9abf-a9074b7b0765
Add the oil and continue to knead until the oil has been absorbed by the dough, about 1 more minute.
fdebb86e-465e-47e4-9abf-a9074b7b0765
Now place in an oiled bowl, turning over once to coat all over with oil, cover with a kitchen towel, and set aside for 2 hours until the dough has risen.
fdebb86e-465e-47e4-9abf-a9074b7b0765
Punch down the dough and divide into 9 or 12 balls, depending on how large or small you want your pav.
fdebb86e-465e-47e4-9abf-a9074b7b0765
Shape them into a slightly rectangular shape by pulling at the sides of the dough and tucking under on all four sides.
fdebb86e-465e-47e4-9abf-a9074b7b0765
Place the tolls in a rectangular 9 X 13 inch baking dish smeared with oil and lightly floured, or on a cookie sheet, close enough but not touching each other. Let the rolls rise for an hour. They will join at the ends when they have risen, forming a slab, or laadi in Marathi
fdebb86e-465e-47e4-9abf-a9074b7b0765
Preheat the oven to 370 degrees. Place the pav in the oven and bake 23 minutes.
fdebb86e-465e-47e4-9abf-a9074b7b0765
Brush the tops with a little oil, if desired, for a pretty, glossy look.
fdebb86e-465e-47e4-9abf-a9074b7b0765
Remove to a rack and allow the rolls to cool before breaking them off.
3881ff03-57ce-4cf3-ac4c-181cf91407a4
Heat the oil in the wok.
3881ff03-57ce-4cf3-ac4c-181cf91407a4
Add the onions and, working constantly over the highest heat setting on your burner, stir-fry them until they start to just change color.
3881ff03-57ce-4cf3-ac4c-181cf91407a4
Add the ginger and green peppers and stir-fry for another couple of minutes or until the bell peppers begin to soften.
3881ff03-57ce-4cf3-ac4c-181cf91407a4
Add the cayenne, turmeric, and pav bhaji masala and stir well. Add the chopped tomatoes or tomato puree and cook, stirring frequently, about two minutes. Add the green peas and potatoes and stir-fry for a minute.
3881ff03-57ce-4cf3-ac4c-181cf91407a4
Add the rice and stir-fry, mixing everything thoroughly, another two to three minutes.
3881ff03-57ce-4cf3-ac4c-181cf91407a4
Turn off heat, add the lemon juice and garnish with coriander leaves or spring onions, or both.
3881ff03-57ce-4cf3-ac4c-181cf91407a4
Serve piping hot.
e552fea9-b9f0-4eac-9eed-9e7720beb548
After putting the pasta water to boil, place the cashews in a blender with ½ cup water and blend into a very smooth paste. Set aside.
e552fea9-b9f0-4eac-9eed-9e7720beb548
Place the tomatoes or puree in a blender along with the tomato paste, paprika, peppers and roasted cumin. Blend into a coarse paste.
e552fea9-b9f0-4eac-9eed-9e7720beb548
Heat the oil in a large wok or skillet. Working on a medium-high flame, add the garlic, stir-fry for a few seconds, then add the blended tomato masala and saute fora couple of minutes. Add the pasta, diced green bell peppers, oregano, vegetable oil, and the powdered spices--the masala magic and the curry powder. Season with salt and, if you like even more spice, some ground black pepper.
e552fea9-b9f0-4eac-9eed-9e7720beb548
Stir-fry the pasta, moving it constantly, to ensure the sauce cooks evenly and the pasta doesn't stick to the pan. You can do this for about five to 10 minutes.
e552fea9-b9f0-4eac-9eed-9e7720beb548
Finish off by adding half the cashew cream, and mixing the pasta one last time. Serve with more cashew cream drizzled on top. You can also garnish with scallions or with vegan cheese, like cashew parmesan (I'll link that recipe in the notes)
3890d98e-124a-4bb4-bead-3889da8d648c Make the bhatura dough: Place all the ingredients except the water in a food processor, bowl of a stand mixer, or, if kneading by hand, in a large bowl. Drizzle in the water and knead until you have an elastic but firm dough. Place in an airtight container and set it aside while you make the chana masala.
3890d98e-124a-4bb4-bead-3889da8d648c Make the chana masala: Heat the oil in a saucepan and add the whole spices -- the bay leaf, cardamom, cinnamon and cloves. Finally add the cumin and stir to mix. When the cumin sizzles, add the onions with some salt and cook until the onions turn golden-brown.
3890d98e-124a-4bb4-bead-3889da8d648c Make the chana masala: Add the ginger-garlic paste and saute for a minute.
3890d98e-124a-4bb4-bead-3889da8d648c Make the chana masala: Add the cayenne and turmeric, saute for another minute, then add the diced tomatoes. Mix well and let the tomatoes cook, stirring them frequently, until they are completely broken down and very pulpy.
3890d98e-124a-4bb4-bead-3889da8d648c Make the chana masala: Add the chickpeas along with 2 cups of water and stir well. Add the chana masala spice mix. and stir it in.
3890d98e-124a-4bb4-bead-3889da8d648c Make the chana masala: Bring to a boil, turn heat to low, cover and simmer about 15-20 minutes so all the flavors merge. You can use a potato masher to mash some of the chickpeas and thicken the sauce. If the chana masala looks too dry, add more water.
3890d98e-124a-4bb4-bead-3889da8d648c Make the chana masala: Squeeze in the lemon juice and garnish with coriander leaves, if using.
3890d98e-124a-4bb4-bead-3889da8d648c Make the bhatura: Heat oil for frying in a pan large enough to hold the bhatura. Divide the dough into 12 pieces and roll each into a ball. Roll out into a circle about six to eight inches in diameter. Make sure you roll the dough evenly, without any spots that are too thick or too thin.
3890d98e-124a-4bb4-bead-3889da8d648c Make the bhatura: When the oil is hot, about 360 degrees, place a bhatura into the pan, taking care not to splash the oil on yourself. Use a spatula to press the bhatura down as it puffs up -- this will ensure it cooks evenly and puffs into a ball.
3890d98e-124a-4bb4-bead-3889da8d648c Make the bhatura: Remove the bhatura to a colander lined with paper towels. Serve hot with the chana masala.
95da61d6-941d-4875-b969-17d337d69f74
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.
95da61d6-941d-4875-b969-17d337d69f74
In a bowl, toss the chickpeas with the oil, chaat masala, garam masala, cayenne or paprika, turmeric, and salt.
95da61d6-941d-4875-b969-17d337d69f74
Spread the chickpeas in a single layer on a baking sheet.
95da61d6-941d-4875-b969-17d337d69f74
Place the baking sheet in the oven and let the chickpeas roast 30-45 minutes, until they are crisp. Oven temperatures vary, so if they are not crispy at the end of 45 minutes, give them some more time.
95da61d6-941d-4875-b969-17d337d69f74
Remove the baking sheet from the oven, place it on a rack and let the chickpeas cool about 10-15 minutes.
95da61d6-941d-4875-b969-17d337d69f74
Toss the chickpeas with the spring onions, coriander leaves and lemon and sprinkle with some more chaat masala, if you wish. Some people add diced tomatoes, but I prefer not to because they tend to make the chickpeas soggy.
95da61d6-941d-4875-b969-17d337d69f74
Eat.
87a33a48-a08d-4633-ae22-55f93bd26299
Blend the cashews with the soaking water, cumin, green chili pepper, ginger, salt, and lime juice until you have a very smooth paste. This by itself makes a great dressing for any salad.
87a33a48-a08d-4633-ae22-55f93bd26299
Remove the cashew paste to a bowl and mix with the grated cucumber and onion, if using. Sprinkle on some cayenne, if you wish.
87a33a48-a08d-4633-ae22-55f93bd26299
Serve on the side with any spicy Indian dish like a biryani or a curry or a paratha.
1508406e-a441-42ec-aaaa-b2c8359adce5
In a skillet, heat the oil.
1508406e-a441-42ec-aaaa-b2c8359adce5
Add the mustard seeds and blackgram dal. When the seeds sputter and the dal turns
1508406e-a441-42ec-aaaa-b2c8359adce5
lightly golden, add the onions and green chilies and stir for a minute.
1508406e-a441-42ec-aaaa-b2c8359adce5
Add the tomatoes, the sambar powder, the turmeric, and the curry leaves.
1508406e-a441-42ec-aaaa-b2c8359adce5
Stir well. The tomatoes will almost immediately start expressing their juices. Allow them to cook on medium-low heat for as long as it takes for most--but not all-- of the juices to evaporate. The tomatoes should have broken down completely.
1508406e-a441-42ec-aaaa-b2c8359adce5
Add the jaggery and salt to taste. Cook for another minute, stirring.
1508406e-a441-42ec-aaaa-b2c8359adce5
Add the coriander and turn off the heat.
1508406e-a441-42ec-aaaa-b2c8359adce5
Enjoy hot with some chapatis or rotis or with sambar and rice.
7403ead1-470e-4015-b0f7-0c4f4101b05c
Heat 1 tsp of oil in a skillet. Add the shallots and the red chili peppers and a pinch of salt. Saute over medium-high heat, stirring frequently, until the onions are caramelized.
7403ead1-470e-4015-b0f7-0c4f4101b05c
Add the tamarind and continue to saute for another couple of minutes.
7403ead1-470e-4015-b0f7-0c4f4101b05c
Remove the onions to a blender and add ¼ cup of water and season with salt as needed. Blend into a smooth paste. If you need to add more water to blend, add no more than a teaspoon at a time. Remove the chutney to a bowl.
7403ead1-470e-4015-b0f7-0c4f4101b05c
In the same skillet used to caramelize the onions, add the remaining ½ tsp of oil. Add the mustard seeds and, when they sputter, add the udal dal and curry leaves. Stir-fry for a few more seconds until the dal turns lightly golden.
7403ead1-470e-4015-b0f7-0c4f4101b05c
Pour the mustard-udad dal mixture over the chutney and mix.
d41d7ee0-4a08-4f17-b678-aacac5a240da
Roast the peanuts in a small saucepan for 2-3 minutes or until the skins are slightly darker. Set aside.
d41d7ee0-4a08-4f17-b678-aacac5a240da
In the saucepan, add the oil, heat, and then add the onions with a pinch of salt.
d41d7ee0-4a08-4f17-b678-aacac5a240da
Cook until the onions are softened, about five minutes.
d41d7ee0-4a08-4f17-b678-aacac5a240da
Add the tomatoes, sugar, curry powder, paprika and cayenne. Cook, stirring frequently, until the tomatoes have reduced and are darker and most of the liquid is gone.
d41d7ee0-4a08-4f17-b678-aacac5a240da
Place the peanuts and red peppers with the tomatoes and onions in a food processor. Blend. I like my chutney quite smooth, but leave it a little coarse if you'd like texture.
d41d7ee0-4a08-4f17-b678-aacac5a240da
Serve with dosa or use as a dip. Perfect either way.
2281655a-eb9f-4c4f-810a-ef4598b86722
Place all the ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth and creamy.
2281655a-eb9f-4c4f-810a-ef4598b86722
Pour into tall glasses over ice.
2281655a-eb9f-4c4f-810a-ef4598b86722
Garnish with chopped pistachios or mint.
2281655a-eb9f-4c4f-810a-ef4598b86722
Yum.
3af89ed1-f3f4-4543-a7bd-5c0823fd1a33
In a small saucepan, bring the water, cardamom, ginger and sugar to a boil.
3af89ed1-f3f4-4543-a7bd-5c0823fd1a33
Add the tea leaves and continue at a rolling boil for at least two more minutes.
3af89ed1-f3f4-4543-a7bd-5c0823fd1a33
Turn off the heat and immediately add the soymilk or creamer at room temperature
3af89ed1-f3f4-4543-a7bd-5c0823fd1a33
Cover the saucepan, let everything steep together for a minute or two, then strain into little glass tumblers.
3af89ed1-f3f4-4543-a7bd-5c0823fd1a33
Serve hot with samosas, bhujias, or cookies.
85645340-515b-4b6e-b1e5-7d8c84a49ed0
Pressure cook the mangoes with two cups of water for up to five "whistles" or for 15 minutes in the Instant Pot. If you don't have either a pressure cooker or an Instant Pot, place the mangoes in a saucepan, cover with an inch of water, and bring to a boil. Cover the pot and let simmer over medium-low heat until a knife pierced near the center goes cleanly through.
85645340-515b-4b6e-b1e5-7d8c84a49ed0
When the mangoes are cool enough to handle, peel them and remove all the pulp to a blender. Discard the seeds and peels.
85645340-515b-4b6e-b1e5-7d8c84a49ed0
Add the sugar to the blender along with the cardamom powder and a dash of salt. A rule of thumb for the perfect sweetness is to use as much sugar as mango pulp, so be sure to measure your pulp. Blend into a very smooth paste. This is the concentrate. You can refrigerate this for 3-4 days or freeze for 2-3 months.
85645340-515b-4b6e-b1e5-7d8c84a49ed0
To serve the panna, measure out ¾ cup of the concentrate and stir in 2 ½ cups of ice-cold water. This makes enough for 3-4 servings.
85645340-515b-4b6e-b1e5-7d8c84a49ed0
You can crush some mint into the glass before serving, or add a dash of cayenne or roasted cumin. You can also serve with lime wedges. Or just serve plain. It's delicious.
a666672e-4b6f-4503-9b71-56fe55e11b30 Make the sugar syrup: Place the sugar and water in a saucepan and bring to a boil. Turn the heat to a simmer, add the cardamom and lemon juice, and let it cook for another five minutes. Turn off heat.
a666672e-4b6f-4503-9b71-56fe55e11b30 Make the gulab jamuns: Place the breadcrumbs in a bowl and mix in the cashew cream, a little at a time until you have a smooth, pliable dough that's not too stiff or dry.
a666672e-4b6f-4503-9b71-56fe55e11b30 Make the gulab jamuns: Divide into 14 equal sized pieces and roll each into a ball. You want a very smooth ball with no visible cracks on the surface. You can use some oil to grease your palms, which will help you shape the jamuns more easily.
a666672e-4b6f-4503-9b71-56fe55e11b30 Make the gulab jamuns: Heat oil in a wok or a fryer. You don't want to oil to be too hot, around 300 degrees is ideal. If the oil is too hot, the jamuns will brown very fast on the outside and not cook all the way through.
a666672e-4b6f-4503-9b71-56fe55e11b30 Make the gulab jamuns: Now place the jamuns, a few at a time so as to not clutter, into the fryer or wok. The oil should bubble only slightly. Don't let the jamuns settle at the bottom. Use your spider or a slotted ladle to keep moving them around until they become a deep, reddish color.
a666672e-4b6f-4503-9b71-56fe55e11b30 Make the gulab jamuns: Remove them to a plate lined with a paper towel. When the jamun is still warm but can be handled, use a very thin pin or needle to poke holes all around. This will help it better absorb the syrup.
a666672e-4b6f-4503-9b71-56fe55e11b30 Make the gulab jamuns: Place the jamuns inside the syrup while the syrup is still warm but not very hot. They should be completely immersed. Let them stand for 3 hours before serving, so they have enough time to soak up the syrup.
a666672e-4b6f-4503-9b71-56fe55e11b30 Make the gulab jamuns: Serve jamuns with a drizzle of the syrup and a sprinkling of nuts (optional).
b2859192-fb95-45bc-b602-66b7c594510e
Blend the cashews with 3 cups water into a very smooth milk/cream. If your blender isn't very powerful, soak the cashews in water for at least an hour first.
b2859192-fb95-45bc-b602-66b7c594510e
Heat 1 tbsp oil in a large pan, preferably nonstick. A wider pan will allow the liquid to thicken and evaporate more easily. Add the sliced almonds or any other nuts you are using. Saute them for a couple of minutes until they just begin to change color. Add the carrots and cardamom, saute a couple of minutes, then add the cashew milk. * (If using dates to sweeten, see notes below before adding all the milk).
b2859192-fb95-45bc-b602-66b7c594510e
Cook, stirring occasionally, over medium-low heat until most of the milk has been absorbed into the cashews. This will take at least 15-20 minutes. If it's going too slow, increase the heat a bit but keep an eye on the carrots and stir them often because you don't want them to stick to the bottom.
b2859192-fb95-45bc-b602-66b7c594510e
Add the sugar and the remaining 1 tbsp oil and stir until it's well mixed and the sugar has dissolved.
b2859192-fb95-45bc-b602-66b7c594510e
At this stage, you can pretty much decide how much longer you want your halwa to cook -- taking it off the heat at this point will give you a more pudding-like texture, but you can continue to cook longer until the halwa pulls off the bottom and sides of the pan and there's absolutely no visible liquid. I like to cook the halwa to this stage, but it means some exercise for your arm, so be warned.
b2859192-fb95-45bc-b602-66b7c594510e
Once the halwa reaches the desired state of doneness, take if off the heat. You can eat the halwa warm or at room temperature or cold, it's delicious every way. Garnish with sliced almonds before serving, if you wish.
4c90aefa-dd06-436e-bfe0-6c0c20117e19
Heat 1 tsp of oil in a large non-stick wok or wide saucepan. Add the grated carrots and a very small pinch of salt. Stir well and then cover with a tight lid that can hold some water on the top. This helps the carrots steam without burning and it also helps them cook faster. Let the carrots cook 15 minutes, stirring a couple of times to ensure they are not sticking to the bottom.
4c90aefa-dd06-436e-bfe0-6c0c20117e19
Blend the dates with 1 cup of almond milk and add to the carrots along with the almond flour. Add the cardamom and mix well. Cover again with a lid, again add some drops of water to the lid, and let the carrots cook for another 15 minutes, stirring a few times in between.
4c90aefa-dd06-436e-bfe0-6c0c20117e19
By this time the carrots should have absorbed all the almond milk and become fairly dry. If there's any visible liquid, cook uncovered for a few minutes until it reduces. Add the remaining 1 tsp of oil and stir the carrots well to mix. Cook, stirring frequently, uncovered, for another 10 minutes. The carrots should have a much darker hue by this time and should be very tender and without the earthy flavor.
4c90aefa-dd06-436e-bfe0-6c0c20117e19
Add the vanilla and the remaining 1 ½ cups of almond milk and cook until warmed through. If you like the pudding a little runnier, add more almond milk.
4c90aefa-dd06-436e-bfe0-6c0c20117e19
If using the garnish, coat the bottom of a small skillet with cooking spray and cook the cashews and raisins, until the raisins plump up and the cashews are slightly golden. Sprinkle over the pudding before serving
dbba9361-cf42-46e8-8af5-1eb4b73c5925
Soak the cashews in water for about 30 minutes, then drain
dbba9361-cf42-46e8-8af5-1eb4b73c5925
Add all of the ingredients to the blender and blend until very, very smooth.
dbba9361-cf42-46e8-8af5-1eb4b73c5925
Pour into popsicle molds, pierce each popsicle with a popsicle stick, and freeze.
dbba9361-cf42-46e8-8af5-1eb4b73c5925
To unmold, dip the popsicle mold in slightly warm water, pop out the popsicle, and enjoy.
e1e8d694-9988-4412-82d7-7816e2a069ca
The day before you want to make the Phirni, place the almonds in a bowl and pour over enough boiling water to cover the almonds. Set aside overnight.
e1e8d694-9988-4412-82d7-7816e2a069ca
Next day, peel the almonds and discard the skins.
e1e8d694-9988-4412-82d7-7816e2a069ca
Place the almonds in a blender with 4 cups of water and blend into a very smooth milk. Pour through a sieve to catch any large bits that might have remained, or any pieces of skin.
e1e8d694-9988-4412-82d7-7816e2a069ca
In a heavy-bottomed saucepan, bring all but ¼th of a cup of the almond milk to a boil.
e1e8d694-9988-4412-82d7-7816e2a069ca
Add the sugar and cook, stirring frequently, over medium-low heat until the milk starts to thicken, about 15 minutes.
e1e8d694-9988-4412-82d7-7816e2a069ca
Drain the rice that's soaking and grind with with the reserved ¼th cup of almond milk.
e1e8d694-9988-4412-82d7-7816e2a069ca
Add the rice paste to the almond milk and continue to cook, stirring, for another 15-20 minutes. You want to feel the pudding thickening as time goes by.
e1e8d694-9988-4412-82d7-7816e2a069ca
Cover the phirni with a tight-fitting lid and let the mixture cook another five minutes.
e1e8d694-9988-4412-82d7-7816e2a069ca
Remove the lid, add the cardamom, rose water and cashew nuts,and cook for another five minutes. Turn off the heat and pour it into individual serving dishes or bowls.
e1e8d694-9988-4412-82d7-7816e2a069ca
Garnish with chopped strawberries or nuts. The slight tartness of the strawberries is a perfect flavor pairing with the sweet Phirni. You can also add saffron-- soak a generous pinch in 1 tbsp almond milk and add along with the cardamom and cashew nuts.
e1e8d694-9988-4412-82d7-7816e2a069ca
Refrigerate the Phirni until thoroughly chilled.
b49368f4-a69c-43e8-af83-80fc2b62a0fa
Place the water and sugar in a heavy-bottomed wok or skillet (non-stick works best for this). Add the cardamom and let it come to a boil.
b49368f4-a69c-43e8-af83-80fc2b62a0fa
Turn the heat to low or medium-low. Add the cashew flour and almond flour and mix. Continue stirring at very frequent intervals, making sure your flour is not sticking to the bottom. If it is, scrape it up rightaway.
b49368f4-a69c-43e8-af83-80fc2b62a0fa
Within a few minutes, the mixture will begin to pull off the sides and bottom of the pan. Add the coconut oil at this point. The mixture will be quite translucent and sticky at this stage, which will make stirring it a bit of a pain, but persist. Since stoves vary, you might want to turn up your heat just a teeny bit if this is taking too long, but around 12-15 minutes after you began cooking, the mixture should turn opaque and dry (meaning it won't be sticky anymore). If you make a ball, it should hold together. Turn off the heat at this point and remove the mixture to a bowl.
b49368f4-a69c-43e8-af83-80fc2b62a0fa
As soon as you can handle the dough, knead it into a smooth ball. I like kneading in a little cashew cream into the mixture at this time because it just makes the barfi softer, which I love. You can skip this step.
b49368f4-a69c-43e8-af83-80fc2b62a0fa
Lay a piece of parchment paper on a baking sheet or a flat baking pan. Pat out the barfi mixture on it in an even layer, about six inches square (or thinner, if you want thinner barfis). Press the sides to make them as even as possible.
b49368f4-a69c-43e8-af83-80fc2b62a0fa
Press some nuts for garnish on the top and let the barfi cool completely. When cool, cut the barfi into pieces. The barfi will store in the refrigerator for at least a week.
